original: de'i phyir / mig ni gzugs thams cad dmigs pa la thun mong gi rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / mig ni gzugs thams cad dmigs pa la thun mong gi rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says, ‚Äúbecause the eye is the common cause of the object of observation of all forms.‚Äù

original: mig ni sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i gzugs thams cad kyi dmigs pa la thun mong gi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig ni sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i gzugs thams cad kyi dmigs pa la thun mong gi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The eye is the common cause of the object of observation of all forms such as blue, yellow, and so on.

original: dmigs pa de dag gsal ba dang mi gsal ba nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa de dag gsal ba dang mi gsal ba nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ste /
translated: The object of observation is clear and unclear, and so on.

original: 'di ltar dmigs pa ni mig la sogs pa gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i rjes su byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar dmigs pa ni mig la sogs pa gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i rjes su byed pa yin te /
translated: Thus, the object of observation is the cause of the clarity and unclarity of the eye and so on.

original: khams kyi mdzod kyi gnas nas ji skad bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: khams kyi mdzod kyi gnas nas ji skad bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: This is as explained in the chapter on the elements in the Abhidharma-ko≈õa.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni tshor ba 'khrugs pa dang / ma 'khrugs pa'i rjes su byed pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni tshor ba 'khrugs pa dang / ma 'khrugs pa'i rjes su byed pa gzung ngo //
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù include the cause of the disturbance and non-disturbance of feeling.

original: de las bzlog pa'i phyir gzugs ni ma yin te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa'i phyir gzugs ni ma yin te zhes bya ba la /
translated: Form is not like that because it is the opposite of that.

original: gzugs sngon po ni @105b gzugs so sor nges pa dmigs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir mig ltar gzugs thams cad dmigs pa'i bya ba thun mong gi rgyu ma yin la /
analyzed: gzugs sngon po ni @105b gzugs so sor nges pa dmigs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir mig ltar gzugs thams cad dmigs pa'i bya ba thun mong gi rgyu ma yin la /
translated: Blue form is not the common cause of the activity of perceiving all form, like the eye, because it is the cause of the perception of the particularity of form.

original: dmigs pa de gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i rjes su byed pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa de gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i rjes su byed pa yang ma yin no //
translated: And it does not conform to the clarity or unclarity of that perception.

original: de'i phyir gzugs ni gzugs kyi dmigs pa la lhag par dbang byed pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs ni gzugs kyi dmigs pa la lhag par dbang byed pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Therefore form is not the dominant condition of the object of form.

original: yid chos rnams la dbang byed pa'i bar du yang de bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: yid chos rnams la dbang byed pa'i bar du yang de bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The same should be applied up to the mental faculty being the dominant condition of mental objects.

original: lus kyi dbang po kho na las zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: lus kyi dbang po kho na las zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ste /
translated: The body faculty is the dominant condition of tactile objects.

original: reg bya'i yul can yin pa'i phyir lus kyi dbang po las gzhan ma yin zhes bya bar shes so //
analyzed: reg bya'i yul can yin pa'i phyir lus kyi dbang po las gzhan ma yin zhes bya bar shes so //
translated: It is not different from the body faculty because it is the object of tactile objects.

original: gzhan nyid yin na ni mig la sogs pa bzhin du reg bya'i yul can du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan nyid yin na ni mig la sogs pa bzhin du reg bya'i yul can du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were different, it would not be the object of tactile objects like the eye faculty and so on.

original: lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir yang lus kyi dbang po las gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir yang lus kyi dbang po las gzhan ma yin te /
translated: It is also not different from the body faculty because it is the basis of body consciousness.

original: gzhan nyid yin na ni mig la sogs pa ltar lus kyi dbang po rnam par shes pa'i rten du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan nyid yin na ni mig la sogs pa ltar lus kyi dbang po rnam par shes pa'i rten du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were different, it would not be the basis of the body consciousness, like the eye, etc.

original: de'i phyir 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lus kyi dbang po'i phyogs yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lus kyi dbang po'i phyogs yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is the part of the body faculty that operates in the realm of desire.

original: 'dod chags dang lhan cig skyes pa'i lus kyi rnam par shes pa nyon mongs pa can kho na'i rten du gyur pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang lhan cig skyes pa'i lus kyi rnam par shes pa nyon mongs pa can kho na'i rten du gyur pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the basis of only the afflicted body consciousness that arises simultaneously with attachment.

original: mo nyid la dbang byed pa'i phyir dang / pho nyid la dbang byed pa'i phyir na mo'i dbang po dang / pho'i dbang po rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: mo nyid la dbang byed pa'i phyir dang / pho nyid la dbang byed pa'i phyir na mo'i dbang po dang / pho'i dbang po rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The female faculty and the male faculty are posited because of their control over femininity and masculinity.

original: mo nyid ni mo'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: mo nyid ni mo'i dbang po'o //
translated: Femininity is the female faculty.

original: gsum pa la yang ngo bo zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gsum pa la yang ngo bo zhes bya ste /
translated: The third is also called the nature.

original: de'i phyir bud med kyi cha byad dang zhes bya ba smos so ;
analyzed: de'i phyir bud med kyi cha byad dang zhes bya ba smos so ;
translated: Therefore, it says, ‚Äúthe form of a woman,‚Äù

original: / kha cig cha byad kyang don gzhan yin par sems pa de'i phyir nga ro dang / g-yo ba dang / bsam pa dag ste zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: / kha cig cha byad kyang don gzhan yin par sems pa de'i phyir nga ro dang / g-yo ba dang / bsam pa dag ste zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: because some think that the form is a different object. Therefore, it says, ‚Äúvoice, movement, and thoughts.‚Äù

original: 'di nyid rnam par dpyad par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di nyid rnam par dpyad par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to analyze this, he says:

original: de ni mo'i mo nyid yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de ni mo'i mo nyid yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: That is the nature of femininity.

original: ji ltar kha cig rtogs par byed pa ltar bud med kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i mtshan nyid can gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar kha cig rtogs par byed pa ltar bud med kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i mtshan nyid can gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not something else that is the characteristic of the life-stream of a woman, as some imagine.üîΩThe nature of masculinity is the form of a man, etc.

original: pho'i ngo bo nyid ni pho'i cha byad dang zhes bya ba 'di ltar yang bshad zin pa'i rjes su 'brangs te brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: pho'i ngo bo nyid ni pho'i cha byad dang zhes bya ba 'di ltar yang bshad zin pa'i rjes su 'brangs te brjod par bya'o //
translated: This should be stated in the same way as the previous explanation.

original: de la bud med kyi bsam pa ni skyes pa'i yul can te /
analyzed: de la bud med kyi bsam pa ni skyes pa'i yul can te /
translated: The thought of a woman has a man as its object,

original: bud med ni skyes pa'i bsam pa can no zhes bya ba 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bud med ni skyes pa'i bsam pa can no zhes bya ba 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is said, ‚ÄúA woman has the thought of a man.‚Äù

original: pho'i bsam pa ni bud med kyi yul can te /
analyzed: pho'i bsam pa ni bud med kyi yul can te /
translated: The thought of a man has a woman as its object,

original: skyes pa dag la ni bud med kyi yul can yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes pa dag la ni bud med kyi yul can yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is said, ‚ÄúMen have the thought of a woman.‚Äù

original: pho dang mo gnyis kyi nga ro yang tha dad de /
analyzed: pho dang mo gnyis kyi nga ro yang tha dad de /
translated: The voices of men and women are also different.

original: 'di ltar ma mthong bar pho'am mor skad kyis shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar ma mthong bar pho'am mor skad kyis shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, one can know whether it is a man or a woman by his or her voice, even if he or she is not seen.

original: g-yo ba 'gros la sogs pa yang pho dang mo rnams la phan tshun mtshan nyid mi mthun par dmigs so //
analyzed: g-yo ba 'gros la sogs pa yang pho dang mo rnams la phan tshun mtshan nyid mi mthun par dmigs so //
translated: The movements of the body, such as walking, are also observed to be different in men and women.üîΩ

original: srog gi dbang po ni ris mthun par gnas par bya @106a * //üîΩba la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste gnas pa ni 'dir rgyun du rjes su 'jug pa ste /üîΩ'dir gzugs kyi khams na dge ba dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi sems dang ldan pa rnams kyang srog gi dbang po'i mthus ris mthun par rjes su 'jug la /
analyzed: srog gi dbang po ni ris mthun par gnas par bya @106a * // ba la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste gnas pa ni 'dir rgyun du rjes su 'jug pa ste / 'dir gzugs kyi khams na dge ba dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi sems dang ldan pa rnams kyang srog gi dbang po'i mthus ris mthun par rjes su 'jug la /
translated: The vital organ is the support of heat and consciousness.üîΩThe vital organ is the support of heat and consciousness in sentient beings born in the realm of fine-materiality.üîΩThe vital organ is the support of heat and consciousness in sentient beings born in the realm of fine-materiality.üîΩThe vital organ is the support of heat and consciousness in sentient beings born in the realm of fine-materiality.

original: srog gi dbang po 'gags na 'gag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srog gi dbang po 'gags na 'gag par 'gyur ro //
translated: The vital organ is the support of heat and consciousness in sentient beings born in the realm of fine-materiality.üîΩThe vital organ is the support of heat and consciousness in sentient beings born in the realm of fine-materiality.üîΩThe vital organ is the support of heat and consciousness in sentient beings born in the realm of fine-materiality.üîΩThe vital organ is the support of heat and consciousness in sentient beings born in the realm of fine-materiality.üîΩThe vital organ is the support of heat and consciousness in sentient beings born in the realm of fine-materiality.üîΩThe vital organ is the support of heat and consciousness in sentient beings born in the realm of fine-materiality.üîΩThe vital organ is the support of heat and consciousness in sentient beings born in the realm of fine-materiality.üîΩThe vital organ is the support of heat and consciousness in sentient beings born in the realm of fine-materiality.

original: gal te ; 'gro ba zas kyis gnas pa yin //üîΩzhes bya bas zas dag kyang dbang po nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /üîΩma yin te /üîΩmed kyang gnas pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gal te ; 'gro ba zas kyis gnas pa yin // zhes bya bas zas dag kyang dbang po nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na / ma yin te / med kyang gnas pa'i phyir te /
translated: The vital organ is the support of heat and consciousness in sentient beings born in the realm of fine-materiality.üîΩThe vital organ is the support of heat and consciousness in sentient beings born in the realm of fine-materiality.üîΩThe vital organ is the support of heat and consciousness in sentient beings born in the realm of fine-materiality.üîΩThe vital organ is the support of heat and consciousness in sentient beings born in the realm of fine-materiality.üîΩThe vital organ is the support of heat and consciousness in sentient beings born in the realm of fine-materiality.üîΩThe vital organ is the support of heat and consciousness in sentient beings born in the realm of fine-materiality.üîΩThe vital organ is the support of heat and consciousness in sentient beings born in the realm of fine-materiality.üîΩThe vital organ is the support of heat and consciousness in sentient beings born in the realm of fine-materiality.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med par skyes pa rnams ni kham gyi zas med kyang ris mthun par rjes su 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med par skyes pa rnams ni kham gyi zas med kyang ris mthun par rjes su 'jug pa yin no //
translated: The vital organ is the support of heat and consciousness in sentient beings born in the realm of fine-materiality.üîΩThe vital organ is the support of heat and consciousness in sentient beings born in the realm of fine-

original: de bzhin du 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par zhugs pa rnams dang / 'du shes med pa la mngon du gyur pa la reg pa dang / sems pa dang / rnam par shes pa med kyang ris mthun par rjes su 'jug pa mthong zhing /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par zhugs pa rnams dang / 'du shes med pa la mngon du gyur pa la reg pa dang / sems pa dang / rnam par shes pa med kyang ris mthun par rjes su 'jug pa mthong zhing /
translated: So too, it is seen that those who enter meditative attainment in the meditative attainment of cessation and the meditative attainment of nonperception, and those who make contact with the state of nonperception,

original: srog gi dbang po med par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: srog gi dbang po med par ni ma yin no //
translated: do not have mind, but they are not without the faculty of life force.

original: de'i phyir ris mthun par gnas pa la dbang byed pa'i phyir na srog gi dbang po kho na dbang po nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir ris mthun par gnas pa la dbang byed pa'i phyir na srog gi dbang po kho na dbang po nyid yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, because it controls remaining in a class affiliate, only the faculty of life force is a faculty,

original: zas rnams ni ma yin no //
analyzed: zas rnams ni ma yin no //
translated: but food is not.

original: tshor ba rnams ni kun nas nyon mongs par bya ba la dbang byed do zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: tshor ba rnams ni kun nas nyon mongs par bya ba la dbang byed do zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: The feeling faculties control the process of affliction.

original: bshad pa / snga ma la khyad par ci yod ce na /
analyzed: bshad pa / snga ma la khyad par ci yod ce na /
translated: Objection: What is the difference between this and the previous explanation?

original: bde ba la sogs pa ni rnam par byang ba la yang dbang byed do zhes bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa ni rnam par byang ba la yang dbang byed do zhes bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Reply: In order to clarify that pleasure and so on also control purification.

original: lhag par dbang byed pa nyid ni dbang byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: lhag par dbang byed pa nyid ni dbang byed pa yin gyi /
translated: The faculty of mastery is the faculty of mastery itself,

original: rgyu tsam ni ma yin la /
analyzed: rgyu tsam ni ma yin la /
translated: not just the cause of mastery.

original: tshor ba rnams kyang kun nas nyon mongs pa la lhag par dbang byed kyi /
analyzed: tshor ba rnams kyang kun nas nyon mongs pa la lhag par dbang byed kyi /
translated: Also, the feelings are the faculty of mastery in the complete affliction of beings,

original: rnam par byang bar bya ba la ni ma yin pas /
analyzed: rnam par byang bar bya ba la ni ma yin pas /
translated: but not in their complete purification.

original: de dag ni kun nas nyon mongs pa kho na la dbang byed do //
analyzed: de dag ni kun nas nyon mongs pa kho na la dbang byed do //
translated: Therefore, they are the faculty of mastery in complete affliction alone.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that,

original: 'di ltar mdo las tshor ba bde ba la ni 'dod chags rgyas par 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di ltar mdo las tshor ba bde ba la ni 'dod chags rgyas par 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: the root text says, ‚ÄúBecause it is said in the sutras that desire increases due to pleasant feeling,‚Äù and so on.

original: dmigs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: [The feelings are the faculty of mastery] in terms of the object and in terms of being concomitant.

original: dad pa la sogs pa dbang po lnga dag ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa dbang po lnga dag ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: The five faculties of faith and so on

original: 'dis rnam par byang bar byed pas na rnam par byang ba ste lam mo //
analyzed: 'dis rnam par byang bar byed pas na rnam par byang ba ste lam mo //
translated: are the faculty of complete purification because they cause complete purification.

original: de nyid la rgyu smras pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid la rgyu smras pa ni /
translated: The cause of that is stated:

original: 'di ltar de dag gis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag gis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause it is said that they increase due to that.‚Äù

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang dro bar gyur pa'i gnas skabs dag gis lam skye ba'i gegs su gyur pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyang rnam par gnon la /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang dro bar gyur pa'i gnas skabs dag gis lam skye ba'i gegs su gyur pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyang rnam par gnon la /
translated: The stages of heat and peak suppress the afflictions that obstruct the arising of the path.

original: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu med par de'i stobs @106b kyis lam bskyed pa'i phyir chos mchog gi gnas skabs dag gis ni lam yang 'dren par byed do //
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu med par de'i stobs @106b kyis lam bskyed pa'i phyir chos mchog gi gnas skabs dag gis ni lam yang 'dren par byed do //
translated: The stages of poised readiness and the supreme mundane state induce the path because the path arises by the power of those stages without a homogeneous cause.

original: de dag kho na rnam par byang ba la dbang byed kyi /
analyzed: de dag kho na rnam par byang ba la dbang byed kyi /
translated: They are called faculties because they control purification.

original: rnam par byang ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po la sogs pa dag ni ma yin no zhes nges par bya ba'i phyir yang smos so //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po la sogs pa dag ni ma yin no zhes nges par bya ba'i phyir yang smos so //
translated: They are also called faculties because they are the nature of purification.üîΩThe term ‚Äúsuch‚Äù refers to the faculties from the eye faculty to the male and female faculties.

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba'i sgra ni ji ltar mig la sogs pa dad pa la sogs pa'i mthar thug pa rnams so sor dbang po yin pa de bzhin du kun shes par byed pa zhes bya ba dang / kun shes pa zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba'i sgra ni ji ltar mig la sogs pa dad pa la sogs pa'i mthar thug pa rnams so sor dbang po yin pa de bzhin du kun shes par byed pa zhes bya ba dang / kun shes pa zhes bya ba dang /
translated: Just as the eye faculty and so on are faculties, so too the faculty producing complete knowledge, the faculty of complete knowledge and the faculty of one definitely destined to enlightenment are also faculties.

original: kun shes ldan pa zhes bya ba yang so sor dbang po yin no zhes nye bar bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun shes ldan pa zhes bya ba yang so sor dbang po yin no zhes nye bar bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The term ‚Äúendowed with complete knowledge‚Äù is taught to be a faculty because it is a distinct faculty.

original: gal te dbang byed pa tha dad pa nyid kyis so sor dbang po nyid du shes pa yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dbang byed pa tha dad pa nyid kyis so sor dbang po nyid du shes pa yin nam zhe na /
translated: If it is known to be a distinct faculty because it has a distinct controlling power,

original: rdzas tha mi dad pas the tshom za ba bsal bar bya ba'i phyir de bzhin zhes bya ba'i sgra rab tu sbyar ro //
analyzed: rdzas tha mi dad pas the tshom za ba bsal bar bya ba'i phyir de bzhin zhes bya ba'i sgra rab tu sbyar ro //
translated: the term ‚Äúthus‚Äù is applied to eliminate doubt that it is not a distinct substance.üîΩThe faculty of producing complete knowledge is the controlling power for obtaining the faculty of complete knowledge.

original: de la kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po ni kun shes pa'i dbang po thob par bya ba la dbang byed do zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa'i lam ni mthong ba'i lam sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: de la kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po ni kun shes pa'i dbang po thob par bya ba la dbang byed do zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa'i lam ni mthong ba'i lam sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: The path of meditation is preceded by the path of seeing,

original: de dag kyang mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam la rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam la rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and they are established on the paths of seeing and meditation.

original: kun shes pa'i dbang po ni kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang thob par bya ba la dbang byed de mi slob pa'i lam bsgom pa'i lam sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun shes pa'i dbang po ni kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang thob par bya ba la dbang byed de mi slob pa'i lam bsgom pa'i lam sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The faculty of final and perfect knowledge controls the attainment of the faculty of having final and perfect knowledge, because it is preceded by the path of cultivation of the adept.

original: kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa la dbang byed de /
analyzed: kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa la dbang byed de /
translated: The faculty of having final and perfect knowledge controls complete nirvana.

original: lam gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lam gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no other path.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni 'dir phung po lhag ma med pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni 'dir phung po lhag ma med pa'o //
translated: Here, nirvana is the absence of the remaining aggregates.

original: ci dbang po dang po gnyis la mya ngan las 'das pa la dbang byed pa med dam zhe na /
analyzed: ci dbang po dang po gnyis la mya ngan las 'das pa la dbang byed pa med dam zhe na /
translated: Do the first two faculties not control nirvana?

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,

original: sems rnam par ma grol ba la yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: sems rnam par ma grol ba la yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: it is said: because there is no complete nirvana for one whose mind is not liberated.

original: sems rnam par grol ba ni zad pa shes pa yin la /
analyzed: sems rnam par grol ba ni zad pa shes pa yin la /
translated: The mind is liberated through the knowledge of destruction.

original: de dang de'i 'og rol gyi zag pa med pa'i la ma thams cad ni kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po yin te /
analyzed: de dang de'i 'og rol gyi zag pa med pa'i la ma thams cad ni kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po yin te /
translated: All the other uncontaminated faculties, from that knowledge of destruction up to the last moment of an arhat, are the faculty of having final and perfect knowledge.

original: de'i phyir kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa la dbang byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa la dbang byed do //
translated: Therefore the faculty of possessing complete knowledge controls complete nirvana.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rnam grangs gzhan bstan par bya ba'i phyir te zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rnam grangs gzhan bstan par bya ba'i phyir te zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù is stated to indicate other synonyms.

original: dbang po dang po gnyis ni mthong ba dang bsgom pas bsdus pas go rims bzhin du mthong ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spong ba la dbang byed pa nyid do //üîΩgal te sbyor ba dang / rnam @107a * //
analyzed: dbang po dang po gnyis ni mthong ba dang bsgom pas bsdus pas go rims bzhin du mthong ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spong ba la dbang byed pa nyid do // gal te sbyor ba dang / rnam @107a * //
translated: The first two faculties are subsumed by the paths of seeing and meditation, respectively, and they control the abandonment of afflictions to be abandoned by the paths of seeing and meditation.üîΩIf they are not controlling faculties because the paths of preparation, liberation, and distinction are not antidotes,

original: par grol ba dang / khyad par gyi lam rnams gnyen po ma yin pa'i phyir de dag nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: par grol ba dang / khyad par gyi lam rnams gnyen po ma yin pa'i phyir de dag nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then they are not controlling faculties.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: de rnams kyang de dag dang rigs mthun pa'i phyir mi skye ba'i chos can gyi dbang po bzhin no //
analyzed: de rnams kyang de dag dang rigs mthun pa'i phyir mi skye ba'i chos can gyi dbang po bzhin no //
translated: because they are similar in type to those that are controlling faculties, like the faculty of possessing complete knowledge that is not subject to arising.

original: mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa'i phyir dbang byed de zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa'i phyir dbang byed de zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is the controlling power with regard to abiding happily in this life.

original: mthong ba'i chos ni mthong ba'i chos te /
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos ni mthong ba'i chos te /
translated: This life is the present life.

original: skye ba mngon sum pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skye ba mngon sum pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is directly perceived.

original: bde bar gnas pa ni bde bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: bde bar gnas pa ni bde bar gnas pa'o //
translated: Abiding happily is abiding happily.

original: mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa ni mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa ste /
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa ni mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa ste /
translated: Abiding happily in this life is abiding happily in this life.

original: de la kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po dbang byed do //
analyzed: de la kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po dbang byed do //
translated: The faculty of final and perfect knowledge is the controlling power with regard to that.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How is it the controlling power?

original: de'i phyir rnam par grol bas dga' ba dang / bde ba dang / so sor yang dag par myong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par grol bas dga' ba dang / bde ba dang / so sor yang dag par myong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúbecause of experiencing joy, happiness, and right action through liberation.‚Äù

original: rnam par grol ba ni nyon mongs pa spangs pa'o //üîΩdga' ba ni yid bde ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba ni nyon mongs pa spangs pa'o // dga' ba ni yid bde ba'o //
translated: Liberation is the abandonment of the defilements.üîΩJoy is mental satisfaction.

original: bde ba ni shin tu sbyangs pa'i bde ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba ni shin tu sbyangs pa'i bde ba'o //
translated: Happiness is the happiness of pliancy.

original: rnam par grol bas dga' ba dang bde ba so sor yang dag par myong ba ni rnam par grol bas dga' ba dang bde ba so sor yang dag par myong ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol bas dga' ba dang bde ba so sor yang dag par myong ba ni rnam par grol bas dga' ba dang bde ba so sor yang dag par myong ba'o //
translated: The experience of joy and pleasure born of liberation is the experience of joy and pleasure born of liberation.

original: dbang byed pa'i phyir dbang po nyid yin na go //
analyzed: dbang byed pa'i phyir dbang po nyid yin na go //
translated: If it is asked what is the reason for calling them faculties, it is because they exercise controlling power.

original: ma rig pa la sogs pas kha bskang dgos te /
analyzed: ma rig pa la sogs pas kha bskang dgos te /
translated: The root text should be supplemented with ignorance and so on.

original: ci zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: bya dgos so zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: bya dgos so zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: It is what should be done, which is the remainder of the sentence.

original: nye bar kha skong ba ni kha skong ba'o //
analyzed: nye bar kha skong ba ni kha skong ba'o //
translated: Supplementation is the addition.

original: mtshan nyid kyis brjod pa 'thob pa ma brjod pa smra ba na kha skong ba'o ;
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyis brjod pa 'thob pa ma brjod pa smra ba na kha skong ba'o ;
translated: When the expression of the characteristics is obtained, the unexpressed is spoken of as supplementation.

original: / sogs pa smos pas ni 'du byed la sogs pa sdud do //
analyzed: / sogs pa smos pas ni 'du byed la sogs pa sdud do //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes formations and so on.

original: ngag la sogs pa dag dang / lag pa dang / rkang pa dang / rkub dang / mdoms kyang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ngag la sogs pa dag dang / lag pa dang / rkang pa dang / rkub dang / mdoms kyang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Speech and so on, hands, feet, anus, and genitals.

original: grangs can pa dag ni ngag gi dbang po la sogs pa rnams mig la sogs pa'i dbang po tha dad par rtogs par byed de dag gi dbang po ni gang gis tshig smra ba'o //
analyzed: grangs can pa dag ni ngag gi dbang po la sogs pa rnams mig la sogs pa'i dbang po tha dad par rtogs par byed de dag gi dbang po ni gang gis tshig smra ba'o //
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhyas understand the faculties of speech, etc., to be different from the eye faculty, etc. Their faculty is that by which one speaks words.

original: lag pa'i dbang po ni gang gis rdzas 'ga' zhig len pa'o //
analyzed: lag pa'i dbang po ni gang gis rdzas 'ga' zhig len pa'o //
translated: The faculty of the hand is that by which one grasps some substance.

original: rkang pa'i dbang po ni gang gis 'gro bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: rkang pa'i dbang po ni gang gis 'gro bar byed pa ste /
translated: The faculty of the foot is that by which one goes.

original: 'chag ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'chag ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúgoes‚Äù is ‚Äúwalks.‚Äù

original: rkub kyi dbang po ni gang gis rtug pa rtug par byed pa'o //üîΩmdoms kyi dbang po ni lus kyi dbang po'i phyogs las tha dad pa ste /
analyzed: rkub kyi dbang po ni gang gis rtug pa rtug par byed pa'o // mdoms kyi dbang po ni lus kyi dbang po'i phyogs las tha dad pa ste /
translated: The faculty of the anus is that by which one discharges feces.

original: gang gis kun du dga' ba'i bde ba'i khyad par thob par byed do //
analyzed: gang gis kun du dga' ba'i bde ba'i khyad par thob par byed do //
translated: The faculty of the sexual organ is a part of the body faculty, by which one obtains the special pleasure of sexual intercourse.

original: kha bskang bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: kha bskang bar mi bya ste /
translated: One should not add to this list.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis don gang zhig shes par bya ba'i phyir dbang po ni nyi shu rtsa gnyis dag go zhes mdo las bstan pa de la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis don gang zhig shes par bya ba'i phyir dbang po ni nyi shu rtsa gnyis dag go zhes mdo las bstan pa de la /
translated: The Bhagavat has taught in the s≈´tras that there are twenty-two faculties in order to show what must be known.

original: ma rig pa la sogs pa dang / ngag la sogs pa dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa la sogs pa dang / ngag la sogs pa dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because ignorance, etc. and speech, etc. are purposeless.

original: don de yang gang zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: don de yang gang zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of that?

original: de'i phyir / @107b sems kyi rten dang bye brag ces bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / @107b sems kyi rten dang bye brag ces bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚Äúthe basis of mind and the distinction,‚Äù and so on.

original: bdag tu gyur pa'i sems kyi rten ni de'i rten to //
analyzed: bdag tu gyur pa'i sems kyi rten ni de'i rten to //
translated: The basis of mind that becomes the self is its basis.

original: rten de'i bye brag ni pho'o //
analyzed: rten de'i bye brag ni pho'o //
translated: The distinction of that basis is male.

original: mo'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mo'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The distinction of that basis is female.

original: gnas ni rgyun rjes su 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: gnas ni rgyun rjes su 'jug pa'o //
translated: The abode is the continuity that follows.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i tshogs dang / rnam par byang ba ni sems bdag tu gyur pa kho na'i yin no //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i tshogs dang / rnam par byang ba ni sems bdag tu gyur pa kho na'i yin no //
translated: The collection of defilement and purification and purification is only of the mind that becomes the self.

original: skye mched drug po de dag ni sems can gyi rdzas kyi gzhi yin no zhes bya ba ni dang po dang gtso bo'o //
analyzed: skye mched drug po de dag ni sems can gyi rdzas kyi gzhi yin no zhes bya ba ni dang po dang gtso bo'o //
translated: Those six sense bases are the basis of the substance of sentient beings, which is the first and foremost.

original: sems can gyi rdzas ni gcig tu sems kyi grangs su bgrangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can gyi rdzas ni gcig tu sems kyi grangs su bgrangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The substance of sentient beings is counted as the number of minds.

original: de dag gi rten can gzugs can la sogs pa dag dang / de dag gi rnam par shes pa dag ni sems can gyi rdzas yin gyi /
analyzed: de dag gi rten can gzugs can la sogs pa dag dang / de dag gi rnam par shes pa dag ni sems can gyi rdzas yin gyi /
translated: The material organs, etc. are the substances of sentient beings, as are the consciousnesses that are supported by them.

original: gzhan ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin te /
translated: They are not the substances of other sentient beings.

original: de'i dbang gis 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they arise by the power of those organs.

original: yang na lhag par chags pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yang na lhag par chags pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Or else, they are the substances of sentient beings because they are the basis of attachment.

original: de la rab tu chags par 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la rab tu chags par 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one is attached to them.

original: gzhan dag ni dbang po'i rnam par gzhag pa rnam pa gzhan du 'chad pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni dbang po'i rnam par gzhag pa rnam pa gzhan du 'chad pa ni /
translated: Others explain the classification of the faculties in a different way.

original: yang na 'jug pa'i rten dang ni zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: yang na 'jug pa'i rten dang ni zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba'o //
translated: Or else, the basis of engagement, etc.

original: 'khor ba'i 'jug pa dang ldog pa dag ni gtso bo yin la /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i 'jug pa dang ldog pa dag ni gtso bo yin la /
translated: The engagement and disengagement of cyclic existence are the most important.

original: de dag gi rten dang / skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / nye bar spyad pa yang gtso bo yin zhing 'di tsam gyis skyes bu'i don yongs su rdzogs pas gang dag dbang byed pa de dag dbang po nyid du rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de dag gi rten dang / skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / nye bar spyad pa yang gtso bo yin zhing 'di tsam gyis skyes bu'i don yongs su rdzogs pas gang dag dbang byed pa de dag dbang po nyid du rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The basis of those, birth, and the enjoyment of the results of birth are also the most important. Since the purpose of a person is fulfilled by just these, those that exercise control are established as faculties.

original: 'jug pa ni 'byung ba ste ;
analyzed: 'jug pa ni 'byung ba ste ;
translated: Engagement is arising.

original: 'khor ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'khor ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the term ‚Äúsamsara‚Äù is ‚Äúto wander in cyclic existence.‚Äù

original: sems can gyi rdzas 'khor ba las skye mched drug ni 'jug pa'i rten yin te /üîΩde'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can gyi rdzas 'khor ba las skye mched drug ni 'jug pa'i rten yin te / de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The six sense bases are the support for the process of entering samsara, because they are the support for the process of entering samsara.üîΩThey are the support for the process of entering samsara because they are the support for the process of entering samsara.

original: de'i phyir dbang po drug po dag ni 'gro ba dag tu skye bar rgyun chags pa'i mtshan nyid can 'jug pa'i rten te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dbang po drug po dag ni 'gro ba dag tu skye bar rgyun chags pa'i mtshan nyid can 'jug pa'i rten te /
translated: Therefore, the six sense faculties are the support for the process of entering samsara, which is characterized by the continuity of birth in the various destinies.

original: rgyu yin la /
analyzed: rgyu yin la /
translated: They are the cause of birth.

original: 'jug pa ni 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: 'jug pa ni 'bras bu yin no //
translated: The process of entering samsara is the result.üîΩThe faculties of male and female are the cause of birth.

original: skye ba ni pho dang mo'i dbang po dag yin zhes bya ba 'byung ste de dag ci'i phyir skye ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: skye ba ni pho dang mo'i dbang po dag yin zhes bya ba 'byung ste de dag ci'i phyir skye ba yin zhe na /
translated: The faculties of male and female are the cause of birth because birth occurs in dependence on them.

original: de'i phyir / de las skye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩgang gi phyir pho dang mo'i dbang po de las skye ba'i phyir skye ba'i rgyu la skye ba zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir / de las skye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te / gang gi phyir pho dang mo'i dbang po de las skye ba'i phyir skye ba'i rgyu la skye ba zhes bstan to //
translated: The cause of birth is called ‚Äúbirth‚Äù because birth occurs in dependence on them.

original: de dag ni khu ba dang khrag 'jug pa'i dus na lus dang yid kyi dbang po gnyis kyi dngos kyi rgyu yin la /
analyzed: de dag ni khu ba dang khrag 'jug pa'i dus na lus dang yid kyi dbang po gnyis kyi dngos kyi rgyu yin la /
translated: At the time when semen and blood enter, the two faculties of body and mind are the substantial cause of birth.

original: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po bzhi po dag gi ni rgyud nas yin te /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po bzhi po dag gi ni rgyud nas yin te /
translated: The four faculties of eye, etc. are the cause of the stream,

original: mthar gyis zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthar gyis zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is said that they are in order.

original: tshul 'di ni mi dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dags kyi 'gro ba dag la yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: tshul 'di ni mi dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dags kyi 'gro ba dag la yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin gyi /
translated: This is the case for those who are born as humans, animals, or hungry ghosts, but not for others.

original: mngal nas skye ba dang / sgo nga las skye ba'i sems can du gyur pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: mngal nas skye ba dang / sgo nga las skye ba'i sems can du gyur pa'i phyir ro//
translated: Because they are sentient beings born from a womb or from an egg.

original: @108a * // srog gi dbang pos ni gnas par byed de /
analyzed: @108a * // srog gi dbang pos ni gnas par byed de /
translated: The faculty of life force causes them to remain,

original: skye mched drug gi rgyun rgyun mi gcod par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye mched drug gi rgyun rgyun mi gcod par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it causes the stream of the six sense spheres to be uninterrupted.

original: tshor ba rnams kyis ni nye bar spyod par byed de /
analyzed: tshor ba rnams kyis ni nye bar spyod par byed de /
translated: The feelings cause them to experience,

original: 'jug pa'i rten la phan pa dang gnod par byed pa la zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rten la phan pa dang gnod par byed pa la zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are engaged in benefiting or harming the basis of engagement.

original: de ltar na bcu bzhi po 'di dag ni 'jug pa la gtsor byed par zhugs pa'i phyir dbang po nyid do //
analyzed: de ltar na bcu bzhi po 'di dag ni 'jug pa la gtsor byed par zhugs pa'i phyir dbang po nyid do //
translated: Thus, these fourteen are faculties because they are engaged in the primary activity of engagement.

original: rnam pa de nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni rten la sogs pa'i rnam pas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam pa de nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni rten la sogs pa'i rnam pas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In that same way means in the way of being a basis, etc.

original: gzhan dag ni ldog pa yin te zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni ldog pa yin te zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The others are the opposite of that.

original: ldog pa ni ldog pa yin te /
analyzed: ldog pa ni ldog pa yin te /
translated: The opposite is the opposite of that.

original: de yang skye mched drug gtan 'gags pa'o //
analyzed: de yang skye mched drug gtan 'gags pa'o //
translated: That is the complete cessation of the six sense spheres.

original: de'i rten ni dad pa la sogs pa rnams yin te /
analyzed: de'i rten ni dad pa la sogs pa rnams yin te /
translated: The support of that is faith, etc.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad skye ba la gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad skye ba la gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are the principal causes of the arising of all roots of virtue.

original: skye ba ni kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po yin te /
analyzed: skye ba ni kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po yin te /
translated: The arising is the faculty of understanding all.

original: nangs kyi dang por yang dag par nges pa'i phung po la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nangs kyi dang por yang dag par nges pa'i phung po la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the first arising of the aggregate of correct resolve.

original: gnas pa ni kun shes pa'i dbang po yin te /
analyzed: gnas pa ni kun shes pa'i dbang po yin te /
translated: The abiding is the faculty of understanding.

original: de ni rgyun dang ldan pa'i phyir na skye ba gzhan du yang rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rgyun dang ldan pa'i phyir na skye ba gzhan du yang rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is continuous, it follows into another birth.

original: kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang pos nye bar spyod par byed de /
analyzed: kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang pos nye bar spyod par byed de /
translated: One experiences through the faculty of possessing understanding.

original: mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pas phye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pas phye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is distinguished by abiding in bliss in this life.

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis dbang po de snyed cig gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis dbang po de snyed cig gsungs te /
translated: Therefore the BhagavƒÅn taught just that many faculties.

original: de snyed cig kho nas brjod par 'dod pa'i don yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de snyed cig kho nas brjod par 'dod pa'i don yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because just that many are sufficient to complete the meaning that is intended to be expressed.

original: de'i phyir ma rig pa la sogs pa dang / ngag la sogs pa rnams dbang po nyid du kha bskang bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir ma rig pa la sogs pa dang / ngag la sogs pa rnams dbang po nyid du kha bskang bar mi bya ste /
translated: Therefore, ignorance, etc., and speech, etc., are not to be added to the faculties.

original: mdo nyid las bshad pa'i dbang po'i don mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo nyid las bshad pa'i dbang po'i don mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the meaning of the faculties as explained in the sutra is not possible.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,üîΩtheir order is also that.

original: de dag gi go rims kyang de yin no zhes bya ba ni mig gi dbang po nas kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po'i bar ro //
analyzed: de dag gi go rims kyang de yin no zhes bya ba ni mig gi dbang po nas kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po'i bar ro //
translated: The order of the faculties is from the eye faculty to the faculty of one who has known.

original: sems kyi rten yin pa'i phyir na sngar mig la sogs pa rnams bshad do//
analyzed: sems kyi rten yin pa'i phyir na sngar mig la sogs pa rnams bshad do//
translated: The faculties of eye, etc., are explained first because they are the basis of mind.

original: de'i bye brag gi rgyu yin pa'i phyir de'i mjug thogs su pho dang mo'i dbang po'o zhes bya ba rgyas par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i bye brag gi rgyu yin pa'i phyir de'i mjug thogs su pho dang mo'i dbang po'o zhes bya ba rgyas par brjod par bya'o //
translated: The male and female faculties are explained immediately after that because they are the cause of its distinction.

original: yang na ldog pa 'jug pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pas skye mched drug 'jug pa'i rten nyid du sngar bshad de /
analyzed: yang na ldog pa 'jug pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pas skye mched drug 'jug pa'i rten nyid du sngar bshad de /
translated: Or, because the engagement of the cessation of the faculties is preceded by the engagement of the six sense bases, the six sense bases are explained first as the basis of engagement.

original: de bzhin du gzhan la yang rgyas par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la yang rgyas par brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said in detail about the other faculties.

original: ngag ni dbang po ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: ngag ni dbang po ma yin pa nyid de /
translated: Speech is not a faculty,

original: gang la zhe na /
analyzed: gang la zhe na /
translated: because of what?

original: tshig smra bar bya ba la ste /
analyzed: tshig smra bar bya ba la ste /
translated: Because of the activity of speaking,

original: slob pa'i khyad par la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: slob pa'i khyad par la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it depends on the particular training of the speaker.

original: gang zhig gang la dbang byed pa de dag ni logs su slob pa la ltos pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang la dbang byed pa de dag ni logs su slob pa la ltos pa ma yin te /
translated: That which controls something is not dependent on something else,

original: mig la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like the eye, etc.

original: byis pa ni skyes pa tsam gyis slob pa med par mig gis gzugs lta'i /
analyzed: byis pa ni skyes pa tsam gyis slob pa med par mig gis gzugs lta'i /
translated: A child, as soon as it is born, sees forms with the eye without any training,

original: bslab pa'i khyad par med par smra ba ni mi nus te /
analyzed: bslab pa'i khyad par med par smra ba ni mi nus te /
translated: but it cannot speak without the particular training of speech.

original: 'di ltar @108b legs par sbyar ba dang tha mal pa'i yul gyi bye brag gis slob pa la ltos nas tshig tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar @108b legs par sbyar ba dang tha mal pa'i yul gyi bye brag gis slob pa la ltos nas tshig tha dad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, speech is different because of the difference of the object, the well-formed and the unformed.

original: de'i phyir dbang po'i chos las 'das pa'i phyir ngag la sogs pa rnams dbang po yin par mi 'os so //
analyzed: de'i phyir dbang po'i chos las 'das pa'i phyir ngag la sogs pa rnams dbang po yin par mi 'os so //
translated: Therefore, because it is beyond the nature of a faculty, speech is not a suitable faculty.

original: re zhig ngag gi dbang po nyid ci zhig yin /
analyzed: re zhig ngag gi dbang po nyid ci zhig yin /
translated: What is the nature of the faculty of speech?

original: gal te gang las tshig 'byung ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te gang las tshig 'byung ba yin na /
translated: If it is the organ from which the sound arises,

original: de lta na ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa la sogs pa dag dang / de dag gis kun nas bslangs pa'i rlung rnams kyang de'i dbang po nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa la sogs pa dag dang / de dag gis kun nas bslangs pa'i rlung rnams kyang de'i dbang po nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then it follows that discursive thought, investigation, etc., and the winds that motivate them are its organ.

original: gal te yang mgrin pa dang / rkan dang / mchu la sogs pa rnams la brten nas 'byung mod kyi /
analyzed: gal te yang mgrin pa dang / rkan dang / mchu la sogs pa rnams la brten nas 'byung mod kyi /
translated: Even if it arises in dependence on the throat, palate, lips, etc.,

original: de ltar na yang rtog pa la sogs pa dag ste kun nas slong bar byed pa'i phyir gtso bo yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na yang rtog pa la sogs pa dag ste kun nas slong bar byed pa'i phyir gtso bo yin no //
translated: discursive thought, etc., are its primary cause because they motivate it.

original: lag pa dang rkang pa yang len pa dang 'gro ba las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lag pa dang rkang pa yang len pa dang 'gro ba las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba la /
translated: The hand and foot are not different from grasping and walking.

original: lag pa de nyid gzhan dang gzhan du 'byung ba la len pa zhes bya la /
analyzed: lag pa de nyid gzhan dang gzhan du 'byung ba la len pa zhes bya la /
translated: The hand itself, arising in another place, is called grasping.

original: rkang pa nyid gzhan dang gzhan du 'byung ba la 'gro ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rkang pa nyid gzhan dang gzhan du 'byung ba la 'gro ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The foot itself, arising in another place, is called walking.

original: de la ni skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir yul gzhan du phyin pa med cing bya ba don gzhan du gyur pa yang med do ;
analyzed: de la ni skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir yul gzhan du phyin pa med cing bya ba don gzhan du gyur pa yang med do ;
translated: It does not go to another place because it is momentary, and it does not have another action as its object.

original: / de'i phyir len pa dang 'gro ba lag pa dang rkang pa las gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: / de'i phyir len pa dang 'gro ba lag pa dang rkang pa las gzhan ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, grasping and going are not different from the hand and foot.

original: de'i phyir de la dbang byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de la dbang byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it does not control them,

original: rang nyid la ni dbang byed par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: rang nyid la ni dbang byed par mi rung ngo //
translated: because it is not tenable that it controls itself.

original: ji ltar mig gzugs la dbang byed cing /
analyzed: ji ltar mig gzugs la dbang byed cing /
translated: Just as the eye controls visible form,

original: mig gi dbang po las gzugs gzhan ma yin la /
analyzed: mig gi dbang po las gzugs gzhan ma yin la /
translated: the eye faculty is not different from visible form,üîΩand it does not control itself.

original: rang nyid la dbang byed pa ma yin pa de bzhin du 'dir yang yin no //
analyzed: rang nyid la dbang byed pa ma yin pa de bzhin du 'dir yang yin no //
translated: In the same way, it is also so here.

original: sprul la sogs pa la zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sprul la sogs pa la zhes bya ba la /
translated: In the case of magical creations, etc.,

original: sprul la sogs pa rnams la lag pa dang rkang pa yod pa ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: sprul la sogs pa rnams la lag pa dang rkang pa yod pa ma yin mod kyi /
translated: although magical creations, etc., do not have hands and feet,

original: de lta na yang de dag khas len pa dang brang gis 'gro ba yin te /
analyzed: de lta na yang de dag khas len pa dang brang gis 'gro ba yin te /
translated: they nevertheless accept things and walk about.

original: de bzhin du nya la sogs pa rnams la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du nya la sogs pa rnams la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said of fish, etc.

original: rkub kyang rtug par bya ba la dbang po ma yin te zhes bya ba ni mi gtsang ba rtug par bya ba la'o //üîΩde rlung gis kyang bro bar byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rkub kyang rtug par bya ba la dbang po ma yin te zhes bya ba ni mi gtsang ba rtug par bya ba la'o // de rlung gis kyang bro bar byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: The anus is not a controlling faculty with regard to the expulsion of feces, for this action is common to both sexes.üîΩThe anus is not a controlling faculty with regard to the expulsion of feces, for this action is common to both sexes.

original: mi gtsang ba bro bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi gtsang ba bro bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The expulsion of feces is also effected by the wind.

original: kha cig ni kha nas kyang rtug par byed par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kha cig ni kha nas kyang rtug par byed par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Some expel feces by the mouth.

original: de ltar na dbang po'i rnam par gzhag pa 'chol bar 'gyur te /üîΩkhas len pa dang rtug pa'i phyir la /üîΩlag pa gnyis kyis len pa dang 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar na dbang po'i rnam par gzhag pa 'chol bar 'gyur te / khas len pa dang rtug pa'i phyir la / lag pa gnyis kyis len pa dang 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus the definition of the controlling faculties is too narrow.üîΩThe hands and feet are the controlling faculties of grasping and walking,

original: de bzhin du rkang pa gnyis kyis len cing 'gro'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rkang pa gnyis kyis len cing 'gro'o //
translated: for one grasps and walks by means of the hands and feet.üîΩThe sexual organs are the controlling faculties of pleasure and lust.

original: kun du dga' ba ni nyon mongs pa can gyi bde ba'o //üîΩde nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: kun du dga' ba ni nyon mongs pa can gyi bde ba'o // de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Lust is a defiled pleasure.üîΩThe pleasure is produced by the sexual organs, for the S≈´tra says:

original: bde ba de ni mo dang pho'i dbang pos byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: bde ba de ni mo dang pho'i dbang pos byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The pleasure and the lust are produced by the male and female sexual organs.

original: de nyid mdoms yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid mdoms yin no zhe na /
translated: The anus is the organ of excretion of feces.

original: de lta na 'o na ni mdoms kyi dbang po lus kyi dbang po las @109a * //
analyzed: de lta na 'o na ni mdoms kyi dbang po lus kyi dbang po las @109a * //
translated: If that is so, then the organ of the penis would be different from the body organ.üîΩ

original: gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan ma yin te /
translated: If that is so, then the sexual organ is not different from the body faculty,

original: pho dang mo'i dbang po dag ni lus kyi dbang po'i phyogs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pho dang mo'i dbang po dag ni lus kyi dbang po'i phyogs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the male and female faculties are parts of the body faculty.

original: de lta ma yin na lkog ma la sogs pa rnams kyang grangs bzhin du med pa la sogs pa la dbang byed pa'i phyir dbang po thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na lkog ma la sogs pa rnams kyang grangs bzhin du med pa la sogs pa la dbang byed pa'i phyir dbang po thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If that were not so, then the throat and so on would also be faculties because they control the respective functions of swallowing, speaking, and so on.

original: nges pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But this is not so, because there is no reason for them to be faculties.

original: sa bon dang myu gu la sogs pa rgyur gyur pa thams cad kyang rang gi bya ba myu gu dang / 'dab ma dang / sbal mig bcas ba'i mtshan nyid la dbang byed pa'i phyir dbang po nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa bon dang myu gu la sogs pa rgyur gyur pa thams cad kyang rang gi bya ba myu gu dang / 'dab ma dang / sbal mig bcas ba'i mtshan nyid la dbang byed pa'i phyir dbang po nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Also, all causes such as seeds and sprouts would become faculties because they control their own functions, such as the characteristics of sprouts, leaves, and so on.

original: dbang po'i don de rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu bshad zin to //
analyzed: dbang po'i don de rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu bshad zin to //
translated: The reason for positing the faculties has been explained.

original: de dag gi rang gi ngo bo brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de dag gi rang gi ngo bo brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now their individual natures will be explained.

original: de la mig la sogs pa pho'i dbang po la thug pa rnams ni bstan zin to zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la mig la sogs pa pho'i dbang po la thug pa rnams ni bstan zin to zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The eyes and so on are the clear form

original: de dag rnams kyi rnam shes rten //üîΩmig la sogs gzugs dang ba rnams //
analyzed: de dag rnams kyi rnam shes rten // mig la sogs gzugs dang ba rnams //
translated: that is the basis of the consciousnesses.üîΩThe male and female faculties are explained in the line:

original: zhes bya ba dang / lus las pho dbang mo dbang dag / ces bya ba las so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / lus las pho dbang mo dbang dag / ces bya ba las so //
translated: The body faculty is the basis of the three.

original: srog gi dbang po ni zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: srog gi dbang po ni zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The life faculty is explained in the line:

original: srog ni tshe yin drod dang ni //
analyzed: srog ni tshe yin drod dang ni //
translated: Life is the life force, heat,

original: rnam shes rten gang yin pa'o //üîΩzhes bya ba de nas so //
analyzed: rnam shes rten gang yin pa'o // zhes bya ba de nas so //
translated: and the basis of consciousness.

original: dad pa la sogs pa rnams ni sems las byung ba dag gi nang nas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa rnams ni sems las byung ba dag gi nang nas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Faith and so on are explained in the line:

original: dad dang bag yod shin tu sbyangs //
analyzed: dad dang bag yod shin tu sbyangs //
translated: Faith, carefulness, pliancy,

original: zhes bya ba de nas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de nas so //
translated: and so on.

original: bde ba la sogs pa dang / kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po la sogs pa bshad par bya ste zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa dang / kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po la sogs pa bshad par bya ste zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: The faculties of pleasure and so on and the faculty producing complete knowledge and so on will be explained.

original: gal te bde ba la sogs pa rnams kyang sems las byung ba yin pa'i phyir dad pa la sogs pa bzhin du sems las byung ba dag gi nang nas bshad par bya ba ma yin zhe na /üîΩma yin te /
analyzed: gal te bde ba la sogs pa rnams kyang sems las byung ba yin pa'i phyir dad pa la sogs pa bzhin du sems las byung ba dag gi nang nas bshad par bya ba ma yin zhe na / ma yin te /
translated: If pleasure and so on are mental factors, like faith and so on, they should be explained among the mental factors.

original: sems las byung ba dag tu ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes sems pa dang zhes spyi'i dbang du byas kyi /
analyzed: sems las byung ba dag tu ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes sems pa dang zhes spyi'i dbang du byas kyi /
translated: They are not explained there because feeling and discernment are explained in general in the Abhidharmako≈õa, which states, Feeling, discernment, intention, mental factors and so on.

original: de'i phyir 'di nyid du de dag gi khyad par gyi mtshan nyid bstan pa'i skabs su bab pas dbang po'i skabs 'di nyid du ston par byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di nyid du de dag gi khyad par gyi mtshan nyid bstan pa'i skabs su bab pas dbang po'i skabs 'di nyid du ston par byed do //
translated: Therefore, since it is appropriate to explain the characteristics of their specific types here, they are taught in this chapter on faculties.

original: gal te yid kyi mtshan nyid ni bshad zin la /
analyzed: gal te yid kyi mtshan nyid ni bshad zin la /
translated: The characteristics of the mental faculty have already been explained.

original: dad pa la sogs pa rnams ni sems las byung ba rnams kyi nang nas 'chad par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa rnams ni sems las byung ba rnams kyi nang nas 'chad par 'gyur zhing /
translated: Faith and so on will be explained among the mental factors.

original: bde ba dang / yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms rnams 'di nyid nas 'chad na /
analyzed: bde ba dang / yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms rnams 'di nyid nas 'chad na /
translated: If pleasure, mental satisfaction and equanimity are explained here,

original: gang zhig 'dir bshad par bya ba brjod pa kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po la sogs pa gsum po gzhan gang zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: gang zhig 'dir bshad par bya ba brjod pa kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po la sogs pa gsum po gzhan gang zhig yod ce na /
translated: What other three faculties are there that are to be explained here?

original: de ni de dag las gzhan med do //
analyzed: de ni de dag las gzhan med do //
translated: They are not different from those.

original: 'o na ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhig ce na /
translated: What are they?

original: 'di dag gnas skabs gang zhig gis khyad par du 'phags pa na /
analyzed: 'di dag gnas skabs gang zhig gis khyad par du 'phags pa na /
translated: When one is distinguished by a certain state,üîΩone obtains the name of one who has the faculty of one who has known, etc.

original: kun shes par byed pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba 'thob pa'i gnas skabs de bstan @109b par bya dgos pas kun shes par byed pa la sogs pa'i dbang po bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: kun shes par byed pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba 'thob pa'i gnas skabs de bstan @109b par bya dgos pas kun shes par byed pa la sogs pa'i dbang po bshad par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, the faculties of one who has known, etc., are to be explained.

original: de brjod par bya'o zhes de skad du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de brjod par bya'o zhes de skad du bstan pa yin no //
translated: That is what is being said.

original: lus tshor sim pa ma yin gang //
analyzed: lus tshor sim pa ma yin gang //
translated: Whatever unpleasant bodily feeling there is

original: sdug bsngal dbang po'o zhes bya ba la /üîΩlus kyi dbang po sim pa yang yod pas sim pa ma yin zhes bya ba khyad par du byas so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dbang po'o zhes bya ba la / lus kyi dbang po sim pa yang yod pas sim pa ma yin zhes bya ba khyad par du byas so //
translated: is the faculty of pain.üîΩSince there is also pleasant bodily feeling, unpleasant is specified.

original: sems kyi sim pa ma yin pa yang yod pas lus kyi zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: sems kyi sim pa ma yin pa yang yod pas lus kyi zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Since there is also unpleasant mental feeling, bodily is mentioned.

original: sim pa ma yin pa'i brjod pa'i don ma gtogs pa'i phyir rnam grangs gzhan gyis de'i don ston par byed pa ni /
analyzed: sim pa ma yin pa'i brjod pa'i don ma gtogs pa'i phyir rnam grangs gzhan gyis de'i don ston par byed pa ni /
translated: The meaning of unpleasant is taught by another term, excluding the meaning of unpleasant expression.

original: sim pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni gnod par byed pa ste /
analyzed: sim pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni gnod par byed pa ste /
translated: Unpleasant means harmful.

original: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is a synonym for suffering.

original: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: This is the explanation.

original: rnam par shes pa lnga dang lhan cig skyes pa'i nyams su myong ba bkag /'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa lnga dang lhan cig skyes pa'i nyams su myong ba bkag /'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: The faculty of pleasure is the experience that arises together with the five consciousnesses, excluding the experience that arises together with mental consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa lnga dang lhan cig skyes pa dang / rnam par shes pa gsum dang lhan cig skyes pa'i nyams su myong ba phan 'dogs pa ni bde ba'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa lnga dang lhan cig skyes pa dang / rnam par shes pa gsum dang lhan cig skyes pa'i nyams su myong ba phan 'dogs pa ni bde ba'i dbang po'o //
translated: The faculty of pleasure is the experience that arises together with the five consciousnesses and the three consciousnesses.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa na yang bde ba'i dbang po yod par 'dod na /
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa na yang bde ba'i dbang po yod par 'dod na /
translated: If you assert that the faculty of pleasure exists in the third absorption,

original: de ni lus kyi yin par 'dod pa yang ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de ni lus kyi yin par 'dod pa yang ma yin no zhe na /
translated: it is not asserted to be physical.üîΩTherefore it is said:

original: de'i phyir / bsam gtan gsum pa na /
analyzed: de'i phyir / bsam gtan gsum pa na /
translated: In the third absorption,

original: sems kyi de ni bde dbang po //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sems kyi de ni bde dbang po //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
translated: that is the faculty of mental pleasure.

original: gnod pa byed pa ni sdug bsngal gyi dbang po'o zhes bya'o sim pa ni bde ba'o //
analyzed: gnod pa byed pa ni sdug bsngal gyi dbang po'o zhes bya'o sim pa ni bde ba'o //
translated: The faculty of pleasure is that which is soothing.

original: skabs su bab pa'i phyir lus kyi dbang po dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: skabs su bab pa'i phyir lus kyi dbang po dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: It is connected with the body faculty because it is the present topic.

original: 'dir yang khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos po ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos po ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Here, the relationship of qualifier and qualificand is the same as before.

original: sems kyi zhes bya ba 'dis ni lus kyi rnam par gcod do //
analyzed: sems kyi zhes bya ba 'dis ni lus kyi rnam par gcod do //
translated: The word ‚Äúmental‚Äù excludes the body.

original: de nyid ces bya ba 'dis ni sim pa ma yin pa rnam par gcod de /
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba 'dis ni sim pa ma yin pa rnam par gcod de /
translated: The word ‚Äúthat‚Äù excludes that which is not soothing.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Therefore,

original: de nyid ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba smos te /
translated: the word ‚Äúthat‚Äù is stated.

original: sems kyi tshor ba sim pa ni bde ba'i dbang po yin no //
analyzed: sems kyi tshor ba sim pa ni bde ba'i dbang po yin no //
translated: Mental feeling that is soothing is the faculty of pleasure.

original: yang ci'i phyir 'dod pa'i khams dang / bsam gtan dang por lus kyi sim pa bde ba'i dbang por rnam par gzhag la /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir 'dod pa'i khams dang / bsam gtan dang por lus kyi sim pa bde ba'i dbang por rnam par gzhag la /
translated: Why is soothing of the body in the desire realm and the first absorption posited as the faculty of pleasure?

original: bsam gtan gsum par ni sems kyi yin zhe na /
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum par ni sems kyi yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it mental in the third absorption?

original: de'i phyir / lus kyi tshor ba ni med do zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / lus kyi tshor ba ni med do zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúThere is no feeling of the body there.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir med ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir med ce na /
translated: Why is there none?

original: de'i phyir / de na rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos so ;
analyzed: de'i phyir / de na rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos so ;
translated: Therefore, it says, ‚Äúbecause the five collections of consciousness do not exist there.‚ÄùüîΩ

original: / gzhan na de yid bde ba yin //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: / gzhan na de yid bde ba yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: In other stages, it is mental pleasure.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa las gzhan yid bde ba'i dbang po yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa las gzhan yid bde ba'i dbang po yin no //
translated: In the third absorption, it is the faculty of pleasure.üîΩIn other stages, it is the faculty of mental pleasure.

original: gzhan na zhes bya ba smos pa bsam gtan gsum pa'i gong du yang der thal bar 'gyur ba bzlog pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gzhan na zhes bya ba smos pa bsam gtan gsum pa'i gong du yang der thal bar 'gyur ba bzlog pa'i phyir //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin other stages‚Äù is stated to prevent the erroneous conclusion that it is also in the third absorption.

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang / bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis pa na ni zhes bya ba @110a * //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang / bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis pa na ni zhes bya ba @110a * //
translated: In the desire realm and the first and second absorptions, it is the faculty of pleasure.

original: smos te ; de ni de dag kho nar srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smos te ; de ni de dag kho nar srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is stated that it exists only in those stages.

original: yang ci'i phyir bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa bzhin du bsam gtan gsum par yang de'i bde ba'i dbang por ma bshad ce na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa bzhin du bsam gtan gsum par yang de'i bde ba'i dbang por ma bshad ce na /
translated: Why is it not explained that, as in the first and second absorptions, it is the faculty of pleasure in the third absorption?

original: de'i phyir / bsam gtan gsum pa na ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir / bsam gtan gsum pa na ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore, it says, ‚ÄúIn the third absorption, it is the faculty of pleasure.‚Äù

original: yid bde ba ni dga' ba yin la /
analyzed: yid bde ba ni dga' ba yin la /
translated: Mental pleasure is joy.

original: dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang bral bas kyang bsam gtan gsum pa thob ste /
analyzed: dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang bral bas kyang bsam gtan gsum pa thob ste /
translated: Also, one who is free from attachment to joy obtains the third absorption.üîΩA sutra states:

original: mdo las / dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang bral bas btang snyoms la gnas pa /
analyzed: mdo las / dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang bral bas btang snyoms la gnas pa /
translated: Freed from attachment to joy, abiding in equanimity,

original: dran pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: dran pa dang ldan pa /
translated: mindful and fully aware,

original: bde ba la gnas pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bde ba la gnas pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: one abides in bliss.

original: de'i phyir bsam gtan gsum pa na bde ba'i dbang po kho nar brjod kyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir bsam gtan gsum pa na bde ba'i dbang po kho nar brjod kyi /
translated: Therefore, in the third absorption, only the faculty of pleasure is mentioned,

original: yid bde ba'i dbang por ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yid bde ba'i dbang por ni ma yin no //
translated: but not the faculty of mental satisfaction.

original: phan 'dogs par byed pa'i nyams su myong bar mtshungs pa yin no //
analyzed: phan 'dogs par byed pa'i nyams su myong bar mtshungs pa yin no //
translated: They are similar in being the experience of benefit.

original: yid 'di gnyis la khyad par ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: yid 'di gnyis la khyad par ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between these two mental faculties?

original: 'jug pas byas pa'o //üîΩsems kyi bde ba'i dbang po ni brtan par 'jug pa yin la /
analyzed: 'jug pas byas pa'o // sems kyi bde ba'i dbang po ni brtan par 'jug pa yin la /
translated: They are distinguished by their engagement.üîΩThe faculty of mental bliss engages stably,

original: yid bde ba ni mi brtan par 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: yid bde ba ni mi brtan par 'jug pa yin te /
translated: but mental satisfaction engages unstably,

original: sems la ya por byed pa'i phyir ro //üîΩsems kyi sim pa ma yin pa //
analyzed: sems la ya por byed pa'i phyir ro // sems kyi sim pa ma yin pa //
translated: because it agitates the mind.

original: mi bde ba'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mi bde ba'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Mental dissatisfaction is unhappiness.

original: sems kyi yid mi bde ba ni gnod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyi yid mi bde ba ni gnod par byed pa'o //
translated: Mental dissatisfaction harms the mind.

original: lus dang sems kyi sim pa dang / sim pa ma yin pa'i dbye bas tshor ba gsum po dag rnam par gzhag pa byas zin to //
analyzed: lus dang sems kyi sim pa dang / sim pa ma yin pa'i dbye bas tshor ba gsum po dag rnam par gzhag pa byas zin to //
translated: The three feelings have been established by the division of bodily and mental pleasure and of bodily and mental suffering.

original: da ni btang snyoms kyi dbang po brjod par bya dgos pas /
analyzed: da ni btang snyoms kyi dbang po brjod par bya dgos pas /
translated: Now, the faculty of equanimity must be mentioned.

original: de'i phyir ; btang snyoms ni bar ma'o zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir ; btang snyoms ni bar ma'o zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said: Equanimity is neutral.

original: sim pa ni bde ba'o //
analyzed: sim pa ni bde ba'o //
translated: Pleasure is satisfaction.üîΩSuffering is dissatisfaction.

original: sim pa ma yin pa ni sdug bsngal lo zhes thal ma thag tu bshad la /
analyzed: sim pa ma yin pa ni sdug bsngal lo zhes thal ma thag tu bshad la /
translated: This was just explained.

original: 'dir ni bar ma'o zhes bshad pa de'i phyir sim pa yang ma yin sim pa ma yin pa yang ma yin pa de ni bar ma'o zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir ni bar ma'o zhes bshad pa de'i phyir sim pa yang ma yin sim pa ma yin pa yang ma yin pa de ni bar ma'o zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, it is explained as neutral. Therefore, it is said to be neutral, neither satisfaction nor dissatisfaction.

original: de'i phyir / sim pa yang ma yin sim pa ma yin pa yang ma yin pa zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / sim pa yang ma yin sim pa ma yin pa yang ma yin pa zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said to be neither satisfaction nor dissatisfaction.

original: de lta na yang mi shes pa de'i phyir gsung rab las grags pa'i rnam grangs gzhan gyis ston pa ni /
analyzed: de lta na yang mi shes pa de'i phyir gsung rab las grags pa'i rnam grangs gzhan gyis ston pa ni /
translated: Even so, because it is not understood, it is taught by another term that is well known in the scriptures.

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The feeling that is neither pleasant nor unpleasant is the feeling that is neither pleasant nor unpleasant.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ltar lus dang sems la brten pa'i phyir dang / de dang 'dra bar phye nas ma bstan pa'i phyir the tshom za ba na 'dri ba ni /üîΩci lus kyi 'am /
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ltar lus dang sems la brten pa'i phyir dang / de dang 'dra bar phye nas ma bstan pa'i phyir the tshom za ba na 'dri ba ni / ci lus kyi 'am /
translated: Since it is based on the body and mind, like pleasant and unpleasant feelings, and since it is not explained as a separate category like them, it is questioned:

original: sems kyi zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sems kyi zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Is it of the body or of the mind?

original: btang snyoms kyi dbang po zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: btang snyoms kyi dbang po zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: The context is that of the faculty of equanimity.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: gnyis ka'i yin no //
analyzed: gnyis ka'i yin no //
translated: It is both.

original: ci'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /üîΩbde ba dang / sdug bsngal dag ni rten tha dad pa la gus pa @110b med par byas te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dag ni rten tha dad pa la gus pa @110b med par byas te /
translated: Why?

original: bsdus nas te bsdoms nas dbang po gcig tu byas pa 'di la rgyu ci zhig yod de /
analyzed: bsdus nas te bsdoms nas dbang po gcig tu byas pa 'di la rgyu ci zhig yod de /
translated: Pleasant and unpleasant feelings are collected and combined into one faculty, without regard for their different bases. What is the reason for this?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la ni thams cad la thogs pa med pa'i ye shes mnga' ba'i phyir dang thams cad la dran pa nye bar gnas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la ni thams cad la thogs pa med pa'i ye shes mnga' ba'i phyir dang thams cad la dran pa nye bar gnas pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the tathƒÅgatas possess unobstructed knowledge of everything and mindfulness is present in all things,

original: rgyu med par chos ston pa mi mnga'o zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu med par chos ston pa mi mnga'o zhe na /
translated: they do not teach the Dharma without a cause.

original: de'i phyir mi rtog phyir zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de'i phyir mi rtog phyir zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚Äúbecause they are nonconceptual.‚Äù

original: bsdus nas dbang po gcig tu byas pa la rgyu smras pa ni /
analyzed: bsdus nas dbang po gcig tu byas pa la rgyu smras pa ni /
translated: The cause is stated for the collection of the faculties as a single entity:
