original: sems kyi bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba ni phal cher rnam par rtog pa la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: sems kyi bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba ni phal cher rnam par rtog pa la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúMental pleasure and pain are mostly due to conceptualization.‚Äù

original: phal cher smos pas ni dga' ba'i bde ba ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa dang / rnam par smin pa las skyes pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di ston to //
analyzed: phal cher smos pas ni dga' ba'i bde ba ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa dang / rnam par smin pa las skyes pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di ston to //
translated: The word ‚Äúmostly‚Äù indicates that the pleasure of joy born from concentration and that born from karmic maturation are excluded.

original: lus kyi bde ba dang sdug bsngal ni rnam par rtog pa las mi skye'o //
analyzed: lus kyi bde ba dang sdug bsngal ni rnam par rtog pa las mi skye'o //
translated: Bodily pleasure and pain are not born from conceptualization.

original: de nyid la rgyu smras pa ni yul gyi dbang gis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid la rgyu smras pa ni yul gyi dbang gis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The cause of that is stated: ‚ÄúDue to the power of the object, etc.‚Äù

original: mdza' ba dang mi mdza' ba'i rnam par rtog pa spangs pa'i dgra bcom pa rnams la yang yul yid du 'ong ba dang / mi 'ong ba'i dbang gis nges par skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdza' ba dang mi mdza' ba'i rnam par rtog pa spangs pa'i dgra bcom pa rnams la yang yul yid du 'ong ba dang / mi 'ong ba'i dbang gis nges par skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For the arhats who have abandoned the conception of friend and foe, pleasure and pain definitely arise due to the power of pleasant and unpleasant objects.

original: de'i phyir de dag ces bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag ces bya ba la /
translated: Therefore, they are called

original: lus kyi dang sems kyi bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dag bde ba'i dbang po /
analyzed: lus kyi dang sems kyi bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dag bde ba'i dbang po /
translated: the faculty of pleasure,

original: sdug bsngal gyi dbang po /üîΩyid bde ba'i dbang po /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi dbang po / yid bde ba'i dbang po /
translated: the faculty of pain,üîΩthe faculty of mental pleasure,

original: yid mi bde ba'i dbang po zhes dbang po tha dad do //üîΩbtang snyoms ni lus kyi 'am /
analyzed: yid mi bde ba'i dbang po zhes dbang po tha dad do // btang snyoms ni lus kyi 'am /
translated: the faculty of mental displeasure,üîΩand the faculty of equanimity.

original: sems kyi 'am ;üîΩrnam par smin pa las skyes pa'am /
analyzed: sems kyi 'am ; rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'am /
translated: Equanimity is either physical or mental,

original: rgyas par 'byung ba yin yang rung ste /üîΩrnam par mi rtog pa kho nar rang gi ngang gis te /
analyzed: rgyas par 'byung ba yin yang rung ste / rnam par mi rtog pa kho nar rang gi ngang gis te /
translated: arisen from the ripening of karma or from development,üîΩand it arises in a nonconceptual state, by its very nature,

original: mngon par 'du bya ba med par skye ste /
analyzed: mngon par 'du bya ba med par skye ste /
translated: without the need for further effort.

original: de'i phyir dbang po gcig tu byas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir dbang po gcig tu byas so //
translated: Therefore, it is made into one faculty.

original: lus kyi bde ba yang gzhan du phan 'dogs la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: lus kyi bde ba yang gzhan du phan 'dogs la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Physical pleasure is helpful in one way,

original: lus kyi bde ba dang sdug bsngal ni nyi tshe bar zhugs par lus dang sems dag la phan 'dogs pa dang / gnod pa byed pa yin la /üîΩlus kyi bde ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi drag pa dang / mgyogs par byed pa dang / rgyun chags pa yang yin gyi /
analyzed: lus kyi bde ba dang sdug bsngal ni nyi tshe bar zhugs par lus dang sems dag la phan 'dogs pa dang / gnod pa byed pa yin la / lus kyi bde ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi drag pa dang / mgyogs par byed pa dang / rgyun chags pa yang yin gyi /
translated: Physical pleasure and pain are limited to the body, and they benefit or harm the body and mind.

original: sems kyi ni de lta ma yin te /üîΩyid la smin pa yongs su rdzogs pa dang / sdug pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu can gyis dus cung zad phan 'dogs pa'am /
analyzed: sems kyi ni de lta ma yin te / yid la smin pa yongs su rdzogs pa dang / sdug pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu can gyis dus cung zad phan 'dogs pa'am /
translated: They are also intense, quick, and continuous, but mental pleasure and pain are not like that.

original: gnod par byed do //üîΩbtang snyoms la ni lus kyi btang snyoms ni gzhan du phan 'dogs la /
analyzed: gnod par byed do // btang snyoms la ni lus kyi btang snyoms ni gzhan du phan 'dogs la /
translated: Mental pleasure and pain benefit or harm for a short time, due to the ripening of karma in the mind and due to the cause of pleasant or unpleasant conception.

original: sems kyi yang gzhan du phan 'dogs so zhes bya ba'i khyad par 'di med de /
analyzed: sems kyi yang gzhan du phan 'dogs so zhes bya ba'i khyad par 'di med de /
translated: But equanimity does not benefit or harm the body or mind in either of these ways.

original: de bas na btang snyoms la bye brag med pas tha dad pa med @111a * //
analyzed: de bas na btang snyoms la bye brag med pas tha dad pa med @111a * //
translated: Therefore, since there is no distinction in equanimity, it is not differentiated.

original: do ; / zag pa med pa rnams kyi skabs su bab pa la /
analyzed: do ; / zag pa med pa rnams kyi skabs su bab pa la /
translated: Now, in the context of the uncontaminated,

original: de dag la ni logs su bstan par bya ba cung zad kyang med mod kyi /
analyzed: de dag la ni logs su bstan par bya ba cung zad kyang med mod kyi /
translated: But they are not taught separately.

original: 'on kyang / mthong bsgom mi slob lam la dgu gsum yin //
analyzed: 'on kyang / mthong bsgom mi slob lam la dgu gsum yin //
translated: The faculties are nine in the paths of seeing, cultivation, and no training.

original: lan gsum du dbang po dgu la kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po la sogs par brjod do //
analyzed: lan gsum du dbang po dgu la kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po la sogs par brjod do //
translated: The three faculties are called the faculty of understanding all, etc.

original: kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams bum pa ltar btags su yod pa nyid du 'gyur ba yin nam zhe na mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams bum pa ltar btags su yod pa nyid du 'gyur ba yin nam zhe na mi 'gyur te /
translated: Are the faculties of understanding all, etc. imputedly existent like a vase?

original: dbang byed pa'i don ni dbang po'i don yin la /
analyzed: dbang byed pa'i don ni dbang po'i don yin la /
translated: No, they are not. The meaning of faculty is the meaning of controlling power.

original: tshogs pa dag kyang re re zhing dbang byed pas kun shes par byed pa la sogs pa'i dbang po nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: tshogs pa dag kyang re re zhing dbang byed pas kun shes par byed pa la sogs pa'i dbang po nyid yin gyi /
translated: Since each of the collections controls, they are faculties of understanding all, etc.

original: bum pa la sogs pa rnams ni re re zhing bum pa la sogs par bsnyad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa rnams ni re re zhing bum pa la sogs par bsnyad pa ma yin no //
translated: But a vase, etc. is not called a vase, etc. by each individual part.

original: mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa dag na yod pa'i rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de ni yid kyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa dag na yod pa'i rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de ni yid kyi dbang po'o //
translated: The consciousness that exists on the path of seeing, etc. is the mental faculty.

original: bde ba la sogs pa tshor ba'i dbang po gsum ni ci rigs par rten gyi dbang gis yin te /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa tshor ba'i dbang po gsum ni ci rigs par rten gyi dbang gis yin te /
translated: The three faculties of sensation, pleasure, etc., are dominant faculties in the sense that they dominate the body, as is appropriate.

original: mthong ba dang / bsgom pa'i lam dag ni sa drug pa dang / sa dgu pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba dang / bsgom pa'i lam dag ni sa drug pa dang / sa dgu pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The path of insight and the path of cultivation are, respectively, the sixth and ninth stages.

original: dge la thams cad dag tu lnga //
analyzed: dge la thams cad dag tu lnga //
translated: Five are in all the wholesome stages.

original: zhes bya bas dad pa la sogs pa dag ni thams cad na yod kyi /
analyzed: zhes bya bas dad pa la sogs pa dag ni thams cad na yod kyi /
translated: Faith, etc., are in all stages.

original: bde ba dang / yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms rnams ni de ltar cig car srid pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bde ba dang / yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms rnams ni de ltar cig car srid pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But pleasure, gladness, and equanimity are not possible simultaneously.

original: ci'i phyir / 'di dag lam gsum du go rims bzhin du kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po la sogs pa nyid ces bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir / 'di dag lam gsum du go rims bzhin du kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po la sogs pa nyid ces bya zhe na /
translated: Why are these faculties called the faculty of coming to know what was not previously known, etc., in order, on the three paths?

original: mthong ba'i lam la ni bden pa bzhi mi shes pa kun shes so snyam du zhugs pa'i dbang po kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam la ni bden pa bzhi mi shes pa kun shes so snyam du zhugs pa'i dbang po kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po yin no //
translated: On the path of insight, the faculty of coming to know what was not previously known is the faculty that engages in the thought: I will come to know the four noble truths that were not previously known.

original: bsgom pa'i lam la ni sngon ma mthong ba kun shes par bya ba ni med kyi zhes bya ba nas kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po nyid kyis shes par bya ba'i bden pa bzhi ste /üîΩdri med bcu drug gzhan rnams med //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam la ni sngon ma mthong ba kun shes par bya ba ni med kyi zhes bya ba nas kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po nyid kyis shes par bya ba'i bden pa bzhi ste / dri med bcu drug gzhan rnams med //
translated: and the faculty producing complete knowledge is the four truths that are to be known by the faculty of complete knowledge.

original: ces 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ces 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The Abhidharmakosa states, Sixteen are stainless, the others are not.

original: de'i phyir bsgom pa'i lam la snga nas med pa kun shes par bya ba med de /
analyzed: de'i phyir bsgom pa'i lam la snga nas med pa kun shes par bya ba med de /
translated: Therefore, on the path of meditation, there is no object to be known that was not previously known.

original: de'i phyir bden pa bzhi'i bden pa rtogs pa yin dang gang zhig dbang po yin pa de ni kun shes pa'i dbang po yin no //üîΩde nyid kun shes par byed pa'o zhes bya ba nyid 'byung ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir bden pa bzhi'i bden pa rtogs pa yin dang gang zhig dbang po yin pa de ni kun shes pa'i dbang po yin no // de nyid kun shes par byed pa'o zhes bya ba nyid 'byung ste /
translated: Therefore, the faculty that is the realization of the four truths is the faculty of complete knowledge and that itself is the faculty producing complete knowledge.

original: bsgom pa'i lam ni mthong ba'i lam gyis mngon par rtogs par byas zin pa'i bden pa bzhi'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam ni mthong ba'i lam gyis mngon par rtogs par byas zin pa'i bden pa bzhi'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the path of meditation possesses the four truths as its object, since it is already fully realized by the path of seeing.

original: gal te mthong ba'i lam nyid kyis bden pa bzhi kun shes par byas na spang ba'i phyir bsgom pa'i lam gyis rtogs par byed ce na /
analyzed: gal te mthong ba'i lam nyid kyis bden pa bzhi kun shes par byas na spang ba'i phyir bsgom pa'i lam gyis rtogs par byed ce na /
translated: If one fully knows the four truths by the path of seeing alone, then why does the path of meditation realize them in order to abandon?

original: phra rgyas lhag ma spang bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phra rgyas lhag ma spang bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to abandon the remaining negative tendencies.

original: @111b 'di ltar mthong ba'i lam gyis ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas spang bar bya ba'i phyir kun shes par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: @111b 'di ltar mthong ba'i lam gyis ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas spang bar bya ba'i phyir kun shes par byed pa yin la /
translated: Thus the path of seeing fully knows the four truths in order to abandon the negative tendencies that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: bsgom pa'i lam gyis ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir kun shes pa yin no //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam gyis ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir kun shes pa yin no //
translated: The path of meditation fully knows the four truths in order to abandon the afflictions that are to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: kun shes so snyam pa dang ldan pa ni kun shes pa zad pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa'i mtshan nyid can te /
analyzed: kun shes so snyam pa dang ldan pa ni kun shes pa zad pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa'i mtshan nyid can te /
translated: One who possesses the thought I fully know possesses the knowledge of the exhaustion of contaminants and the knowledge of nonarising.

original: de 'di la yod pas sam kun shes pa bsrung ba'i ngang tshul 'di la yod pas na kun shes pa dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: de 'di la yod pas sam kun shes pa bsrung ba'i ngang tshul 'di la yod pas na kun shes pa dang ldan pa ste /
translated: One who possesses that is one who possesses full knowledge because it exists in him or she possesses the nature of guarding full knowledge.

original: ldan pa'i don dang / de'i ngang tshul can gyi don yin no //
analyzed: ldan pa'i don dang / de'i ngang tshul can gyi don yin no //
translated: The term ‚Äúpossesses‚Äù has the meaning of possessing and the meaning of having that nature.

original: de lta bur gyur pa kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po'o //
translated: Such is the faculty of final and perfect knowledge.

original: kun shes pa'i dbang po dang 'di la khyad par ci zhig yod ;
analyzed: kun shes pa'i dbang po dang 'di la khyad par ci zhig yod ;
translated: What is the difference between the faculty of final and perfect knowledge and the faculty of perfect knowledge?

original: des kyang kun shes pa nyid shes pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: des kyang kun shes pa nyid shes pa yin no zhe na /
translated: The latter is the knowledge of perfect knowledge.

original: de'i phyir / zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'i ye shes thob pa'i phyir zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir / zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'i ye shes thob pa'i phyir zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ngo //
translated: That is why the root text says, ‚Äúbecause they have attained the knowledge that consists of the cognition of exhaustion and the cognition of nonarising.‚Äù

original: de lta bu'i dbang po ni zhes bya ba ni kun shes pa rtogs pa dang / srung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de lta bu'i dbang po ni zhes bya ba ni kun shes pa rtogs pa dang / srung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The root text says, ‚Äúsuch a faculty.‚Äù This refers to the faculty of final and perfect knowledge, which is the nature of the faculty of perfect knowledge and the nature of the faculty of final and perfect knowledge.

original: 'dir rang gi ngo bo ston pa'i dbang du byas pa yin pas /
analyzed: 'dir rang gi ngo bo ston pa'i dbang du byas pa yin pas /
translated: The root text presents the essential nature of each of the faculties in the following way:

original: lus tshor sim pa ma yin gang //
analyzed: lus tshor sim pa ma yin gang //
translated: The faculty of pain is a painful feeling in the body.üîΩThe faculty of pleasure is a pleasant feeling in the body.üîΩThe faculty of mental pleasure is a pleasant feeling in the mind.

original: sdug bsngal dbang po zhes bya ba la sogs pas de dag rang gi ngo bo bstan zhing /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dbang po zhes bya ba la sogs pas de dag rang gi ngo bo bstan zhing /
translated: The faculty of mental displeasure is a painful feeling in the mind.üîΩThe faculty of equanimity is a feeling that is neither pleasant nor painful.üîΩThe faculty of life force is the life force of the three realms.

original: 'chad par 'byung ba'i srog gi dbang po la sogs pa rnams rang gi ngo bo bstan zin par bya ste /
analyzed: 'chad par 'byung ba'i srog gi dbang po la sogs pa rnams rang gi ngo bo bstan zin par bya ste /
translated: The five faculties of faith and the rest are as they were explained in the chapter on the powers.üîΩThe faculty of final and perfect knowledge is the faculty of a learner who has attained the knowledge of exhaustion and the knowledge of nonarising.üîΩThe faculty of perfect knowledge is the faculty of an arhat who has not lost his or her knowledge.üîΩThe faculty of neither pleasure nor pain is a feeling that is neither pleasant nor painful.

original: rang gi ngo bo bstan nas zhes bya ba 'di mngon par brjod do //üîΩrnam pa'i bye brag brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo bstan nas zhes bya ba 'di mngon par brjod do // rnam pa'i bye brag brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The term ‚Äútheir nature‚Äù is stated in the Abhidharma.üîΩThe term ‚Äútheir specific attributes‚Äù is stated in the Abhidharma.üîΩThe term ‚Äútheir specific attributes‚Äù is stated in the Abhidharma.üîΩThe term ‚Äútheir specific attributes‚Äù is stated in the Abhidharma.

original: chos mngon pa ni chos rab tu rnam par dbye bar bya ba'i don du yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgsum ni dri med ces bya ba la /
analyzed: chos mngon pa ni chos rab tu rnam par dbye bar bya ba'i don du yin pa'i phyir ro // gsum ni dri med ces bya ba la /
translated: The term ‚Äútheir specific attributes‚Äù is stated in the Abhidharma.üîΩThe term ‚Äútheir specific attributes‚Äù is stated in the Abhidharma.üîΩThe term ‚Äútheir specific attributes‚Äù is stated in the Abhidharma.üîΩThe term ‚Äútheir specific attributes‚Äù is stated in the Abhidharma.üîΩThe term ‚Äútheir specific attributes‚Äù is stated in the Abhidharma.üîΩThe term ‚Äútheir specific attributes‚Äù is stated in the Abhidharma.üîΩThe term ‚Äútheir specific attributes‚Äù is stated in the Abhidharma.üîΩThe term ‚Äútheir specific attributes‚Äù is stated in the Abhidharma.üîΩThe term ‚Äútheir specific attributes‚Äù is stated in the Abhidharma.üîΩThe term ‚Äútheir specific attributes‚Äù is stated in the Abhidharma.üîΩThe term ‚Äútheir specific attributes‚Äù is stated in the Abhidharma.üîΩThe term ‚Äútheir specific attributes‚Äù is stated in the Abhidharma.üîΩThe term ‚Äútheir specific attributes‚Äù is stated in the Abhidharma.üîΩThe term ‚Äútheir specific attributes‚Äù is stated in the Abhidharma.

original: gsum ni dri ma med pa kho na'o zhes bya bar nges par gzung ste /
analyzed: gsum ni dri ma med pa kho na'o zhes bya bar nges par gzung ste /
translated: The term ‚Äútheir specific attributes‚Äù is stated in the Abhidharma.üîΩThe term ‚Äútheir specific attributes‚Äù is stated in the Abhidharma.üîΩThe term ‚Äútheir specific attributes‚Äù is stated in the Abhidharma.üîΩThe term ‚Äútheir specific attributes‚Äù is stated in the Abhidharma.üîΩThe term ‚Äútheir specific attributes‚Äù is stated in the Abhidharma.

original: dgu rnam gnyis zhes 'byung ba'i phyir dang zag pa med pa'i lam gsum gyis bsdus pa'i phyir 'di dag zag pa dang bcas pa ni med do //
analyzed: dgu rnam gnyis zhes 'byung ba'i phyir dang zag pa med pa'i lam gsum gyis bsdus pa'i phyir 'di dag zag pa dang bcas pa ni med do //
translated: The term ‚Äútheir specific attributes‚Äù is stated in the Abhidharma.

original: gzugs can srog dang sdug bsngal dag / zag dang bcas pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gzugs can srog dang sdug bsngal dag / zag dang bcas pa kho na'o //
translated: The term ‚Äútheir specific attributes‚Äù is stated in the Abhidharma.

original: zhes nges par gzung ste /
analyzed: zhes nges par gzung ste /
translated: The term ‚Äútheir specific attributes‚Äù is stated in the Abhidharma.üîΩThe term ‚Äútheir specific attributes‚Äù is stated in the Abhidharma.üîΩThe term ‚Äútheir specific attributes‚Äù is stated in the Abhidharma.üîΩThe term ‚Äútheir specific attributes‚Äù is stated in the Abhidharma.üîΩThe term ‚Äútheir specific attributes‚Äù is stated in the Abhidharma.üîΩThe term ‚Äútheir specific attributes‚Äù is stated in the Abhidharma.

original: dgu rnam gnyis zhes gsungs pa'i phyir dang / lam gyi bden pa'i dang / 'dus ma byas kyis ma bsdus pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: dgu rnam gnyis zhes gsungs pa'i phyir dang / lam gyi bden pa'i dang / 'dus ma byas kyis ma bsdus pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: The term ‚Äútheir specific attributes‚Äù is stated in the Abhidharma.üîΩThe

original: / gzugs kyi phung pos bsdus pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: / gzugs kyi phung pos bsdus pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: because they are included in the form aggregate.

original: gzugs can zhes brjod par 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan bstan par bya ba'i phyir smos so //
analyzed: gzugs can zhes brjod par 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan bstan par bya ba'i phyir smos so //
translated: This is stated to indicate the reason why they are called ‚Äúhaving form.‚Äù

original: dgu rnam gnyis zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: dgu rnam gnyis zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: Nine are of two types.

original: lam dang lam ma yin pas bsdus pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgal te gcig tu zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med par @112a * //
analyzed: lam dang lam ma yin pas bsdus pa'i phyir ro // gal te gcig tu zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med par @112a * //
translated: because they are included in the path and not the path.

original: nges pa'i phyir dgu rnam gnyis zhes bya ba ma smras kyang /
analyzed: nges pa'i phyir dgu rnam gnyis zhes bya ba ma smras kyang /
translated: Even though it is not stated that ‚Äúnine are of two types‚Äù because they are definitely either with or without outflows,

original: gnyis nyid du rtog par 'gyur ba ma yin na ma zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis nyid du rtog par 'gyur ba ma yin na ma zhe na /
translated: if they are not conceived as a duality,

original: 'di ni bzhi kho na ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ni bzhi kho na ma yin gyi /
translated: then why is it said that ‚Äúthey are not only four‚Äù?

original: dgu char yang rnam pa gnyis yin no zhes dad pa la sogs pa gcig tu zag pa med pa nyid yin pa dgag par bya ba'i phyir yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dgu char yang rnam pa gnyis yin no zhes dad pa la sogs pa gcig tu zag pa med pa nyid yin pa dgag par bya ba'i phyir yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is in order to refute the idea that faith, etc., are only uncontaminated, that it is said that ‚Äúthe nine are of two types.‚Äù

original: kha cig na re dad pa la sogs pa rnams ni zag pa med pa kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: kha cig na re dad pa la sogs pa rnams ni zag pa med pa kho na yin gyi /
translated: Some say that faith, etc., are only uncontaminated,

original: zag pa dang bcas pa ni med do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa ni med do zhes zer ro //
translated: and that they are not with outflows.

original: don de nyid la khungs smras pa ni /
analyzed: don de nyid la khungs smras pa ni /
translated: The source for this meaning is stated:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
translated: The Bhagavat said, etc.

original: rnam pa thams cad du zhes bya ba ni chung du dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i rnam par ro//
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du zhes bya ba ni chung du dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i rnam par ro//
translated: In every way means in the small, medium, and great aspects.

original: thams cad ces bya ba ni lnga char zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba ni lnga char zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: All means all five.

original: 'di ltar zag pa ngang bcas pa'i chos rnams ni zag pa med pa ltar so so'i skye bo rnams la med pa ma yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar zag pa ngang bcas pa'i chos rnams ni zag pa med pa ltar so so'i skye bo rnams la med pa ma yin la /
translated: Thus, the dharmas with outflows do not exist for ordinary beings as they do for those without outflows.

original: dad pa la sogs pa rnams ni so so'i skye bo rnams la yod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa rnams ni so so'i skye bo rnams la yod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: And faith, etc. do not exist for ordinary beings,

original: dgag pa mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgag pa mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are refuted.

original: de'i phyir zag pa med pa kho na yin no zhes bya bar shes so zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir zag pa med pa kho na yin no zhes bya bar shes so zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it is understood that they are only without outflows.

original: 'di dad pa la sogs pa rnams zag pa med pa'i khungs su mi rung ngo //
analyzed: 'di dad pa la sogs pa rnams zag pa med pa'i khungs su mi rung ngo //
translated: This is not a source for the claim that faith, etc. are without outflows.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: zag pa med pa rnams kyi dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zag pa med pa rnams kyi dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is stated with reference to those without outflows.

original: gal te khyad par med par dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams kyi dbang du mdzad par gyur na ni 'di khungs su 'gyur ba zhig na ;
analyzed: gal te khyad par med par dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams kyi dbang du mdzad par gyur na ni 'di khungs su 'gyur ba zhig na ;
translated: If the five faculties of faith, etc. were not distinguished, then this passage would be a source.

original: 'di ni zag pa med pa rnams kho na'i dbang du mdzad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni zag pa med pa rnams kho na'i dbang du mdzad pa yin te /
translated: But this passage refers only to the uncontaminated faculties,

original: de'i phyir 'di khungs su mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di khungs su mi rung ngo //
translated: so it is not a source.

original: 'di ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: 'di ji ltar shes she na /
translated: How do we know that?

original: de'i phyir / 'di ltar 'phags pa'i gang zag rnam par gzhag pa mdzad nas zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'di ltar 'phags pa'i gang zag rnam par gzhag pa mdzad nas zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said: ‚ÄúHaving distinguished the noble persons.

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'i sgra ni gang gi phyir gyi don to //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'i sgra ni gang gi phyir gyi don to //
translated: ‚Äù The word ‚Äúthus‚Äù means ‚Äúbecause.üîΩ‚Äù The sutra says:

original: mdo las ni dge slong dag dbang po lnga po 'di dag tsam ste /
analyzed: mdo las ni dge slong dag dbang po lnga po 'di dag tsam ste /
translated: ‚ÄúMonks, there are just these five faculties.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: dad pa'i dbang po dang / brtson 'grus kyi dbang po dang / dran pa'i dbang po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po dang / shes rab kyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: dad pa'i dbang po dang / brtson 'grus kyi dbang po dang / dran pa'i dbang po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po dang / shes rab kyi dbang po'o //
translated: The faculty of faith, the faculty of perseverance, the faculty of mindfulness, the faculty of concentration, and the faculty of wisdom.

original: dge slong dag dbang po lnga po 'di dag rab yin pa'i phyir dang / rno ba yin pa'i phyir dang / bsten pa yin pa'i phyir dang / yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir dgra bcom pa gnyis ka'i cha las rnam par grol ba yin no //
analyzed: dge slong dag dbang po lnga po 'di dag rab yin pa'i phyir dang / rno ba yin pa'i phyir dang / bsten pa yin pa'i phyir dang / yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir dgra bcom pa gnyis ka'i cha las rnam par grol ba yin no //
translated: O monks, the two types of perfected beings are those who are liberated through both parts, because their five faculties are strong, sharp, well-developed, and complete.

original: de bas ches rtul ba dang / ches zhan pa dag gis ni dgra bcom pa shes rab kyi rnam par grol ba yin no //
analyzed: de bas ches rtul ba dang / ches zhan pa dag gis ni dgra bcom pa shes rab kyi rnam par grol ba yin no //
translated: Those who are perfected beings with weak faculties and weak effort are liberated through wisdom alone.

original: de bas ches rtul ba dang / ches zhen pa dag gis na rnam par grol ba dus dang @112b sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: de bas ches rtul ba dang / ches zhen pa dag gis na rnam par grol ba dus dang @112b sbyor ba yin no //
translated: Those who are perfected beings with still weaker faculties and still weaker effort are liberated at the proper time.

original: de bas ches rtul ba dang ches zhan pa dag gis ni mthong bas thob pa /üîΩde bas ches rtul ba dang ches zhan pas ni dad pas mos pa /
analyzed: de bas ches rtul ba dang ches zhan pa dag gis ni mthong bas thob pa / de bas ches rtul ba dang ches zhan pas ni dad pas mos pa /
translated: Those who are perfected beings with still weaker faculties and still weaker effort are those who obtain results by insight.üîΩThose who are perfected beings with still weaker faculties and still weaker effort are those who are convinced through faith.

original: de bas ches rtul ba dang ches zhan pas ni chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba yin no //
analyzed: de bas ches rtul ba dang ches zhan pas ni chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba yin no //
translated: Those who are perfected beings with still weaker faculties and still weaker effort are those who follow the teachings.

original: de bas ches rtul ba dang ches phra bas ni dad pas rjes su 'brang ba yin no zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de bas ches rtul ba dang ches phra bas ni dad pas rjes su 'brang ba yin no zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Those who are duller and more subtle are followers of faith.

original: gang la dbang po lnga po 'di dag rnam pa thams cad du thams cad med pa de ni phyi rol so so'i skye bo'i phyogs la gnas par nga sma'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs so //
analyzed: gang la dbang po lnga po 'di dag rnam pa thams cad du thams cad med pa de ni phyi rol so so'i skye bo'i phyogs la gnas par nga sma'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs so //
translated: I declare that those who lack these five faculties in all ways belong to the class of ordinary beings who are outside the arya fold.

original: de'i phyir de ltar na 'phags pa'i gang zag rnam par gzhag par mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar na 'phags pa'i gang zag rnam par gzhag par mdzad nas /
translated: Thus, having presented the arya persons,

original: gang la dbang po lnga po 'di dag ces gsungs te /
analyzed: gang la dbang po lnga po 'di dag ces gsungs te /
translated: the sutra states, those who have these five faculties.

original: gang dag 'dir dbang du mdzad pa ma yin no zhes bya bar rtogs so //
analyzed: gang dag 'dir dbang du mdzad pa ma yin no zhes bya bar rtogs so //
translated: It is understood that those who are not the focus of the five faculties are not arya persons.

original: de ltar ma yin na gang la dbang po lnga po 'di dag ces mi gsung bar 'gyur ba zhig go //
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na gang la dbang po lnga po 'di dag ces mi gsung bar 'gyur ba zhig go //
translated: Otherwise, it would not state those who have these five faculties.

original: de'i phyir der dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po thams cad kyi dbang du mdzad pa ma yin no zhes bya bar rtogs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir der dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po thams cad kyi dbang du mdzad pa ma yin no zhes bya bar rtogs so //
translated: Therefore it is understood that those who are not the focus of all the faculties such as faith are not arya persons.

original: de'i phyir phyi rol so so'i skye bo'i phyogs la gnas pa zag pa dang bcas pa dag dang ldan pa mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: de'i phyir phyi rol so so'i skye bo'i phyogs la gnas pa zag pa dang bcas pa dag dang ldan pa mi 'gal lo //
translated: Therefore, it is not contradictory to say that the ordinary person who is externally situated possesses the contaminated states.

original: yang na so so'i skye bo rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yang na so so'i skye bo rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Or else, the ordinary person is twofold:

original: nang pa dang / phyi rol pa'o //
analyzed: nang pa dang / phyi rol pa'o //
translated: the insider and the outsider.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du ma chad pa ni nang pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du ma chad pa ni nang pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The one who has not severed the wholesome roots is called the insider,

original: bden pa mngon par rtogs par rung ba'i phyir dang / de'i tshogs sogs par rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bden pa mngon par rtogs par rung ba'i phyir dang / de'i tshogs sogs par rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is fit for the realization of the truths and because he is fit for the accumulation of their requisites.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du chad pa ni phyi rol pa ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du chad pa ni phyi rol pa ste /
translated: The one who has severed the wholesome roots is the outsider,

original: bzlog pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: bzlog pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: because he is the opposite of that.

original: / de lta ma yin na ni phyi rol gsungs pa la den mi mnga' bar 'gyur ro //üîΩdge ba'i rtsa ba kun du chad pa dang / kun du ma chad pa gnyis char 'phags pa'i chos ma thob par mtshungs pa'i sgo nas so so'i skye bo'i phyogs la gnas pas nang pa las khyad par du bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: / de lta ma yin na ni phyi rol gsungs pa la den mi mnga' bar 'gyur ro // dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du chad pa dang / kun du ma chad pa gnyis char 'phags pa'i chos ma thob par mtshungs pa'i sgo nas so so'i skye bo'i phyogs la gnas pas nang pa las khyad par du bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Otherwise, the statement about the outsider would be false.

original: phyi rol zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: phyi rol zhes gsungs so //
translated: In order to distinguish the outsider from the insider, the one who has severed the wholesome roots is called the outsider, because he is situated in the class of the ordinary person, in the same way that the one who has not severed the wholesome roots is situated in the class of the ordinary person.

original: rnam pa thams cad du zhes bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i rnam par ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du zhes bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i rnam par ro //
translated: In every way means in the aspect of contaminated and uncontaminated.

original: thams cad ces bya ba ni rnam pa chung du'i chung du yang med pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba ni rnam pa chung du'i chung du yang med pa'o //
translated: All means there is no small or smaller.

original: de lta ma yin na ni gang la dbang po lnga po 'di dag med pa de ni so so'i skye bo'i phyogs la gnas par nga smra'o zhes gsungs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni gang la dbang po lnga po 'di dag med pa de ni so so'i skye bo'i phyogs la gnas par nga smra'o zhes gsungs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would say, I say that one who lacks these five faculties remains in the class of ordinary beings.

original: dad pa la sogs pa zag pa dang bcas pa nyid du rab tu bsgrub pa la khungs gzhan smos pa ni /
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa zag pa dang bcas pa nyid du rab tu bsgrub pa la khungs gzhan smos pa ni /
translated: To prove that faith and so on are contaminated, another source is mentioned.

original: mdo las kyang sems can 'jig rten du skyes shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: mdo las kyang sems can 'jig rten du skyes shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
translated: The sutra states that sentient beings born in the world and so on.

original: mdo 'di yang zag pa med pa rnams kyi dbang du mdzad nas gsungs so zhe na /
analyzed: mdo 'di yang zag pa med pa rnams kyi dbang du mdzad nas gsungs so zhe na /
translated: This sutra was spoken from the perspective of uncontaminated states.

original: de'i phyir / chos kyi 'khor lo ma bskor ba kho na nyi tshe zhes bya ba drangs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / chos kyi 'khor lo ma bskor ba kho na nyi tshe zhes bya ba drangs te /
translated: Therefore, the sutra states, Only those who have not turned the wheel of Dharma are called ordinary beings.

original: chos kyi 'khor @113a * //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor @113a * //
translated: The wheel of Dharma is turned by the path of seeing.

original: lo ma bskor bar ni 'jig rten na sems can rnams la dad pa la sogs pa zag pa med pa dag yod pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: lo ma bskor bar ni 'jig rten na sems can rnams la dad pa la sogs pa zag pa med pa dag yod pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: In the world, sentient beings do not have the uncontaminated faculties of faith, etc.

original: sangs rgyas 'byung ba dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba don med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'byung ba dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba don med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that the appearance of a Buddha and the turning of the wheel of the Dharma would be pointless.

original: de'i phyir chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i gong rol na sems can rnams kyi dad pa la sogs pa zag pa dang bcas pa kho na zhes bya bar shes so //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i gong rol na sems can rnams kyi dad pa la sogs pa zag pa dang bcas pa kho na zhes bya bar shes so //
translated: Therefore, it is known that prior to the turning of the wheel of the Dharma, sentient beings have only the contaminated faculties of faith, etc.

original: 'dir dbang po rnon po la sogs pa bstan pa ni yid kyi dbang po'i dbang du mdzad nas yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir dbang po rnon po la sogs pa bstan pa ni yid kyi dbang po'i dbang du mdzad nas yin no zhe na /
translated: Here, the teaching of those with sharp faculties, etc., is from the perspective of the mental faculty.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po phun sum tshogs pas skal ba dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po phun sum tshogs pas skal ba dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because those who are fortunate possess the perfect faculties of faith, etc.

original: 'di ltar mdo las ni skal ba dang ldan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar mdo las ni skal ba dang ldan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Thus, a sutra declares:

original: bcom ldan 'das chos bshad du gsol /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das chos bshad du gsol /
translated: Bhagavan, please teach the Dharma.

original: sems can dbang po rnon po dag kyang mchis //
analyzed: sems can dbang po rnon po dag kyang mchis //
translated: There are sentient beings with sharp faculties.

original: zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba nas /
translated: up to:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi chos kun shes par 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs kyi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi chos kun shes par 'gyur // zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs kyi /
translated: he will know all the dharmas of the Lord.

original: yid kyi dbang po ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yid kyi dbang po ni ma yin no //
translated: But it does not say that the mental faculty is the faculty of coming to know what is as yet unknown.

original: yid kyi dbang po yin na ni dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du chad pa rnams skal ba mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid kyi dbang po yin na ni dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du chad pa rnams skal ba mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the mental faculty were the faculty of coming to know what is as yet unknown, then those who have cut off the wholesome roots would not have it.

original: yang ngas ji srid du zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: yang ngas ji srid du zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Moreover, it is stated in detail: ‚ÄúFor as long as I have not known thus,

original: 'di ni dad pa la sogs pa dag zag pa dang bcas pa nyid du rab tu bsgrub pa la lung gzhan yin no zhes ston to //
analyzed: 'di ni dad pa la sogs pa dag zag pa dang bcas pa nyid du rab tu bsgrub pa la lung gzhan yin no zhes ston to //
translated: this is another scriptural reference to establish that faith, etc. are only with-outflows.

original: ci ste yang mdo 'di nyid zag pa med pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa yin no snyam na /
analyzed: ci ste yang mdo 'di nyid zag pa med pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa yin no snyam na /
translated: But if you think that this very s≈´tra is stated with reference to the uncontaminated,

original: de'i phyir / zag pa med pa rnams la ni zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / zag pa med pa rnams la ni zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: then he says, ‚ÄúBut the uncontaminated ones are not like that.‚Äù

original: gal te yang lam la skye ba dang 'gag pa yod pas kun 'byung ba dang / mi snang ba gnyis srid mod kyi ro myong ba dang / nyes dmigs ni mi srid pas lam la yongs su brtag pa rnam pa 'di mi rigs so //
analyzed: gal te yang lam la skye ba dang 'gag pa yod pas kun 'byung ba dang / mi snang ba gnyis srid mod kyi ro myong ba dang / nyes dmigs ni mi srid pas lam la yongs su brtag pa rnam pa 'di mi rigs so //
translated: If the path has arising and cessation, then it is possible that it has both origination and disappearance. But since it is impossible that it have both experience and disadvantage, this analysis of the path is not correct.

original: de'i phyir dad pa la sogs pa dag zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir dad pa la sogs pa dag zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
translated: Therefore, it is established that faith, etc., are both contaminated and uncontaminated.

original: re zhig gcig tu zhes bya ba ni bye brag med ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: re zhig gcig tu zhes bya ba ni bye brag med ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: First of all, means without distinction.

original: srog ni rnam smin zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: srog ni rnam smin zhes bya ba la /
translated: Life is a karmic maturation.

original: srog gi dbang po ni rnam par smin pa kho na yin no zhes bya bar nges par gzung ste /
analyzed: srog gi dbang po ni rnam par smin pa kho na yin no zhes bya bar nges par gzung ste /
translated: The faculty of life force is only a karmic maturation.

original: bcu gnyis gnyis zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcu gnyis gnyis zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is ascertained because it is said, ‚ÄúTwelve are of two types.‚Äù

original: byin gyis brlabs pa'i tshe ji ltar zhes te /
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs pa'i tshe ji ltar zhes te /
translated: How is it when it is empowered?

original: de rnam par smin pa ma yin pa nyid du shes par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de rnam par smin pa ma yin pa nyid du shes par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that it is not a karmic maturation,üîΩhe says,

original: 'o na dge slong dgra bcom pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di smos so //üîΩsrog gi dbang po gang yin pa de dag gang gi rnam par smin pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba ni ci tshe rabs gzhan gyi las yin nam /
analyzed: 'o na dge slong dgra bcom pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di smos so // srog gi dbang po gang yin pa de dag gang gi rnam par smin pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba ni ci tshe rabs gzhan gyi las yin nam /
translated: Now, this is stated: ‚ÄúThe life faculty of an arhat monk...‚Äù.

original: 'on te da ltar byung ba'i tshe rabs kyi yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te da ltar byung ba'i tshe rabs kyi yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: With regard to the question, ‚ÄúWhat is the karmic maturation of those life faculties?‚Äù it is asked whether it is the karma of another lifetime or whether it is the karma of the present lifetime.üîΩThe treatise states:

original: bstan bcos las @113b zhes bya ba ni de skye ba da ltar ba'i las kyi 'bras bu yin no zhes lung gis ston pa'o //
analyzed: bstan bcos las @113b zhes bya ba ni de skye ba da ltar ba'i las kyi 'bras bu yin no zhes lung gis ston pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is the result of present life karma.‚Äù This is taught by scripture.

original: dgra bcom pa zhes bya ba ni phyir mi 'ong ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa zhes bya ba ni phyir mi 'ong ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúArhat‚Äù refers to one who is not a non-returner.

original: rdzu 'phrul dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni mngon par shes pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni mngon par shes pa thob pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOne who possesses superknowledge‚Äù refers to one who has attained higher perception.

original: sems la dbang thob pa zhes bya ba ni dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: sems la dbang thob pa zhes bya ba ni dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOne who has attained mastery of mind‚Äù refers to one liberated regardless of circumstances.

original: gang zag la zhes bya ba ni gang du mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: gang zag la zhes bya ba ni gang du mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúWith regard to a person‚Äù refers to one who experiences the result in the present life.

original: gang dag 'gog byams nyon mongs med //
analyzed: gang dag 'gog byams nyon mongs med //
translated: Those who are free of attachment, free of conflict,

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is the meaning of the verse.

original: 'tshe ba'i yo byad ces bya ba la 'cho ba'i ched kyi yo byad ni 'tsho ba'i yo byad de /
analyzed: 'tshe ba'i yo byad ces bya ba la 'cho ba'i ched kyi yo byad ni 'tsho ba'i yo byad de /
translated: The term ‚Äúmeans of livelihood‚Äù means the means of living.

original: de dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is in conformity with that.

original: de phul nas de bsams te /
analyzed: de phul nas de bsams te /
translated: Having given it, he thinks of it.

original: de cher bsams shing sems la gzhag ste 'dun pa bskyed nas so //
analyzed: de cher bsams shing sems la gzhag ste 'dun pa bskyed nas so //
translated: Having thought of it a great deal, having placed it in the mind, he generates the aspiration.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How?

original: bdag gi longs spyod kyi rnam par smin pa gang yin pa de tshe'i rnam par smin par gyur cig snyam du'o //
analyzed: bdag gi longs spyod kyi rnam par smin pa gang yin pa de tshe'i rnam par smin par gyur cig snyam du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúMay whatever is the karmic maturation of my enjoyments become the karmic maturation of my life.‚Äù

original: de'i longs spyod kyi rnam par smin pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de'i longs spyod kyi rnam par smin pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Whatever is the karmic maturation of his enjoyments, etc.

original: smon lam de'i shugs dang rab kyi mtha' pa'i mjug thogs su brjod pa'i rnam par rig byed kyi shugs kyis dge 'dun nam gang zag la 'bul ba'i sems pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: smon lam de'i shugs dang rab kyi mtha' pa'i mjug thogs su brjod pa'i rnam par rig byed kyi shugs kyis dge 'dun nam gang zag la 'bul ba'i sems pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa kho na'o //
translated: The karmic maturation of that aspiration is only karmic maturation because it is the result of the intention to offer to the Sa·πÖgha or an individual through the force of that aspiration and the force of the indicative form at the end of the highest limit.

original: rnam par smin pa'i lhag ma rnam par smin par byed do zhes bya bar 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i lhag ma rnam par smin par byed do zhes bya bar 'byung ngo //
translated: The remainder of the karmic maturation of that action is experienced.

original: dus ma yin par 'chi bas tshe'i rnam par smin pa yongs su ma rdzogs shing /
analyzed: dus ma yin par 'chi bas tshe'i rnam par smin pa yongs su ma rdzogs shing /
translated: The karmic maturation of life is not complete due to untimely death.

original: rnam par smin pa'i las gang yin pa de'i rnam par smin pa lhag ma ste /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i las gang yin pa de'i rnam par smin pa lhag ma ste /
translated: The remainder of the karmic maturation of that action is experienced.

original: rab kyi mtha' pa'i bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis drangs nas so sor myong bar byed do //
analyzed: rab kyi mtha' pa'i bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis drangs nas so sor myong bar byed do //
translated: It is drawn out and experienced by the power of cultivating the fourth absorption at the peak of existence.

original: de'i phyir de ltar na gzhan dag ni rnam pa 'dis kyang srog ni de'i rnam par smin pa kho na yin par 'gyur te ;
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar na gzhan dag ni rnam pa 'dis kyang srog ni de'i rnam par smin pa kho na yin par 'gyur te ;
translated: Thus others say: Life is the karmic maturation of that action.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i mthus skye ba gzhan snga ma las myong bar 'gyur bar nges pa'i las kyis 'phags pa'i tshe dag drangs nas 'dir so sor myong bar byed do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i mthus skye ba gzhan snga ma las myong bar 'gyur bar nges pa'i las kyis 'phags pa'i tshe dag drangs nas 'dir so sor myong bar byed do zhes zer ro //
translated: By the power of meditative attainment, the ƒÅrya draws out and experiences in this life the karma certain to be experienced in another life.

original: tshe'i 'du byed dag ji ltar gtong zhe na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: tshe'i 'du byed dag ji ltar gtong zhe na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: How do they relinquish the formation of life?

original: de'i de lta bur 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i de lta bur 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: The Master says: ‚ÄúThat is so for them.‚Äù

original: tshe'i rnam par smin pa longs spyod kyi rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshe'i rnam par smin pa longs spyod kyi rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: The karmic maturation of life becomes the karmic maturation of resources.

original: lus kyi de nyid la zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa la'o //
analyzed: lus kyi de nyid la zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that very body‚Äù means in the desire realm.

original: tshe dang mthun pa zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi las kyi rnam par smin pa'i srog gnas pa dang mthun pa dag go //
analyzed: tshe dang mthun pa zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi las kyi rnam par smin pa'i srog gnas pa dang mthun pa dag go //
translated: ‚ÄúIn accord with life‚Äù means in accord with the life force that is the karmic maturation of previous karma.

original: rnam pa 'dis kyang srog ni rnam par smin pa kho na yin no //üîΩ'gal ba dag ces bya ba ni 'byung @114a * //
analyzed: rnam pa 'dis kyang srog ni rnam par smin pa kho na yin no // 'gal ba dag ces bya ba ni 'byung @114a * //
translated: This also shows that life is only karmic maturation.

original: pa chen po dag ste /
analyzed: pa chen po dag ste /
translated: ‚ÄúMutually contradictory‚Äù means the primary elements.

original: tshe dang zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: tshe dang zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúLife‚Äù is connected to ‚Äúmutually contradictory.‚Äù

original: 'di lta bu yin te zhes smra ba ni bstan bcos mkhan po'o //üîΩde dag gi de lta bu ni ting nge 'dzin gyi mthu kho na ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di lta bu yin te zhes smra ba ni bstan bcos mkhan po'o // de dag gi de lta bu ni ting nge 'dzin gyi mthu kho na ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: The author of the treatise says, ‚ÄúThis is so.‚Äù

original: de dag gi ni rnal 'byor pa dag gi ste /
analyzed: de dag gi ni rnal 'byor pa dag gi ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThat is so for them‚Äù means that is so for those yogins.

original: bsam gtan pa rnams kyi bsam gtan gyi yul gyi bsam gyis mi khyab ngo zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan pa rnams kyi bsam gtan gyi yul gyi bsam gyis mi khyab ngo zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The Abhidharmako≈õa declares, ‚ÄúThe object of concentration of those in equipoise is inconceivable.‚Äù

original: des zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi mthu dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi mthu dang sbyar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBy that‚Äù should be connected with ‚Äúthe power of concentration.‚Äù

original: tshe rabs gzhan snga ma la byed pa'i las skyes pa ni sngon gyi las skyes pa'o //üîΩgnas pa ni dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po rnams kyi rgyun no //
analyzed: tshe rabs gzhan snga ma la byed pa'i las skyes pa ni sngon gyi las skyes pa'o // gnas pa ni dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po rnams kyi rgyun no //
translated: Arisen from previous action means arisen from previous karma.üîΩThe life faculty is the continuum of the great elements that are faculties.

original: gnas pa'i dus ni dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po rnams gnas pa'i dus so //
analyzed: gnas pa'i dus ni dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po rnams gnas pa'i dus so //
translated: The time of life is the time of the life faculty.

original: de'i 'phen pa ni dus kyi 'phen pa ste /
analyzed: de'i 'phen pa ni dus kyi 'phen pa ste /
translated: The impetus of that is the impetus of time.

original: gnas pa'i dus kyi 'phen pa'i shugs zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gnas pa'i dus kyi 'phen pa'i shugs zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is the impetus of the time of the life faculty.

original: 'phen pa'i shugs de yang yang srid par mtshams sbyor ba'i skad cig ste /
analyzed: 'phen pa'i shugs de yang yang srid par mtshams sbyor ba'i skad cig ste /
translated: That impetus is the moment of linking with rebirth.

original: gang gis rgyun dus de srid du 'jug par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gang gis rgyun dus de srid du 'jug par 'gyur zhing /
translated: By it, the continuum operates for that period of time.

original: sngon gyi las dag gis de lta bu'i rang bzhin gyi nus pa gzhag pa de ni 'phen pa'i shugs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi las dag gis de lta bu'i rang bzhin gyi nus pa gzhag pa de ni 'phen pa'i shugs zhes bya'o //
translated: The power of that kind of nature that is posited by previous karma is called the impetus.

original: dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po rnams kyi zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po rnams kyi zhes bya ba la /
translated: The great elements that are faculties are the great elements that are faculties.

original: dbang po rnams dang 'byung ba chen po rnams kyi gnas pa'i dus kyi 'phen pa sngon gyi las las skyes pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi mthus zlog par byed la /
analyzed: dbang po rnams dang 'byung ba chen po rnams kyi gnas pa'i dus kyi 'phen pa sngon gyi las las skyes pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi mthus zlog par byed la /
translated: The projection of the time of endurance of the faculties and the great elements generated from past karma is reversed by the power of concentration.

original: dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po rnams kyi gnas pa'i dus kyi 'phen pa sngon med pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi mthus 'phen par byed de /
analyzed: dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po rnams kyi gnas pa'i dus kyi 'phen pa sngon med pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi mthus 'phen par byed de /
translated: The projection of the time of endurance of the great elements of the faculties that is not generated from past karma is projected by the power of concentration.

original: de lta bas na ting nge 'dzin gyi mthus 'phangs pa'i srog gi dbang po gang yin pa de ni rnam par smin pa ma yin la de las gzhan pa ni rnam par smin pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na ting nge 'dzin gyi mthus 'phangs pa'i srog gi dbang po gang yin pa de ni rnam par smin pa ma yin la de las gzhan pa ni rnam par smin pa yin te /
translated: Therefore the faculty of life force projected by the power of concentration is not karmic maturation. That which is other than that is karmic maturation.

original: ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa las gzhan pa sngon gyi las las skyes pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa las gzhan pa sngon gyi las las skyes pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That which is generated from concentration and that which is generated from past karma that is other than that.üîΩIf you ask, ‚ÄúWhat is this like?‚Äù

original: de ni 'di lta bu zhes bya ba 'di yin no zhes bya bar gsal bar brjod par bya'o zhe na /üîΩde ni rgyas pa las 'byung ba zhig ste /
analyzed: de ni 'di lta bu zhes bya ba 'di yin no zhes bya bar gsal bar brjod par bya'o zhe na /üîΩde ni rgyas pa las 'byung ba zhig ste /
translated: it is like the following.

original: dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po rnams kyi gnas pa'i dus kyi 'phen pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyu can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po rnams kyi gnas pa'i dus kyi 'phen pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyu can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The duration of the life of the great elements of the sense faculties is projected by the cause of concentration.

original: btsun pa mtha' yas go cha na re ni khyad par ston pa de dag bzhi ka yang skyon dang bcas pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: btsun pa mtha' yas go cha na re ni khyad par ston pa de dag bzhi ka yang skyon dang bcas pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Bhadanta Anantavarman says that all four of these explanations have faults.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: dang po ltar na ni tshe'i rnam par smin pa'i las mthong ba'i chos kyi 'bras bu can du 'gyur na /
analyzed: dang po ltar na ni tshe'i rnam par smin pa'i las mthong ba'i chos kyi 'bras bu can du 'gyur na /
translated: In the first case, karma that ripens as life would have a result in the current life,

original: tshe'i rnam par smin pa'i las ni mthong ba'i chos can la myong bar 'gyur bar yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: tshe'i rnam par smin pa'i las ni mthong ba'i chos can la myong bar 'gyur bar yang mi rigs te /
translated: but it is illogical that karma that ripens as life would be experienced in the current life.

original: las 'bras bu nye la 'bras bu ring ba ma yin pa yang yod ces bya ba rgyas @114b par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: las 'bras bu nye la 'bras bu ring ba ma yin pa yang yod ces bya ba rgyas @114b par 'byung ngo //
translated: Karma has a result that is near and a result that is distant.

original: gnyis pa ltar na las rnams nges pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyis pa ltar na las rnams nges pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the second case, it would follow that karma would be indeterminate.

original: gal te rnam par smin pa lhag ma smin par byed par 'gyur na ni las gsum po mthong ba'i chos dang / lan grangs gzhan dang / skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba rnams nges par med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te rnam par smin pa lhag ma smin par byed par 'gyur na ni las gsum po mthong ba'i chos dang / lan grangs gzhan dang / skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba rnams nges par med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the remaining karmic maturation were to ripen, then the three types of karma‚Äîto be experienced in the current life, in the next rebirth, and in a future life‚Äîwould not be definite.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: 'dir skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyi rnam par smin pa ni smin par 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'dir skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyi rnam par smin pa ni smin par 'gyur la /
translated: The karmic maturation of karma to be experienced after rebirth has already ripened.

original: las de nyid kyi rnam par smin pa lhag ma ni /
analyzed: las de nyid kyi rnam par smin pa lhag ma ni /
translated: The remaining karmic maturation of that karma

original: lan grangs gzhan la yin no //
analyzed: lan grangs gzhan la yin no //
translated: is to be experienced in a future life.

original: mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur ba ni mthong ba'i chos la rnam par smin par 'gyur la /
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur ba ni mthong ba'i chos la rnam par smin par 'gyur la /
translated: Karma to be experienced in the current life ripens in the current life.

original: de nyid kyi skye ba gsum pa la yin pas /
analyzed: de nyid kyi skye ba gsum pa la yin pas /
translated: The third rebirth of that karmaüîΩis to be experienced in a future life.

original: las de nyid mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur bar yang 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: las de nyid mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur bar yang 'gyur zhing /
translated: Therefore that karma is to be experienced in the current life.

original: de nyid skyes nas dang / lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: de nyid skyes nas dang / lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur na /
translated: If it were to be experienced after rebirth and in a future life,

original: 'di ni 'dod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: that is unacceptable.

original: gsum pa ltar na ni gzugs na spyod pa'i 'byung ba chen po rnams la 'gal ba nyid mi srid pa'i phyir phan 'dogs par byed par 'gyur ba de dag tshe rgyun gcod par byed par ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gsum pa ltar na ni gzugs na spyod pa'i 'byung ba chen po rnams la 'gal ba nyid mi srid pa'i phyir phan 'dogs par byed par 'gyur ba de dag tshe rgyun gcod par byed par ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: In the third case, since it is impossible for the great elements of the form realm to be contradictory, they would be beneficial. How could they sever the continuum of life?

original: gnod par byed pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnod par byed pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they have the characteristic of not being harmful.

original: bzhi pa ltar na sngon gyi las kyi rnam par smin pa zad pa'i phyir dang / sngon med pa skyes pa'i phyir 'chi 'phos pa dang / skyes par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bzhi pa ltar na sngon gyi las kyi rnam par smin pa zad pa'i phyir dang / sngon med pa skyes pa'i phyir 'chi 'phos pa dang / skyes par 'gyur te /
translated: In the fourth case, death and rebirth would occur because the ripening of former karma would be exhausted and that which did not previously exist would arise.

original: de'i phyir tshe rabs gzhan bzhin du so sor thar pa'i sdom pa gtang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshe rabs gzhan bzhin du so sor thar pa'i sdom pa gtang bar 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, like other lives, the pratimoksa vow would be relinquished.

original: bslab pa phul dang 'chi 'pho dang // zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bslab pa phul dang 'chi 'pho dang // zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it says, ‚ÄúThrough offering back the training, death, or changing sex.‚ÄùüîΩHe states his own system:

original: de nyid kyis rang gi lugs smras ba ni tshe ma nges pa 'phen pa yin te /üîΩ'di na ma nges tha mar ni //
analyzed: de nyid kyis rang gi lugs smras ba ni tshe ma nges pa 'phen pa yin te / 'di na ma nges tha mar ni //
translated: The lifespan of the desire realm is projected.üîΩHere the lifespan is uncertain in the end,

original: lo bcu dang po dpag tu med //
analyzed: lo bcu dang po dpag tu med //
translated: but at the beginning it is immeasurable.

original: ces 'byung ba'i phyir dus ma nges zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ces 'byung ba'i phyir dus ma nges zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Thus the meaning of the term is not definite.

original: thams cad kyang kye ma ma la bdag tshe ring bar gyur cig ces smon lam 'debs kyi /
analyzed: thams cad kyang kye ma ma la bdag tshe ring bar gyur cig ces smon lam 'debs kyi /
translated: All beings pray, May I live a long time,

original: tshe brgya 'am stong zhes ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tshe brgya 'am stong zhes ni ma yin no //
translated: but not, May I live a hundred or a thousand years.

original: gal te de lta yin na /
analyzed: gal te de lta yin na /
translated: If that is so,

original: 'o na ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag deng sang ni mi rnams tshe lo brgya pa'o zhes gsungs she na /
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag deng sang ni mi rnams tshe lo brgya pa'o zhes gsungs she na /
translated: why did the Bhagavan say, Monks, nowadays the lifespan of humans is one hundred years?

original: de yan chad na bcud kyis len pa la sogs pa dag tu gnas pa'i rgyu 'byung ba chen po'i cha rkyen med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de yan chad na bcud kyis len pa la sogs pa dag tu gnas pa'i rgyu 'byung ba chen po'i cha rkyen med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because beyond that, the lifespan of humans would not be sustained by the conditions of the great elements that are the cause of elixirs and so on.

original: 'di la bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re bstan bcos kyi don ma rtogs pas de skad du smras pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di la bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re bstan bcos kyi don ma rtogs pas de skad du smras pa yin te /
translated: Vaibhasikas say: You speak thus because you do not understand the meaning of the treatise.

original: mthong ba'i chos kyi 'bras bu can du 'gyur na zhes gang smras ba de ni 'dod pa nyid de /
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos kyi 'bras bu can du 'gyur na zhes gang smras ba de ni 'dod pa nyid de /
translated: It is asserted that the lifespan of humans is one hundred years because it is the result of present action.

original: mchod rten rnying pa la sogs pa gsos pa las tshe @115a * //
analyzed: mchod rten rnying pa la sogs pa gsos pa las tshe @115a * //
translated: The lifespan of humans is not one hundred years in the hells and so on.

original: 'phel bar 'dod pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'phel bar 'dod pa kho na yin no //
translated: But it is not the case that they are not the results of karma.

original: mdo las kyang srog ni rnam par smin pa yin gyi /
analyzed: mdo las kyang srog ni rnam par smin pa yin gyi /
translated: A sutra states: Life is the result of karma.

original: 'das pa'i las kho na'i ni ma yin no zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'das pa'i las kho na'i ni ma yin no zhes gsungs te /
translated: It is not the result of past karma alone.

original: re zhig srog ni rnam par thams cad du rnam par smin pa kho na yin no //üîΩgal te bsam gtan la sogs pa'i stobs kho na las yin la rag mod /
analyzed: re zhig srog ni rnam par thams cad du rnam par smin pa kho na yin no // gal te bsam gtan la sogs pa'i stobs kho na las yin la rag mod /
translated: Life is the result of karma in all cases.

original: ci'i phyir lhung bzed la sogs pa la ltos she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir lhung bzed la sogs pa la ltos she na /
translated: If life is due to the power of meditative stabilization and so on, why is it dependent on such things as a begging bowl?

original: lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is dependent on the supporting condition of karma.

original: bzhi pa ltar na las kyi rnam par smin pa zad pas 'chi 'pho dang / skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bzhi pa ltar na las kyi rnam par smin pa zad pas 'chi 'pho dang / skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: If it is the fourth, then death and rebirth occur due to the exhaustion of the karmic maturation of karma.

original: de'i phyir skye ba gzhan bzhin du so sor thar pa'i sdom pa gtang bar 'gyur te zhes gang smras pa de la yang brjod bar bya ste /üîΩ'dir 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba yang mi rigs la /
analyzed: de'i phyir skye ba gzhan bzhin du so sor thar pa'i sdom pa gtang bar 'gyur te zhes gang smras pa de la yang brjod bar bya ste / 'dir 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba yang mi rigs la /
translated: Therefore, like rebirth, the pratimoksa vow would be relinquished.

original: sngom pa gtong ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: sngom pa gtong ba yang ma yin te /
translated: But it is illogical that death and rebirth occur here and that the vow is not relinquished.

original: sngar gyi ris mthun pa rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir dang / snga na med pa'i ris mthun pa ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar gyi ris mthun pa rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir dang / snga na med pa'i ris mthun pa ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the homogeneous collection of former moments that is projected, and because a new homogeneous collection that has not existed previously is not produced.

original: de'i phyir ji skad smras pa'i nyes par thal bar mi 'gyur ro //üîΩtshe ma nges pa 'phen la /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji skad smras pa'i nyes par thal bar mi 'gyur ro // tshe ma nges pa 'phen la /
translated: Therefore the error stated does not arise.

original: cha rkyen ma tshang bas 'chi bar 'gyur ro zhes gang smra na /
analyzed: cha rkyen ma tshang bas 'chi bar 'gyur ro zhes gang smra na /
translated: If you say that death occurs because the conditions for the life force are incomplete,

original: de ltar 'dod na ni longs spyod bad pa kho na las 'chi bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de ltar 'dod na ni longs spyod bad pa kho na las 'chi bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: then if you assert that, death would occur only from the exhaustion of resources,

original: tshe zad pa las ni ma yin te /üîΩde lta ma yin dang tshe zad pa yin gyi /
analyzed: tshe zad pa las ni ma yin te / de lta ma yin dang tshe zad pa yin gyi /
translated: not from the exhaustion of life.üîΩIf it were otherwise, there would be the fault of the four possibilities, such as the following:

original: bsod nams zad pa ma yin pa yang yod de zhes bya ba la sogs pa mu bzhi la gnod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsod nams zad pa ma yin pa yang yod de zhes bya ba la sogs pa mu bzhi la gnod par 'gyur ro //
translated: There is the life force being exhausted but not merit.

original: spros pas chog go ;
analyzed: spros pas chog go ;
translated: Enough of this elaboration.

original: / bstan bcos la 'jug par bya ste /
analyzed: / bstan bcos la 'jug par bya ste /
translated: Let us enter the treatise.

original: dri ba las dri ba gzhan 'byung ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dri ba las dri ba gzhan 'byung ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: One question arises from another.

original: 'o na dge slong dgra bcom pa'i tshe'i 'du byed 'jog par byed pa'i zhes bya ba'i dri ba de las dri ba gzhan 'di 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'o na dge slong dgra bcom pa'i tshe'i 'du byed 'jog par byed pa'i zhes bya ba'i dri ba de las dri ba gzhan 'di 'byung ngo //
translated: Another question is raised by the question, ‚ÄúWhy does the bhik·π£u extend the life force when he is an arhat?‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir che'i 'du byed dag byin gyis rlob par byed ce na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir che'i 'du byed dag byin gyis rlob par byed ce na zhes bya ba la /
translated: Why does he bless the life force?

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni gzhan la phan pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni gzhan la phan pa'i don du'o //
translated: The Bhagavat Buddha does so for the sake of benefiting others.

original: gzhan ni bstan pa gnas par bya ba'i don du yang ngo //
analyzed: gzhan ni bstan pa gnas par bya ba'i don du yang ngo //
translated: Others do so for the sake of the longevity of the teaching.

original: gal te bstan pa gnas pa yang gzhan la phan pa'i don kho na ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bstan pa gnas pa yang gzhan la phan pa'i don kho na ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If the longevity of the teaching is for the sake of benefiting others,üîΩwhat is the difference between the two?

original: 'di la khyad par yod de /üîΩbstan pa gnas par gyur kyang gzhan la /
analyzed: 'di la khyad par yod de / bstan pa gnas par gyur kyang gzhan la /
translated: There is a difference.

original: phan pa 'ga' zhig la gzhan nus pa mthong ngo ;
analyzed: phan pa 'ga' zhig la gzhan nus pa mthong ngo ;
translated: Even though the teaching remains, others do not see any benefit.

original: / de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: / de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Therefore,

original: de la gzhan nus pa mthong ba yin no zhes bya bar smos so //
analyzed: de la gzhan nus pa mthong ba yin no zhes bya bar smos so //
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúOthers do not see any benefit.‚Äù

original: gzhan la phan pa chung ba dang // zhes bya ba ni chos gos dang / bsod snyoms la sogs pa bslang ba nye bar longs spyod pas byas pa'o //üîΩnad la sogs ba lta bu zhes bya ba ni nad dang / 'bras dang / zung rdul @115b sogs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: gzhan la phan pa chung ba dang // zhes bya ba ni chos gos dang / bsod snyoms la sogs pa bslang ba nye bar longs spyod pas byas pa'o // nad la sogs ba lta bu zhes bya ba ni nad dang / 'bras dang / zung rdul @115b sogs pa lta bu ste /
translated: The benefit for others is small because one uses the robes, alms, and so on that one has requested.üîΩLike illness, etc.

original: sdug bsngal nyid gsum dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal nyid gsum dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Like illness, abscesses, and so on, because they possess the three kinds of suffering.

original: tshangs spyong 'di la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: tshangs spyong 'di la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: This is the extensive explanation of the passage beginning with ‚Äúthe pure conduct.‚Äù

original: lus nad la sogs pa'i snod du gyur pa'i phyir na phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das par 'jug pa'i tshe de dang bral na dga' bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: lus nad la sogs pa'i snod du gyur pa'i phyir na phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das par 'jug pa'i tshe de dang bral na dga' bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: Because the body is a vessel for illness, etc., one is happy when one is free of it at the time of entering nirvana without remainder.

original: zhugs pa na ni ma yin te /
analyzed: zhugs pa na ni ma yin te /
translated: But one is not happy when entering the womb,

original: de'i tshe sems dang sems las byung ba 'gag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe sems dang sems las byung ba 'gag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because at that time mind and mental factors cease.

original: 'o na gang du 'am gang zhig gi zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'o na gang du 'am gang zhig gi zhes bya ba la /
translated: Now, where or in whose lineage is this path taught?

original: gang du zhes bya ba 'di'i lan ni mi'i nang kho na dag tu ste /
analyzed: gang du zhes bya ba 'di'i lan ni mi'i nang kho na dag tu ste /
translated: The answer to ‚Äúwhere‚Äù is: in the human realm alone.

original: gling gsum po dag tu'o zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gling gsum po dag tu'o zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is in three continents.

original: bstan pa med pa'i phyir byang gi sgra mi snyan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bstan pa med pa'i phyir byang gi sgra mi snyan du ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not in Uttarakuru because there is no teaching there.

original: gang zhig gi zhes bya ba'i lan ni /
analyzed: gang zhig gi zhes bya ba'i lan ni /
translated: Who?

original: dgra bcom pa pho mo zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa pho mo zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is a male or female arhat.

original: za ma la sogs pa rnams la mngon par rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgnyis ka smos pa ni dgra bcom pa dus mi sbyor bar rnam bar grol ba'i yin gyi /
analyzed: za ma la sogs pa rnams la mngon par rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro // gnyis ka smos pa ni dgra bcom pa dus mi sbyor bar rnam bar grol ba'i yin gyi /
translated: Because there is no clear knowledge in neuters and so on.üîΩBoth male and female are mentioned because this is liberation not dependent on time for arhats.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba dang / rnam par grol ba dus dang sbyor ba ni ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //üîΩde ni rab kyi mtha' pa'i bsam gtan thob pas ting nge 'dzin la dbang zhing /üîΩnyon mongs pa med pas nyon mongs pa dag gis kyang rgyud ma brtan pa yin te /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba dang / rnam par grol ba dus dang sbyor ba ni ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro // de ni rab kyi mtha' pa'i bsam gtan thob pas ting nge 'dzin la dbang zhing / nyon mongs pa med pas nyon mongs pa dag gis kyang rgyud ma brtan pa yin te /
translated: But it is not for nonreturners who are liberated according to circumstances.

original: khams gsum gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khams gsum gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: That is because they obtain the limit of the fourth absorption and they have mastery over concentration and their mindstreams are not firm due to affliction because they are free from attachment to the three realms.

original: phyir mi 'ong bal ni ting nge 'dzin la dbang ba snyed yod mod kyi /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong bal ni ting nge 'dzin la dbang ba snyed yod mod kyi /
translated: Nonreturners have mastery over concentration.

original: nyon mongs pa dag gis rgyud nye bar ma brtan pa ni ma yin te ;
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dag gis rgyud nye bar ma brtan pa ni ma yin te ;
translated: The mind is not steady due to the defilements,

original: nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrnam par grol ba dus dang sbyor ba ni nyon mongs pa dag gis rgyud nye bar ma brtan pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro // rnam par grol ba dus dang sbyor ba ni nyon mongs pa dag gis rgyud nye bar ma brtan pa yin mod kyi /
translated: because it is associated with the defilements.üîΩThe mind is steady due to the defilements, but not due to mastery of concentration.

original: ting nge 'dzin la dbang ba nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la dbang ba nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: The mind is steady due to the defilements, but not due to mastery of concentration.

original: gcig ni nyon mongs pas bcings la /
analyzed: gcig ni nyon mongs pas bcings la /
translated: One is bound by the defilements,

original: gnyis pa la ni ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par med do //
analyzed: gnyis pa la ni ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par med do //
translated: but the other is not distinguished by concentration.

original: srog gtong ba dang ; byin gyis rlob pa'i zhar la 'di dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: srog gtong ba dang ; byin gyis rlob pa'i zhar la 'di dpyad par bya ste /
translated: The following should be investigated in the context of the life force and the consecration.üîΩThe S≈´tra says, ‚ÄúThe Bhagavat, having consecrated the compositional factors of life,üîΩhaving extended the life span,üîΩhaving extended the life span,üîΩhaving extended the life span,üîΩhaving extended the life span,

analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus, etc.

original: gang nas gsungs she na /
analyzed: gang nas gsungs she na /
translated: Where is this taught?

original: chos mngon pa las so //
analyzed: chos mngon pa las so //
