analyzed: ji ltar gsungs she na /
translated: How is it taught?

original: srog gi dbang po gang zhe na /
analyzed: srog gi dbang po gang zhe na /
translated: What is the faculty of life force?

original: khams gsum pa'i tshe yin no zhes bya bar ro //
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i tshe yin no zhes bya bar ro //
translated: It is life in the three realms.

original: srog gi 'du byed dag byin gyis brlabs nas zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //üîΩsrog gi 'du @116a * //
analyzed: srog gi 'du byed dag byin gyis brlabs nas zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro // srog gi 'du @116a * //
translated: Because it is said, ‚ÄúHaving blessed the formative forces of life force.üîΩ‚Äù

original: byed dag ni da ltar byung ba'i las kyi 'bras bu yin par rtogs so //
analyzed: byed dag ni da ltar byung ba'i las kyi 'bras bu yin par rtogs so //
translated: The formative forces of life force are understood to be the effect of present karma.

original: tshe'i 'du byed kyang gtong ngo zhes bya ba ni sngar bslangs pa gtong ba yin no //
analyzed: tshe'i 'du byed kyang gtong ngo zhes bya ba ni sngar bslangs pa gtong ba yin no //
translated: One also relinquishes the formative forces of life, that is, one relinquishes those previously accumulated.

original: gang dag gis ris mthun par zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /üîΩlas gang dag gis ris mthun pa ma 'ongs pa gnas par 'gyur ba de dag ni tshe'i 'du byed dag yin la /
analyzed: gang dag gis ris mthun par zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / las gang dag gis ris mthun pa ma 'ongs pa gnas par 'gyur ba de dag ni tshe'i 'du byed dag yin la /
translated: Those that maintain the continuity of a species, etc.üîΩThe formative forces of life are those karmas that maintain the continuity of a species in the future.

original: sngon gyi las gang dag gis da lta dus gzhan gyi bar du 'tsho bde dag ni srog gi 'du byed dag yin no //
analyzed: sngon gyi las gang dag gis da lta dus gzhan gyi bar du 'tsho bde dag ni srog gi 'du byed dag yin no //
translated: The formative forces of life force are those previous karmas that sustain life for a certain period of time.

original: srog gi 'du byed dag ces mang po'i tshig gang yin pa'i mang po'i tshig ci'i phyir yin zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: srog gi 'du byed dag ces mang po'i tshig gang yin pa'i mang po'i tshig ci'i phyir yin zhes zer ba la /
translated: Why is the plural particle used in the phrase ‚Äúthe formative forces of life‚Äù?

original: mang po'i tshig ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //üîΩtshe rang srog gi 'du byed kyi zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: mang po'i tshig ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so // tshe rang srog gi 'du byed kyi zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The plural particle is used becauseüîΩthe life force is relinquished and empowered in many moments.

original: srog gi 'du byed kun la gnas pa mang po rnams la gtong zhing byin gyis rlob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srog gi 'du byed kun la gnas pa mang po rnams la gtong zhing byin gyis rlob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The plural particle is used because the life force is relinquished and empowered in many moments.

original: skad cig ma gcig gtong ba'am byin gyis rlob pa la ni dgos pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: skad cig ma gcig gtong ba'am byin gyis rlob pa la ni dgos pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not necessary to relinquish or empower a single moment of life,üîΩbecause that does not benefit others and does not accomplish the goal of the characteristics of the teaching remaining.

original: des gzhan la phan pa dang / bstan pa gnas pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi don thob par mi byed pa'i phyir dang / tshe skad cig ma gcig lus pa las gtong ba dang byin gyis rlob pa'i sems kun du spyod pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des gzhan la phan pa dang / bstan pa gnas pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi don thob par mi byed pa'i phyir dang / tshe skad cig ma gcig lus pa las gtong ba dang byin gyis rlob pa'i sems kun du spyod pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not reasonable to relinquish or empower the mind that remains in a single moment of life.

original: dus gzhan gyi bar du 'du ga pa'i zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dus gzhan gyi bar du 'du ga pa'i zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúup to the time of death‚Äù means

original: 'dis ni tshe skad cig ma nyid du ston par byed do //
analyzed: 'dis ni tshe skad cig ma nyid du ston par byed do //
translated: This shows that life is momentary.

original: gnas pa'i ngang tshul can ni 'dug pa ste /
analyzed: gnas pa'i ngang tshul can ni 'dug pa ste /
translated: The nature of abiding is remaining.

original: ji ltar bye brag pa rnams kyi lta ba bdag dang yid sbyor ba brtan pa'i srog yin pa de dag ni 'di na med do //
analyzed: ji ltar bye brag pa rnams kyi lta ba bdag dang yid sbyor ba brtan pa'i srog yin pa de dag ni 'di na med do //
translated: The soul and mind of the Vai≈õe·π£ikas are not the life faculty, because they are not impermanent.

original: 'du byed mang po rnams la zhes bya brgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: 'du byed mang po rnams la zhes bya brgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: With regard to the many formations,

original: mdo sde pa na re ni 'dis ci rigs par gzugs la sogs pa lnga dang / tshor ba la sogs pa phung po bzhi la ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed kyi mtshan nyid can srog gi dbang po 'gog par mdzad do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: mdo sde pa na re ni 'dis ci rigs par gzugs la sogs pa lnga dang / tshor ba la sogs pa phung po bzhi la ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed kyi mtshan nyid can srog gi dbang po 'gog par mdzad do zhes zer ro //
translated: the SautrƒÅntikas say that the life faculty is a characteristic of the formations that are not associated with any of the five aggregates, such as form, and so on, and the four aggregates, such as feeling, and so on, as is appropriate.

original: de nyid gyi  phyir rdzas gcig pu ni med do zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de nyid gyi  phyir rdzas gcig pu ni med do zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: For that very reason, it is said, ‚ÄúThere is no single substance.‚Äù

analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te tshe'i dbang po rdzas su yod par gyur na ni zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Otherwise, if the life faculty were a substance,

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: what would it be?

original: srog dag byin gyis brlabs nas tshe dag gtong ngo zhes gsungs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srog dag byin gyis brlabs nas tshe dag gtong ngo zhes gsungs par 'gyur ro //
translated: and then he consecrated his life and gave up his life.

original: 'chi ba la mnga' ba nyid du bstan pa'i phyir ni zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba la mnga' ba nyid 'di la yod pas so //
analyzed: 'chi ba la mnga' ba nyid du bstan pa'i phyir ni zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba la mnga' ba nyid 'di la yod pas so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause he demonstrated mastery over death‚Äù means that he had mastery over death.

original: zla ba gsum kho na byin gyis brlabs kyi mtshang ba dang lhag pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: zla ba gsum kho na byin gyis brlabs kyi mtshang ba dang lhag pa ni ma yin no //
translated: He consecrated only three months, not more or less.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For this very reason,

original: 'dul ba'i don med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: 'dul ba'i don med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: he said, ‚Äúbecause there would be no purpose in taming them.‚Äù

original: dus de tsam gyis rab bzang gi rgyud yongs su smin pa'i phyir zla ba @116b gsum gong ma 'og tu byin gyis brlabs pa la dgos pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: dus de tsam gyis rab bzang gi rgyud yongs su smin pa'i phyir zla ba @116b gsum gong ma 'og tu byin gyis brlabs pa la dgos pa mi mnga'o //
translated: Since only that much time was required to ripen Subhadra‚Äôs mind stream, there was no purpose in consecrating more or less than three months.

original: gang yang rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /üîΩ'du na pa dang / sems dang / brtson 'grus dang / dpyod pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa ste /
analyzed: gang yang rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la / 'du na pa dang / sems dang / brtson 'grus dang / dpyod pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa ste /
translated: The passage that begins with ‚ÄúThe bases of supernatural power‚Äù explains the bases of supernatural power.

original: rdzu 'phrul yang yin la /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul yang yin la /
translated: The bases of supernatural power are concentration that is accompanied by the desire, the mind, the effort, and the investigation of analysis.üîΩThey are supernatural powers because they are the feet or bases of supernatural power.

analyzed: rkang pa yang yin pas rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'o //

original: rkang pa'i don ni rten gyi don te /
analyzed: rkang pa'i don ni rten gyi don te /

original: rdzu 'phrul ni yon tan thams cad gyi  rten yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul ni yon tan thams cad gyi  rten yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: 'dod na bskal pa'am bskal pa las lhag par zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dod na bskal pa'am bskal pa las lhag par zhes bya ba la /

original: bskal pa ni gcig chang ba'o //
analyzed: bskal pa ni gcig chang ba'o //

original: bskal pa las lhag pa ni bskal pa las lhag pa ste /
analyzed: bskal pa las lhag pa ni bskal pa las lhag pa ste /

original: bskal pa las bla lhag ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bskal pa las bla lhag ces bya ba'i don to //

original: de yang bsgrub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la ni zhal gyis bzhes pa bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang bsgrub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la ni zhal gyis bzhes pa bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And for the sake of accomplishing that, he manifests the acceptance of the offering.

original: de lta ma yin na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na /
translated: Otherwise,

translated: The four types of mental factors that are karmic maturation are the four: the karmic maturation of karmic maturation, the karmic maturation of a universal mental factor, the karmic maturation of a virtuous mental factor, and the karmic maturation of a nonvirtuous mental factor.üîΩThe four types of mental factors that are karmic maturation are the four: the karmic maturation of karmic maturation, the karmic maturation of a universal mental factor, the karmic maturation of a virtuous mental factor, and the karmic maturation of a nonvirtuous mental factor.

translated: The four types of mental factors that are karmic maturation are the four: the karmic maturation of karmic maturation, the karmic maturation of a universal mental factor, the karmic maturation of a virtuous mental factor, and the karmic maturation of a nonvirtuous mental factor.üîΩThe four types of mental factors that are karmic maturation are the four: the karmic maturation of karmic maturation, the karmic maturation of a universal mental factor, the karmic maturation of a virtuous mental factor, and the karmic maturation of a nonvirtuous mental factor.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams na ni spyod lam la sogs pa med pa'i phyir gsum ka yang med do //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams na ni spyod lam la sogs pa med pa'i phyir gsum ka yang med do //
translated: The four types of mental factors that are karmic maturation are the four: the karmic maturation of karmic maturation, the karmic maturation of a universal mental factor, the karmic maturation of a virtuous mental factor, and the karmic maturation of a nonvirtuous mental factor.üîΩThe four types of mental factors that are karmic maturation are the four: the karmic maturation of karmic maturation, the karmic maturation of a universal mental factor, the karmic maturation of a virtuous mental factor, and the karmic maturation of a nonvirtuous mental factor.üîΩThe four types of mental factors that are karmic maturation are the four: the karmic maturation of karmic maturation, the karmic maturation of a universal mental factor

original: de la 'dod pa na spyod pa'i spyod lam pa dang / bzo'i gnas pa la ni yid dang / yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms kyi dbang po dag go //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa na spyod pa'i spyod lam pa dang / bzo'i gnas pa la ni yid dang / yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms kyi dbang po dag go //
translated: In the realm of desire, the two, the attitude of the life-cycle and the attitude of craftsmanship, are accompanied by the mental faculty and the faculties of pleasure, mental pleasure, and indifference.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal gnyis ka ni med de /
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal gnyis ka ni med de /
translated: They are not accompanied by the faculties of suffering and frustration,

original: de dag ni 'dod pa'i khams rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga pa yin pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni 'dod pa'i khams rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga pa yin pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid yin no //
translated: because they are the five consciousnesses of the realm of desire and are therefore without conceptualization.

original: 'di gnyis ni rtog pa dang bcas pa yang yin no //
analyzed: 'di gnyis ni rtog pa dang bcas pa yang yin no //
translated: They are also accompanied by the faculty of coming to know the unknown.

original: yid mi bde ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: yid mi bde ba yang ma yin te /
translated: They are not accompanied by the faculty of mental pleasure,

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are virtuous or nonvirtuous.

original: gzugs na spyod pa'i spyod lam pa la ni yid dang / bde ba dang / yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms @117b kyi dbang po rnams so //
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa'i spyod lam pa la ni yid dang / bde ba dang / yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms @117b kyi dbang po rnams so //
translated: In the realm of form, the attitude of the life-cycle is accompanied by the mental faculty and the faculties of pleasure, mental pleasure, and indifference.

original: de la ni bsam gtan gsum pa'i yid kyis pa'i bde ba yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de la ni bsam gtan gsum pa'i yid kyis pa'i bde ba yod pa yin no //
translated: In the third meditation, it is accompanied by the faculty of pleasure of the third meditation.

original: sprul pa ni sa lnga char la yang yid dang / btang snyoms kyi dbang po gnyis so //
analyzed: sprul pa ni sa lnga char la yang yid dang / btang snyoms kyi dbang po gnyis so //
translated: Emanation is accompanied by the mental faculty and the faculty of indifference in all five stages.

original: bde ba dang / yid bde ba'i dbang po gnyis ni med de /
analyzed: bde ba dang / yid bde ba'i dbang po gnyis ni med de /
translated: The two faculties of pleasure and mental pleasure do not exist there,

original: sbyor ba'i khyad par gyi bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i khyad par gyi bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are to be established by a special application.

original: lhag ma rnams ni rnam par smin pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni rnam par smin pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The remaining faculties are not karmic maturation.

original: dad pa la sogs pa brgyad dang / yid mi bde ba'o //
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa brgyad dang / yid mi bde ba'o //
translated: The eight beginning with faith and mental dissatisfaction.

original: yang ji ltar de rnams rnam par smin pa ma yin par grub ce na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar de rnams rnam par smin pa ma yin par grub ce na /
translated: How are they established as not being karmic maturation?

original: gcig tu rnam par smin pa nyid dang / rnam par smin pa dang / rnam par smin pa ma yin pa yang yin pa bstan pa las so //
analyzed: gcig tu rnam par smin pa nyid dang / rnam par smin pa dang / rnam par smin pa ma yin pa yang yin pa bstan pa las so //
translated: Because it is taught that they are exclusively karmic maturation, or both karmic maturation and not karmic maturation.

original: de ltar na srog gi dbang po ni rnam par smin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de ltar na srog gi dbang po ni rnam par smin pa kho na'o //
translated: Thus the faculty of life force is only karmic maturation.

original: dgu ni rnam par smin pa ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: dgu ni rnam par smin pa ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: Nine are only not karmic maturation.

original: bcu gnyis ni rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: bcu gnyis ni rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: Twelve are of two types.

original: mdo 'di ltar drang zhe na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mdo 'di ltar drang zhe na zhes bya ba la /
translated: If this s≈´tra is interpreted in this way,

original: gal te yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms myong bar 'gyur ba'i las ltar yid mi bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba yid mi bde ba'i rnam par smin pa can du mi 'dod pa de'i phyir mdo dang 'gal lo zhes ston to //
analyzed: gal te yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms myong bar 'gyur ba'i las ltar yid mi bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba yid mi bde ba'i rnam par smin pa can du mi 'dod pa de'i phyir mdo dang 'gal lo zhes ston to //
translated: If you do not accept that unpleasant feeling has unpleasant karmic maturation, like pleasant feeling and neutral feeling, then you contradict the sutras.

original: bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i reg pa ltar mtshungs par ldan pa'i myong bar 'gyur ba'i dpang du mdzad nas gsungs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i reg pa ltar mtshungs par ldan pa'i myong bar 'gyur ba'i dpang du mdzad nas gsungs pa yin gyi /
translated: The sutra states that pleasant feeling is experienced through contact that is to be experienced as pleasure, but it does not state that pleasant feeling is karmic maturation.

original: rnam par smin pa myong bar 'gyur ba'i dbang du mdzad nas ni ma yin pas mdo dang 'gal ba med do //üîΩlas 'di la yid mi bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa myong bar 'gyur ba'i dbang du mdzad nas ni ma yin pas mdo dang 'gal ba med do // las 'di la yid mi bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Therefore there is no contradiction with the sutra.

original: yid bde ba dang mtshungs par myong bar 'gyur ba ste /üîΩmtshungs par ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yid bde ba dang mtshungs par myong bar 'gyur ba ste / mtshungs par ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This action is to be experienced as unpleasant feeling or to be experienced as pleasure.üîΩTo be experienced as pleasure means to be concomitant with pleasure.

original: myong 'gyur rnam pa lnga zhes bya //
analyzed: myong 'gyur rnam pa lnga zhes bya //
translated: This is the meaning of to be experienced.

original: zhes phyi nas 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes phyi nas 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: It will be explained later thatüîΩfeeling is fivefold.

original: 'o na ni yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na ni yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is so, then pleasant feeling and neutral feelingüîΩare not karmic maturation.

original: las kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /üîΩyid mi bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i las bzhin du yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyang /
analyzed: las kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / yid mi bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i las bzhin du yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyang /
translated: Also karma and so on.üîΩKarma to be experienced as mental satisfaction and equanimity is like karma to be experienced as mental dissatisfaction.üîΩ

original: yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i las ni yid bde ba dang btang snyoms myong bar 'gyur ba'i las so zhes mtshungs par ldan pa'i myong bar 'gyur ba kho na'i dbang du mdzad nas ston par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i las ni yid bde ba dang btang snyoms myong bar 'gyur ba'i las so zhes mtshungs par ldan pa'i myong bar 'gyur ba kho na'i dbang du mdzad nas ston par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Also karma that is associated with mental satisfaction and equanimity is karma to be experienced as mental satisfaction and equanimity, respectively, because it is taught that karma to be experienced as mental satisfaction is associated with mental satisfaction, and so on.

original: de ltar na yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms gnyis kyang yid mi bde ba dang 'dra bar rnam par smin pa ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms gnyis kyang yid mi bde ba dang 'dra bar rnam par smin pa ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: But if that were so, then mental satisfaction and equanimity would not be karmic maturation, like mental dissatisfaction,

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //üîΩji ltar dga' ba de lta yin la rag ste zhes bya ba ni gnyis @118a * //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro // ji ltar dga' ba de lta yin la rag ste zhes bya ba ni gnyis @118a * //
translated: because they would be associated with virtuous and nonvirtuous karma.

original: ka ltar yang 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ka ltar yang 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But if you say that this is so, then there is no contradiction.

original: yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms myong bar 'gyur ba'i las zhes bya ba ni yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms kyi rnam par smin pa can dang / yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan pa zhes bya ba gnyis ka ltar yang 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms myong bar 'gyur ba'i las zhes bya ba ni yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms kyi rnam par smin pa can dang / yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan pa zhes bya ba gnyis ka ltar yang 'gal ba med do //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúkarma to be experienced as mental satisfaction and equanimity‚Äù is not contradictory in either of the following senses: (1) karma that has mental satisfaction and equanimity as its ripening result and (2) karma that is concomitant with mental satisfaction and equanimity.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar dga' ba de ltar yin la rag go //üîΩgo skabs med pas de ni de ltar shes so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar dga' ba de ltar yin la rag go // go skabs med pas de ni de ltar shes so zhes bya ba la /
translated: Therefore, it is as you say.

original: go skabs med pa ni mi srid pa'o //
analyzed: go skabs med pa ni mi srid pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause there is no opportunity‚Äù means that there is no possibility.

original: gal te yid mi bde ba ltar yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms dag la rnam par smin pa'i go skabs med par gyur na ni de'i phyir yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms dag kyang yid mi bde ba dang 'dra bar mtshungs par ldan pa'i myong ba'i dbang du mdzad nas bstan gyi /
analyzed: gal te yid mi bde ba ltar yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms dag la rnam par smin pa'i go skabs med par gyur na ni de'i phyir yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms dag kyang yid mi bde ba dang 'dra bar mtshungs par ldan pa'i myong ba'i dbang du mdzad nas bstan gyi /
translated: If there were no opportunity for mental satisfaction and equanimity to be ripening results, just as there is no opportunity for mental dissatisfaction to be a ripening result, then mental satisfaction and equanimity would be taught as being experienced in the same way that mental dissatisfaction is experienced.

original: rnam par smin par myong bar 'gyur ba'i dbang du mdzad nas ma yin pa de ltar shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par smin par myong bar 'gyur ba'i dbang du mdzad nas ma yin pa de ltar shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: It should be understood that this is stated from the perspective of the karma to be experienced as karmic maturation, not from the perspective of the karma to be experienced as a concomitant state.

original: yang na 'di ni don gzhan yin te /
analyzed: yang na 'di ni don gzhan yin te /
translated: Or this has a different meaning:

original: go skabs med pas na yid mi bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i las de ni mtshungs par ldan pa'i myong bar 'gyur ba'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs so zhes bya ba de ltar shes te /
analyzed: go skabs med pas na yid mi bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i las de ni mtshungs par ldan pa'i myong bar 'gyur ba'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs so zhes bya ba de ltar shes te /
translated: It should be understood that karma to be experienced as mental dissatisfaction is stated from the perspective of the karma to be experienced as a concomitant state, because there is no opportunity for that.

original: gang las yid mi bde bar myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyang yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms myong bar 'gyur ba'i las dang 'dra bar rnam par smin pa myong bar 'gyur ba'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs so zhes bya bar shes par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: gang las yid mi bde bar myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyang yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms myong bar 'gyur ba'i las dang 'dra bar rnam par smin pa myong bar 'gyur ba'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs so zhes bya bar shes par 'gyur ba /
translated: It should be understood that karma to be experienced as mental dissatisfaction is stated from the perspective of the karma to be experienced as karmic maturation, just as karma to be experienced as mental satisfaction and equanimity is stated from the perspective of the karma to be experienced as karmic maturation.

original: yid mi bde ba la ni yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms ltar rnam par smin pa srid pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yid mi bde ba la ni yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms ltar rnam par smin pa srid pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is not possible for mental satisfaction and equanimity to be the karmic maturation of karma to be experienced as mental dissatisfaction.

original: tshig tsam gyis dad par mi 'gyur bar de'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i go skabs zlog par byed pa'i rgyu dris pa ni /
analyzed: tshig tsam gyis dad par mi 'gyur bar de'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i go skabs zlog par byed pa'i rgyu dris pa ni /
translated: In order to generate faith that is not merely verbal, he asks the reason for the reversal of the opportunity for karmic maturation.

original: 'di la rigs pa ci zhig yod //
analyzed: 'di la rigs pa ci zhig yod //
translated: What is the logic here?

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: and so on.

original: rgyu smras pa ni /
analyzed: rgyu smras pa ni /
translated: The reason is stated:

original: yid mi bde ba de ni zhes rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: yid mi bde ba de ni zhes rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
translated: That mental dissatisfaction is...and so on.

original: yid mi bde ba ni yid du mi 'ongs pas bsam pa la sogs pa kun du rtog pa'i khyad par dag gis skyed par byed cing zhi bar byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: yid mi bde ba ni yid du mi 'ongs pas bsam pa la sogs pa kun du rtog pa'i khyad par dag gis skyed par byed cing zhi bar byed pa yin gyi /
translated: Mental dissatisfaction is produced and pacified by specific conceptions of unpleasant thoughts and so on,

original: rnam par smin pa ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: but karmic maturation is not like that.

original: mig la sogs pa rnam par smin pa ni rnam par rtog pa la mi ltos pa las kyi 'phen pa'i dbang gis 'jug pa dang / ldog pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa rnam par smin pa ni rnam par rtog pa la mi ltos pa las kyi 'phen pa'i dbang gis 'jug pa dang / ldog pa nyid yin no //
translated: Karmic maturation of the eyes and so on is engaged and withdrawn by the power of karmic projection, without depending on conception.

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: Thus,

original: yid bde pa yang de dang 'dra //
analyzed: yid bde pa yang de dang 'dra //
translated: mental satisfaction is also like that.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'khrul par ston te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'khrul par ston te /
translated: This shows the error.

original: yid bde ba yang yid du 'ong ba bsam pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dag gis skyed par byed cing zhi bar byed pa yin mod @118b kyi ;
analyzed: yid bde ba yang yid du 'ong ba bsam pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dag gis skyed par byed cing zhi bar byed pa yin mod @118b kyi ;
translated: and mental pleasure is generated and pacified by the conception of desirable objects, etc.

original: 'on kyang rnam par smin par 'dod pas 'di ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang rnam par smin par 'dod pas 'di ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: However, it is not reasonable to assert that mental pleasure is karmic maturation.

original: yid mi bde ba rnam par smin pa ma yin pa nyid du bsgrubs ba la rigs pa nus pa dang ldan pa gzhan smra ba ni /
analyzed: yid mi bde ba rnam par smin pa ma yin pa nyid du bsgrubs ba la rigs pa nus pa dang ldan pa gzhan smra ba ni /
translated: Another argument is presented to prove that mental dissatisfaction is not karmic maturation:

original: 'o na gal te yid mi bde ba zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'o na gal te yid mi bde ba zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
translated: If mental dissatisfaction is not karmic maturation, then what is?

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore,

original: mtshams med pa'i rgyu can gyis yid mi bde ba skye bas las de rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshams med pa'i rgyu can gyis yid mi bde ba skye bas las de rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: mental dissatisfaction that is the cause of the heinous acts arises and that karma ripens.

original: de ltar na mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar na mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur ba yin gyi /
translated: Thus it is experienced in the current life,

original: skyes nas myong bar 'gyur pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: skyes nas myong bar 'gyur pa yang ma yin no //
translated: but not necessarily experienced after rebirth.

original: yid bde ba yang de dang 'dra ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yid bde ba yang de dang 'dra ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: Mental pleasure is similar to that.

original: skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba'i las dge ba mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur ba nyid yin na mi rung bas /
analyzed: skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba'i las dge ba mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur ba nyid yin na mi rung bas /
translated: It is untenable that virtuous karma to be experienced after rebirth is karma to be experienced in the current life.üîΩTherefore, just as mental dissatisfaction, mental satisfaction should not be asserted to be karmic maturation.üîΩBut if you say that mental dissatisfaction is not karmic maturation, you must state another reason.

original: yid mi bde ba bzhin du yid bde ba yang rnam par smin par khas blang bar mi bya'o zhes de ltar 'khrul par smras pa dang / yang yid mi bde ba rnam par smin pa ma yin pa nyid la rgyu gzhan smras pa ni /
analyzed: yid mi bde ba bzhin du yid bde ba yang rnam par smin par khas blang bar mi bya'o zhes de ltar 'khrul par smras pa dang / yang yid mi bde ba rnam par smin pa ma yin pa nyid la rgyu gzhan smras pa ni /
translated: If you say that mental dissatisfaction is not karmic maturation,üîΩthen why does the Abhidharma say:

original: 'o na 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'o na 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
translated: The mental faculty and the feeling of equanimity are karmic maturation.üîΩThe mental faculty and the feeling of equanimity are karmic maturation because they are not karmic maturation in the desire realm.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams la ni sdug bsngal gyi dbang po ltar yid mi bde ba rjes su 'jug pa yin te /üîΩston pa mya ngan las 'das kyang bdag la mya ngan la sogs pa mi 'byung ngo zhes mdo las bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams la ni sdug bsngal gyi dbang po ltar yid mi bde ba rjes su 'jug pa yin te / ston pa mya ngan las 'das kyang bdag la mya ngan la sogs pa mi 'byung ngo zhes mdo las bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But mental dissatisfaction is not karmic maturation because it is not like the faculty of pain.

original: rnam par smin pa ni de lta ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ni de lta ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: But if you say that mental dissatisfaction is not karmic maturation, then why does the Abhidharma say:üîΩThe mental faculty and the feeling of equanimity are karmic maturation?

original: mig la sogs pa rnam par smin pa ni 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams la ldog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa rnam par smin pa ni 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams la ldog pa ma yin no //
translated: The eye faculty and so on do not cease for those free from attachment.

original: dgos pa med pa'i phyir na dge ba mngon du byed pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dgos pa med pa'i phyir na dge ba mngon du byed pa yang ma yin te /
translated: They do not manifest virtue because there is no need for them.

original: de ni yid bde ba dang 'dra bar phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni yid bde ba dang 'dra bar phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: They are not like mental satisfaction, which is helpful.

original: de dag gi yid bde ba zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: de dag gi yid bde ba zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Mental satisfaction of those free from attachmentüîΩis not virtuous or karmic maturation.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams la yid bde ba dge ba snyoms par 'jug pas bsdus pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi yon tan bsam pa'i rgyu can yod mod kyi /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams la yid bde ba dge ba snyoms par 'jug pas bsdus pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi yon tan bsam pa'i rgyu can yod mod kyi /
translated: Mental satisfaction of those free from attachment is virtuous and subsumed by meditative equipoise and it is the cause for contemplating the qualities of the Buddha.

original: dge ba rnam par smin pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dge ba rnam par smin pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not virtuous karmic maturation.

original: de'i phyir de dag gi yid bde ba lung du ma bstan pa rnam par smin pa ji lta bu yin pa brjod par bya dgos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag gi yid bde ba lung du ma bstan pa rnam par smin pa ji lta bu yin pa brjod par bya dgos te /
translated: Therefore it must be said that the karmic maturation of their neutral mental satisfaction is like this.

original: de kun du 'byung ba ni yongs su gcad du med do //
analyzed: de kun du 'byung ba ni yongs su gcad du med do //
translated: But it is impossible to determine the extent of its occurrence.üîΩWhatever it is,

original: ci 'dra yang rung ste zhes bya brgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: ci 'dra yang rung ste zhes bya brgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: it is said:

original: yid bde ba ni kun du 'byung ba srid pas rnam par smin pa'i go skabs yod de /
analyzed: yid bde ba ni kun du 'byung ba srid pas rnam par smin pa'i go skabs yod de /
translated: Since mental satisfaction is possible in all realms, it is possible that it is a karmic maturation.

original: de ni gang gi tshe res 'ga' phyi rol gyi rgyu mtshan med pa ni kun du rtog pa med par skye ste /
analyzed: de ni gang gi tshe res 'ga' phyi rol gyi rgyu mtshan med pa ni kun du rtog pa med par skye ste /
translated: Sometimes it arises without external objects, for example, when one imagines something.

original: lung du ma bstan pa rnam par smin pa ni de lta bu yin no //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa rnam par smin pa ni de lta bu yin no //
translated: This is the type of neutral karmic maturation.

original: yid mi bde ba ni rnam pa thams cad du yang @119a * //
analyzed: yid mi bde ba ni rnam pa thams cad du yang @119a * //
translated: Mental dissatisfaction never occurs in the formless realm.üîΩSince it never occurs in the formless realm,

original: kun du mi 'byung bas zhes bya ba 'byung ba la /
analyzed: kun du mi 'byung bas zhes bya ba 'byung ba la /
translated: it is not a karmic maturation.

original: dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa yin na /
analyzed: dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa yin na /
translated: If it is virtuous and neutral,

original: dge ba go ga las yin /
analyzed: dge ba go ga las yin /
translated: how can it be virtuous?

original: lung las kyang ste /
analyzed: lung las kyang ste /
translated: It is also stated in the scriptures:

original: gang la brten nas yid bde ba rnam par smin pa so sor yang dag par myong bar byed ces gsungs kyi /
analyzed: gang la brten nas yid bde ba rnam par smin pa so sor yang dag par myong bar byed ces gsungs kyi /
translated: ‚ÄúOne experiences the karmic maturation of mental satisfaction that is based on that.‚Äù

original: de ltar nag po'i phyogs la ni gang la brten nas yid mi bde ba rnam par smin pa so sor yang dag par myong bar byed ces ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar nag po'i phyogs la ni gang la brten nas yid mi bde ba rnam par smin pa so sor yang dag par myong bar byed ces ma yin no //
translated: But it is not stated that ‚ÄúOne experiences the karmic maturation of mental dissatisfaction that is based on that‚Äù in the same way for the dark side.

original: de'i phyir lung dang rigs pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir lung dang rigs pa las /
translated: Therefore, it is not a karmic maturation.

original: yid mi bde ba rnam par smin pa ma yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
analyzed: yid mi bde ba rnam par smin pa ma yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
translated: It is established that mental dissatisfaction is not karmic maturation.

original: de la brgyad pa srog gi dbang po dang ldan pa rnams ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: de la brgyad pa srog gi dbang po dang ldan pa rnams ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Those possessing the eighth, the faculty of life force, possess eight faculties.

original: mig la sogs pa pho'i dpang po'i mthar thug pa rnams ni brgyad pa srog gi dbang po dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa pho'i dpang po'i mthar thug pa rnams ni brgyad pa srog gi dbang po dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Those possessing the eighth, the faculty of life force, possess eight faculties, from the eye faculty up to the male faculty.

original: bde 'gro ni lha dang mi'o //
analyzed: bde 'gro ni lha dang mi'o //
translated: Happy rebirths are gods and humans.

original: ngan 'gro ni ngan song gsum mo //
analyzed: ngan 'gro ni ngan song gsum mo //
translated: Bad rebirths are the three lower rebirths.

original: yid kyi dbang po ni gnyis kar zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yid kyi dbang po ni gnyis kar zhes bya ba la /
translated: The mental faculty is in both.

original: gnyis ka zhes bya ba ni bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro dag tu'o //
analyzed: gnyis ka zhes bya ba ni bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro dag tu'o //
translated: Both refers to happy and bad rebirths.

original: gnyis ka'i zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i ste /
analyzed: gnyis ka'i zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i ste /
translated: Both refers to virtuous and nonvirtuous.

original: gang gi tshe yid kyi dbang po rnam par smin pa las skyes pa sdug bsngal dang mtshungs par ldan par gyur pa de'i tshe ni /
analyzed: gang gi tshe yid kyi dbang po rnam par smin pa las skyes pa sdug bsngal dang mtshungs par ldan par gyur pa de'i tshe ni /
translated: When the mental faculty arises as karmic maturation and is concomitant with pain,

original: bde 'gro 'am ngan 'gro na nyes par spyad pa'i rnam par smin pa'o //
analyzed: bde 'gro 'am ngan 'gro na nyes par spyad pa'i rnam par smin pa'o //
translated: it is the karmic maturation of misconduct in happy or bad rebirths.

original: gang gi tshe rnam par smin pa las skyes pa bde ba dang / yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan par gyur pa de'i tshe ni dge ba'i yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rnam par smin pa las skyes pa bde ba dang / yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan par gyur pa de'i tshe ni dge ba'i yin no //
translated: When it is concomitant with pleasure, mental satisfaction, or equanimity that arises from karmic maturation, then it is virtuous.

original: bde ba dang / yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms kyi dbang po rnams ni dge ba'i rnam par smin pa yin no zhes bya bar ni dmyal ba dag ma gtogs pa'i bde 'gro 'am ngan 'gro na'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang / yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms kyi dbang po rnams ni dge ba'i rnam par smin pa yin no zhes bya bar ni dmyal ba dag ma gtogs pa'i bde 'gro 'am ngan 'gro na'o //
translated: The faculties of pleasure, mental satisfaction, and equanimity are the karmic maturation of virtue.

original: sdug bsngal gyi dbang po ni mi dge ba'i zhes bya ba ni bde 'gro dang / ngan 'gro dag tu'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi dbang po ni mi dge ba'i zhes bya ba ni bde 'gro dang / ngan 'gro dag tu'o //
translated: The faculty of pain is nonvirtuous.

original: brgyad pa srog gi dbang po dang ldan pa rnams ni bde 'gro ni dge ba'i rnam par smin pa yin la zhes bshad nas /
analyzed: brgyad pa srog gi dbang po dang ldan pa rnams ni bde 'gro ni dge ba'i rnam par smin pa yin la zhes bshad nas /
translated: The eighth, the faculty of life force, is the karmic maturation of virtue in happy realms.

original: mtshan gnyis pa'i dbang po gnyis bde 'gro na dge ba'i rnam par smin pa ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: mtshan gnyis pa'i dbang po gnyis bde 'gro na dge ba'i rnam par smin pa ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: How can the two faculties of the two sexual organs be the karmic maturation of virtue in happy realms?

original: de'i phyir / bde 'gro na zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / bde 'gro na zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: Therefore he says,üîΩIn happy realms, the two sexual organs are the karmic maturation of virtue.

original: bde 'gro na ste mi dag gi nang nas mi dge ba'i las kyis dbang po gnyis po de rjes su mi 'tsham pa'i gnas su rnyed pa yin te /
analyzed: bde 'gro na ste mi dag gi nang nas mi dge ba'i las kyis dbang po gnyis po de rjes su mi 'tsham pa'i gnas su rnyed pa yin te /
translated: In the happy realms, i.e., among humans, these two faculties are obtained in an inappropriate place due to nonvirtuous karma.

original: de ni sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed do //
analyzed: de ni sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed do //
translated: This is an unmanifest form that is not associated with mind.

original: dbang po ni lus kyi dbang po'i phyogs yin pa'i phyir dge ba kho na'i yin te /
analyzed: dbang po ni lus kyi dbang po'i phyogs yin pa'i phyir dge ba kho na'i yin te /
translated: The faculty of life force is virtuous alone because it is a part of the faculty of body.

original: lus kyi dbang po bzhin du bde 'gro na gcig tu dge ba'i kho na'i rnam par smin pa @119b yin no ;
analyzed: lus kyi dbang po bzhin du bde 'gro na gcig tu dge ba'i kho na'i rnam par smin pa @119b yin no ;
translated: Like the faculty of body, it is the result of exclusively virtuous karma in the happy realms.

original: / de nyid kyi phyir /üîΩdbang po ni ma yin te /
analyzed: / de nyid kyi phyir / dbang po ni ma yin te /
translated: Therefore it is said,

original: dge bas 'phangs pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: dge bas 'phangs pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: It is not a faculty because it is projected by virtue.

original: dbang po du ni rnam par smin pa dang bcas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /üîΩrnam par smin pa dang lhan cig pa ni rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa dag ste /
analyzed: dbang po du ni rnam par smin pa dang bcas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / rnam par smin pa dang lhan cig pa ni rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa dag ste /
translated: How many faculties are with result?üîΩThose that are with result are with result and cause.

original: gang dag la rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu yod pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang dag la rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu yod pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Those that have a ripened result are called with result.üîΩHow many are with result?

original: gang 'di dag mi bde ba rnam par smin pa ma yin no zhes bshad ma thag pa de gcig ni /
analyzed: gang 'di dag mi bde ba rnam par smin pa ma yin no zhes bshad ma thag pa de gcig ni /
translated: The immediately preceding explanation that these are not karmic maturation is as follows.

original: rnam par smin bcas de gcig pu ni rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: rnam par smin bcas de gcig pu ni rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa kho na yin te /
translated: Only that is karmic maturation.

original: lung du ma bstan pa dang / zag pa med pa rnams kho na rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir dang / de ni gnyis ka las log pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa dang / zag pa med pa rnams kho na rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir dang / de ni gnyis ka las log pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is only karmic maturation because neutral and uncontaminated states are not karmic maturation and it is the opposite of both.

original: ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni kho na zhes bya ba'i don dang zhes bya ba ni nges par gzung ba'i don dang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni kho na zhes bya ba'i don dang zhes bya ba ni nges par gzung ba'i don dang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The term ‚Äúonly‚Äù means ‚Äúalone‚Äù and ‚Äúalone‚Äù means ‚Äúexclusively.‚Äù

original: rim pa gzhan du sbyar ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rim pa gzhan du sbyar ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The term ‚Äúapplied in a different order‚Äù means

original: de gcig pu /
analyzed: de gcig pu /
translated: that is only

original: rnam par smin bcas ni /
analyzed: rnam par smin bcas ni /
translated: karmic maturation.

original: zhes mthar rig par bya ste zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes mthar rig par bya ste zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of ‚Äúshould be understood.‚Äù

original: rim pa gzhan du sbyar na ni ji skad bshad pa'i nges par gzung bar rig ste /
analyzed: rim pa gzhan du sbyar na ni ji skad bshad pa'i nges par gzung bar rig ste /
translated: If applied in a different order, it should be understood as the exclusive meaning explained above.

original: de lta ma yin na de kho na rnam par smin pa dang bcas so zhes bya bar nges par gzung bar shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na de kho na rnam par smin pa dang bcas so zhes bya bar nges par gzung bar shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were not so, then it would be understood that only that is karmic maturation.

original: de lta na gzhan dag rnam par smin pa med par thal bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: de lta na gzhan dag rnam par smin pa med par thal bar 'gyur bas /
translated: In that case, it would follow that others are not karmic maturation,

original: bcu rnam gnyis zhes brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: bcu rnam gnyis zhes brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: so it should not be said that ten are of two types.

original: yid mi bde ba rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba gang yin pa 'di la rgyu ci yod ce na /
analyzed: yid mi bde ba rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba gang yin pa 'di la rgyu ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the reason for saying that mental dissatisfaction is only karmic maturation?üîΩTherefore, it is said:

original: de'i phyir / de ni lung du ma bstan pa yang med la zhes bya ba rgya bar 'byung ste /üîΩsa bon rul ba bzhin du lung du ma bstan pa ni rnam par smin pa med pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir / de ni lung du ma bstan pa yang med la zhes bya ba rgya bar 'byung ste / sa bon rul ba bzhin du lung du ma bstan pa ni rnam par smin pa med pa yin la /
translated: It is not neutral,üîΩLike a rotten seed, a neutral state has no karmic maturation.

original: zag pa med pa yang sa bo na grung po rlan gyis ma brlan pa ltar sred pa ma brlan pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa med pa yin na /
analyzed: zag pa med pa yang sa bo na grung po rlan gyis ma brlan pa ltar sred pa ma brlan pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa med pa yin na /
translated: Also, uncontaminated states have no karmic maturation because they are not moistened by craving, like a fertile seed that is not moistened.

original: yid mi bde ba ni dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir dang / mi dge ba yin pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: yid mi bde ba ni dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir dang / mi dge ba yin pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: Mental dissatisfaction is accompanied by ripening because it is virtuous contaminated or nonvirtuous.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i med pa la rgyu smras pa ste /
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i med pa la rgyu smras pa ste /
translated: Because it is not equipoise, means that it is stated as the cause of uncontaminated states that are not equipoise.

original: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i zag pa med pa 'dus byas ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i zag pa med pa 'dus byas ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Uncontaminated states that are conditioned and not equipoise do not exist.

original: bcu rnam gnyis zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bcu rnam gnyis zhes bya ba la /
translated: Ten are of two types.

original: bcu kho na rnam pa gnyis yin no zhes bya bar nges par gzung bas gzhan rnam pa gcig go zhes bya bar grub par 'gyur ro //üîΩyid dang tshor gzhan dad la sogs //
analyzed: bcu kho na rnam pa gnyis yin no zhes bya bar nges par gzung bas gzhan rnam pa gcig go zhes bya bar grub par 'gyur ro // yid dang tshor gzhan dad la sogs //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúonly ten are of two types‚Äù is a restrictive statement. It is established that the others are of one type.üîΩThe mental faculty, the other feelings, and faith and so on.

original: zhes bya ba ni yid dang / tshor ba gzhan dang / dad pa la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni yid dang / tshor ba gzhan dang / dad pa la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The mental faculty, the other feelings, and faith and so on.

original: tshor ba ni @120a * //
analyzed: tshor ba ni @120a * //
translated: Feeling is the experience of an object.

original: rig pa'o // gzhan smos pa ni yid mi bde ba ma gtogs pa'i tshor ba gzung ste /
analyzed: rig pa'o // gzhan smos pa ni yid mi bde ba ma gtogs pa'i tshor ba gzung ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe other feelings‚Äù refers to the feelings that are not mental dissatisfaction.

original: yid mi bde ba bshad zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid mi bde ba bshad zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Mental dissatisfaction is already included in the phrase ‚Äúthe other feelings.‚Äù

original: dad pa la sogs pa ni ste /
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa ni ste /
translated: Faith and so on are the five faculties of faith, diligence, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom.

original: gzung ngo zhes skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: gzung ngo zhes skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: The term ‚Äúgrasp‚Äù is supplied in the verse.

original: gzhan ni rnam par smin pa med pa yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
analyzed: gzhan ni rnam par smin pa med pa yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
translated: The remaining faculties are not karmic maturation.

original: gzhan gang zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan gang zhe na /
translated: Which faculties are the remaining ones?

original: dbang po bcu gcig go //
analyzed: dbang po bcu gcig go //
translated: The eleven faculties.

original: de la mig la sogs pa bdun dang / brgyad pa srog dang ldan pa rnams ni lung ma bstan pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la mig la sogs pa bdun dang / brgyad pa srog dang ldan pa rnams ni lung ma bstan pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa med pa ma yin no //
translated: The seven beginning with the eye faculty and the eighth, the vitality faculty, are not karmic maturation because they are indeterminate.

original: kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po la sogs pa gsum ni zag pa med pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa med pa'o //
analyzed: kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po la sogs pa gsum ni zag pa med pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa med pa'o //
translated: The three beginning with the faculty of understanding all are not karmic maturation because they are uncontaminated.

original: dge ba brgyad ces bya ba ma chags pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir dge ba kho na'o zhes bya bar gzung ste /
analyzed: dge ba brgyad ces bya ba ma chags pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir dge ba kho na'o zhes bya bar gzung ste /
translated: The eight virtuous faculties are only virtuous because they are concomitant with nonattachment and so on.

original: de dag las gzhan pa rnams kyang dge ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag las gzhan pa rnams kyang dge ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The remaining faculties are also virtuous.

original: yid mi bde ba rnam gnyis zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yid mi bde ba rnam gnyis zhes bya ba la /
translated: Mental dissatisfaction is twofold.

original: yid mi bde ba'i ni rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa'i phyir rnam pa gnyis kho na ste /
analyzed: yid mi bde ba'i ni rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa'i phyir rnam pa gnyis kho na ste /
translated: Mental dissatisfaction has two types, because it is associated with karmic maturation.üîΩIt was previously explained that it is not neutral.üîΩThe others are of three types.üîΩThe others are of three types.üîΩThe others are of three types.

original: sngar lung du ma bstan par med par bshad pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: sngar lung du ma bstan par med par bshad pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: The others are of three types.üîΩThe others are of three types.

original: / yid dang tshor gzhan ni /
analyzed: / yid dang tshor gzhan ni /
translated: The others are of three types.

original: rnam gsum zhes bya ba la /üîΩgzhan smos pas ni yid mi bde ba las gzhan pa'i tshor ba gzung ngo //üîΩdbang po lnga po 'di dag dge ba'i rtsa ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni dge ba'o //üîΩmi dge ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni mi dge ba'o //

analyzed: de dag las gzhan pa rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang / spyod lam dang / bzo'i gnas pa dang / sprul pa pa dag ni lung du ma bstan pa rnams so //

original: gzhan ni rnam pa gcig ces bya bar nges par gzung ngo //üîΩnges par ma bzung na ni cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan ni rnam pa gcig ces bya bar nges par gzung ngo //üîΩnges par ma bzung na ni cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: The others are of three types.üîΩThe others are of three

original: ci rnam pa gcig yin nam rnam pa gnyis yin snyam du the tshom za bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci rnam pa gcig yin nam rnam pa gnyis yin snyam du the tshom za bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One would doubt whether there is one or two aspects.

original: de lta na yang the tshom za bar kho na'o //
analyzed: de lta na yang the tshom za bar kho na'o //
translated: Even so, there is doubt.

original: cir zhe na /
analyzed: cir zhe na /
translated: What is the doubt?

original: dge ba'am / mi dge ba'am lung du ma bstan par ro //
analyzed: dge ba'am / mi dge ba'am lung du ma bstan par ro //
translated: Is it virtuous, nonvirtuous, or neutral?

original: lung ma bstan brgyad de dag nyid //
analyzed: lung ma bstan brgyad de dag nyid //
translated: The eight neutral ones are just those.

original: gzugs sgra ma gtogs zhes bya ba dang / srog ni rnam smin zhes bya ba dang / rnam smin lung du ma bstan zhes bya ba 'byung ba'i phyir the tshom za bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs sgra ma gtogs zhes bya ba dang / srog ni rnam smin zhes bya ba dang / rnam smin lung du ma bstan zhes bya ba 'byung ba'i phyir the tshom za bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because it is said that the faculties are neutral, and because it is said that form and sound are excluded, and because it is said that life force is karmic maturation, and because it is said that karmic maturation is neutral, there is no doubt.

original: dri med ma gtogs 'dod par gtogs //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dri med ma gtogs 'dod par gtogs // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Those belonging to the desire realm, except for the stainless.

original: dbang po thams cad 'dod par gtogs so zhes bya ba 'di ni spyir btang ba yin la /
analyzed: dbang po thams cad 'dod par gtogs so zhes bya ba 'di ni spyir btang ba yin la /
translated: All faculties belong to the desire realm. This is the general statement.

original: dri med ma gtogs zhes bya ba ni 'di'i dmigs kyis bsal ba'o //
analyzed: dri med ma gtogs zhes bya ba ni 'di'i dmigs kyis bsal ba'o //
translated: Except for the stainless is the specific exception.

original: de ltar na dri ma med pa kho na ma gtogs pa'i lhag ma ni 'dod par gtogs pa'o zhes bya bar grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na dri ma med pa kho na ma gtogs pa'i lhag ma ni 'dod par gtogs pa'o zhes bya bar grub pa yin no //
translated: Thus it is established that those remaining, except for the stainless, belong to the desire realm.

original: dri ma med @120b pa'i dbang po ma gtogs pa'i rgyu smras pa ni /
analyzed: dri ma med @120b pa'i dbang po ma gtogs pa'i rgyu smras pa ni /
translated: The cause of the faculties is stated, with the exception of the stainless faculties.

original: de ni ldan pa ma yin pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni ldan pa ma yin pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: They are not associated.

original: pho mo'i dbang dang sdug bsngal dag / ma gtogs gzugs gtogs dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: pho mo'i dbang dang sdug bsngal dag / ma gtogs gzugs gtogs dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The faculties of femininity and masculinity, and the faculties of pain and mental sorrow are not included in the form realm.

original: dri med dang zhes rjes su drang ba'i don te /
analyzed: dri med dang zhes rjes su drang ba'i don te /
translated: The word ‚Äústainless‚Äù is to be supplied.

original: ma gtogs zhes bya bar sbyar ro //üîΩsdug bsngal dag ces bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang / yid mi bde ba dag ste /
analyzed: ma gtogs zhes bya bar sbyar ro // sdug bsngal dag ces bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang / yid mi bde ba dag ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúincluded‚Äù is to be supplied.

original: gnyis ka yang rjes su mi mthun pa'i phyir sgra gcig gis brjod do //
analyzed: gnyis ka yang rjes su mi mthun pa'i phyir sgra gcig gis brjod do //
translated: The faculties of pain and mental sorrow are both mentioned by the single word ‚Äúpain‚Äù because they are both unpleasant.

original: gzugs kyi khams na ni mo dang pho dang / sdug bsngal dang / yid mi bde ba'i dbang po dag dang / sngar smos pa'i zag pa med pa gsum ma gtogs pa dbang po lhag ma'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams na ni mo dang pho dang / sdug bsngal dang / yid mi bde ba'i dbang po dag dang / sngar smos pa'i zag pa med pa gsum ma gtogs pa dbang po lhag ma'o //
translated: In the form realm, the faculties of femininity and masculinity, the faculties of pain and mental sorrow, and the three stainless faculties mentioned previously are excluded. The remaining faculties are included in the form realm.

original: mi mdzes par byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mdoms kyi sba ba sbubs su nub pa rnams kyis ci'i phyir mi mdzes te /
analyzed: mi mdzes par byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mdoms kyi sba ba sbubs su nub pa rnams kyis ci'i phyir mi mdzes te /
translated: Why is it that those whose sexual organs are concealed are not ugly?

original: gtan tshigs snga ma kho na legs so //
analyzed: gtan tshigs snga ma kho na legs so //
translated: The first reason is good.

original: 'dir pho'i dbang po'i rgyu mtshan can du mthong nas dri ba ni pho'i dbang po'i med na da ni ji ltar na de dag pho zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir pho'i dbang po'i rgyu mtshan can du mthong nas dri ba ni pho'i dbang po'i med na da ni ji ltar na de dag pho zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Here, having seen the sign of the male faculty, the question is asked: ‚ÄúIf the male faculty does not exist, how are they male?‚ÄùüîΩThis question is asked improperly.

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pas dris pa'i phyir 'dri ba 'di ni /
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pas dris pa'i phyir 'dri ba 'di ni /
translated: This question is asked improperly.

original: gang las 'byung zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gang las 'byung zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The question should be asked: ‚ÄúWhat is the nature of being male?‚Äù

original: de ni pho'i ngo bo pho'i dbang po las gzhan pa 'dod pa'i khams na yod pa gang yin pa de ni yod do //
analyzed: de ni pho'i ngo bo pho'i dbang po las gzhan pa 'dod pa'i khams na yod pa gang yin pa de ni yod do //
translated: That which exists in the desire realm, apart from the nature of being male, which is the cause of the sign of the male faculty, does exist.

original: de ni nga ro dang / g-yo ba dang / dbyibs kyis bsdus pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni nga ro dang / g-yo ba dang / dbyibs kyis bsdus pa yin te /
translated: That is included in voice, movement, and shape.

original: de yang 'dod pa'i khams na pho'i khams na pho'i dbang po dang lhan cig tu rgyu bar mthong gi / mo'i dbang po dang lhan cig rgyu bar ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang 'dod pa'i khams na pho'i khams na pho'i dbang po dang lhan cig tu rgyu bar mthong gi / mo'i dbang po dang lhan cig rgyu bar ni ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, in the desire realm, the nature of being male is seen to occur together with the male faculty, but not with the female faculty.

original: sdug bsngal gyi dbang po med do zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi dbang po med do zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: There is no faculty of suffering, etc.

original: lus dang ba'i phyir brdegs pa las skyes pa'i sdug bsngal gyi dbang po med la /
analyzed: lus dang ba'i phyir brdegs pa las skyes pa'i sdug bsngal gyi dbang po med la /
translated: Since the body is pure, there is no faculty of pain born of violence.

original: mi dge ba med pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i yang med do //
analyzed: mi dge ba med pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i yang med do //
translated: Since there is no nonvirtue, there is no faculty born of retribution.

original: yid mi bde ba'i dbang po med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: yid mi bde ba'i dbang po med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: There is no faculty of sorrow, etc.

original: de yang rgyus bskyed pa dang / rkyen gyis bskyed pa zhig tu 'gyur grang /
analyzed: de yang rgyus bskyed pa dang / rkyen gyis bskyed pa zhig tu 'gyur grang /
translated: Is that faculty of sorrow born from a cause or born from conditions?

original: de la rgyus bskyed pa med de /
analyzed: de la rgyus bskyed pa med de /
translated: It is not born from a cause,

original: rgyud zhi gnas kyis brlan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyud zhi gnas kyis brlan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the stream of being is moistened by calm abiding.

original: zhi gnas te ting nge 'dzin gyis khong khro dang bral ba'i phyir de dag gi rgyud la rtsub pa nyid med de /
analyzed: zhi gnas te ting nge 'dzin gyis khong khro dang bral ba'i phyir de dag gi rgyud la rtsub pa nyid med de /
translated: Because of calm abiding, i.e., because of samƒÅdhi, there is no anger in their stream of being, and therefore there is no roughness in their stream of being.

original: de'i phyir de'i rgyu can yid mi bde ba'i dbang po yang med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i rgyu can yid mi bde ba'i dbang po yang med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no faculty of sorrow born from that cause.

original: rgyud la yod pa'i rtsub pa ni khong khro ba'o //
analyzed: rgyud la yod pa'i rtsub pa ni khong khro ba'o //
translated: The roughness in the stream of being is anger.

original: de'i phyir 'dis ni de na rtsub pas bskyed pa'i yid mi bde ba med do zhes bya bar shes par byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dis ni de na rtsub pas bskyed pa'i yid mi bde ba med do zhes bya bar shes par byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is understood that there is no sorrow born of roughness in that realm.

original: kun nas mnar sems kyi gzhi med pa'i phyir zhes bya bas ni de la mnar sems kyis bskyed pa med do zhes bya ba @121a * //üîΩ'di shes par byed do //
analyzed: kun nas mnar sems kyi gzhi med pa'i phyir zhes bya bas ni de la mnar sems kyis bskyed pa med do zhes bya ba @121a * // 'di shes par byed do //
translated: This shows that there is no mental dissatisfaction generated by malice.

original: mnar sems ni rab tu 'khrug pa'o //
analyzed: mnar sems ni rab tu 'khrug pa'o //
translated: Malice is a disturbance.

original: de'i gzhi ni yul lo //
analyzed: de'i gzhi ni yul lo //
translated: Its basis is an object.

original: de'i phyir 'dis ni yul gyis bskyed pa'i yid mi bde ba med do zhes bya bar shes te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dis ni yul gyis bskyed pa'i yid mi bde ba med do zhes bya bar shes te /
translated: Therefore, this shows that there is no mental dissatisfaction generated by an object.

original: de na mnar sems kyi gzhi dgu med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde dag kyang nga la don ma yin pa byas pa dang / byed pa dang ; byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mnar sems kyi gzhi gsum mo //üîΩnga'i bshes la don ma yin pa byas pa dang / byed pa dang / byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ni gzhan gsum mo //
analyzed: de na mnar sems kyi gzhi dgu med pa'i phyir ro // de dag kyang nga la don ma yin pa byas pa dang / byed pa dang ; byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mnar sems kyi gzhi gsum mo // nga'i bshes la don ma yin pa byas pa dang / byed pa dang / byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ni gzhan gsum mo //
translated: Because there is no basis for malice there.üîΩThe three bases of malice are: ‚ÄúHe has harmed me, is harming me, and will harm me.‚ÄùüîΩThe other three are: ‚ÄúHe is harming my friends, has helped my enemies, and will help my enemies.‚Äù

original: nga'i dgra la don byas pa dang / byed pa dang / byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ni gzhan gsum mo //
analyzed: nga'i dgra la don byas pa dang / byed pa dang / byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ni gzhan gsum mo //
translated: The other three are: ‚ÄúHe has helped me, is helping me, and will help me.‚Äù

original: gzugs med gtogs zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: gzugs med gtogs zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthose belonging to the formless realm‚Äù is expanded.

original: dang gi sgras ni pho dang mo'i dbang po dag dang / sdug bsngal dag dang / dri ma med pa zhes bya ba dang sbrel te /
analyzed: dang gi sgras ni pho dang mo'i dbang po dag dang / sdug bsngal dag dang / dri ma med pa zhes bya ba dang sbrel te /
translated: The word ‚Äúand‚Äù connects the words ‚Äúthe male and female faculties,‚Äù ‚Äúthe two sensations of pain and mental dissatisfaction,‚Äù and ‚Äúthe stainless.‚Äù

original: skabs su bab pa'i phyir na ma gtogs pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: skabs su bab pa'i phyir na ma gtogs pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Since the context is relevant, the phrase ‚Äúwith the exception of‚Äù is supplied.

original: bde ba zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang / yid bde ba dag ste /
analyzed: bde ba zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang / yid bde ba dag ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúpleasure‚Äù refers to both pleasure and mental satisfaction.

original: phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid du mtshungs pas gnyis ka yang sgra gcig gis brjod do //
analyzed: phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid du mtshungs pas gnyis ka yang sgra gcig gis brjod do //
translated: Since they are similar in that they are both beneficial, they are both expressed by the single word ‚Äúpleasure.‚Äù

original: gzugs can smos pas ni mig la sogs pa dbang po lnga po rnams bsdus so //
analyzed: gzugs can smos pas ni mig la sogs pa dbang po lnga po rnams bsdus so //
translated: The word ‚Äúform‚Äù includes the five faculties such as the eyes.

original: gal te gzugs can smos pas pho dang mo'i dbang po gnyis kyang gzung ba ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gzugs can smos pas pho dang mo'i dbang po gnyis kyang gzung ba ma yin zhe na /
translated: If the word ‚Äúform‚Äù includes the male and female faculties, why are they mentioned separately?

original: gal te gzugs can smos pas nyid kyis mig la sogs pa lngar pho dang mo'i dbang po gnyis kyang bkag na ni de lta yin dang / sdug bsngal la sogs pa rnams bsal bar bya ba'i phyir slar yang 'bad pas gzhan dag gir bya dgos so //
analyzed: gal te gzugs can smos pas nyid kyis mig la sogs pa lngar pho dang mo'i dbang po gnyis kyang bkag na ni de lta yin dang / sdug bsngal la sogs pa rnams bsal bar bya ba'i phyir slar yang 'bad pas gzhan dag gir bya dgos so //
translated: If the five sense organs, eye, etc., are excluded by the word ‚Äúmaterial,‚Äù then the male and female organs should be excluded by the word ‚Äúother.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir 'dir dbang po gzugs can dngos su dgag pa nyid du brjod par 'dod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir dbang po gzugs can dngos su dgag pa nyid du brjod par 'dod do //
translated: Therefore, the author of the root text wishes to state explicitly that the material organs are excluded.

original: lhag ma rnams ni skabs dang mthun par sbyar ba kho nas bkag pa nyid do //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni skabs dang mthun par sbyar ba kho nas bkag pa nyid do //
translated: The remaining organs are excluded by the context alone.

original: yid dang tshor ba rnam gsum zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yid dang tshor ba rnam gsum zhes bya ba la /
translated: The three feelings are associated with the mental faculty.

original: bde ba dang / yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i tshogs pa yin pa'i phyir dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa yin pa'i phyir gsum nyid do //
analyzed: bde ba dang / yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i tshogs pa yin pa'i phyir dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa yin pa'i phyir gsum nyid do //
translated: The three feelings are pleasure, mental pleasure, and indifference. They are associated with the mental faculty because they are associated with the mental consciousness. They are threefold because they are either contaminated or uncontaminated.

original: bde ba ni bsam gtan gsum pa'i sa pa'i sems kyi yin la /
analyzed: bde ba ni bsam gtan gsum pa'i sa pa'i sems kyi yin la /
translated: Pleasure is associated with the mental faculty of the third meditative absorption.

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang / bsam gtan dang po na ni lus kyi kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang / bsam gtan dang po na ni lus kyi kho na yin no //
translated: In the realm of desire and in the first meditation, there is only bodily sensation.üîΩBodily pleasure and the controlling faculties of the meditations and the five sense consciousnesses are abandoned by cultivation.üîΩMental pleasure, equanimity, satisfaction and the mental consciousness are abandoned by insight.

original: de la lus kyi bde ba dang / bsam gtan gyi dbang bo dag dang / rnam par shes pa lnga'i bdag nyid kyi yid ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba kho na'o //
analyzed: de la lus kyi bde ba dang / bsam gtan gyi dbang bo dag dang / rnam par shes pa lnga'i bdag nyid kyi yid ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba kho na'o //
translated: The rest, namely, the defiled and neutral factors and the wholesome impure factors, are abandoned by cultivation.üîΩThe pure factors are not to be abandoned.üîΩThe mental faculty associated with the defilements to be abandoned by insight is also abandoned by insight.üîΩThe mental faculty associated with the defilements to be abandoned by cultivation is also abandoned by cultivation.üîΩThe mental faculty associated with the defilements to be abandoned neither by insight nor by cultivation is not to be abandoned.üîΩThe mental faculty associated with the defilements to be abandoned by insight is abandoned by insight.

original: sems kyi bde ba dang / btang @121b snyoms dang / yid bde ba dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid can gyi yid mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa de dag ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin no //üîΩlhag ma nyon mongs pa can dang / lung du ma bstan pa dag dang / dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa rnams ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sems kyi bde ba dang / btang @121b snyoms dang / yid bde ba dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid can gyi yid mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa de dag ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin no // lhag ma nyon mongs pa can dang / lung du ma bstan pa dag dang / dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa rnams ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: The mental faculty associated with the defilements to be abandoned by cultivation is abandoned by cultivation.üîΩThe mental faculty associated with the defilements to be abandoned neither by insight nor by cultivation is not to be abandoned.üîΩThe mental faculty associated with the defilements to be abandoned by insight is abandoned by insight.üîΩThe mental faculty associated with the defilements to be abandoned by cultivation is abandoned by cultivation.üîΩThe mental faculty associated with the defilements to be abandoned neither by insight nor by cultivation is not to be abandoned.üîΩThe mental faculty associated with the defilements to be abandoned by insight is abandoned by insight.

original: zag pa med pa rnams ni spang bar bya ba ma yin pa yin no //
analyzed: zag pa med pa rnams ni spang bar bya ba ma yin pa yin no //
translated: The mental faculty associated with the defilements to be abandoned by cultivation is abandoned by cultivation.üîΩThe mental faculty associated with the defilements to be abandoned neither by insight nor by cultivation is not to be abandoned.üîΩThe mental faculty associated with the defilements to be abandoned by insight is abandoned by insight.

original: gnyis kyis spang bya'i yid mi bde //üîΩzhes bya ba /
analyzed: gnyis kyis spang bya'i yid mi bde //üîΩzhes bya ba /
translated: The mental faculty associated with the defilements to be abandoned by cultivation is abandoned by cultivation.üîΩThe mental faculty associated with the defilements to be abandoned neither by insight nor by cultivation is not to be abandoned.üîΩThe mental faculty associated with the defilements to be abandoned by insight is abandoned by insight.üîΩThe mental faculty associated with the defilements to be abandoned by cultivation is abandoned by cultivation.üîΩThe mental faculty associated with the defilements to be abandoned neither by insight nor by cultivation is not to be abandoned.üîΩThe mental faculty associated with the defilements to be abandoned by insight is abandoned by insight.üîΩThe mental faculty associated with the defilements to be abandoned by cultivation is abandoned by cultivation.üîΩThe mental faculty associated with the defilements to be

original: yid mi bde ba dang ldan pas na yid mi bde ba'o //
analyzed: yid mi bde ba dang ldan pas na yid mi bde ba'o //
translated: It is associated with mental dissatisfaction, thus it is mental dissatisfaction.

original: de'i dngos po ni yid mi bde ba nyid de /
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni yid mi bde ba nyid de /
translated: The nature of that is mental dissatisfaction.

original: yid mi bde zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yid mi bde zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is mental dissatisfaction.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa med pa'i phyir zag pa med pa med do //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa med pa'i phyir zag pa med pa med do //
translated: It is not uncontaminated because it is not equipoise.

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / mtshungs par ldan pa ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / mtshungs par ldan pa ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba'o //
translated: That which is associated with the affliction to be abandoned by the path of seeing is to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: lhag ma dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: lhag ma dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'o //
translated: The remaining virtuous and afflicted states are to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: mig la sogs pa bdun dang / srog dang / sdug bsngal gyi dbang po ni ci rigs par gzugs can yin pa'i phyir dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i phyir dang / drug pa las skyes pa ma yin pa'i phyir bsgom pas spang bar bya ba kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa bdun dang / srog dang / sdug bsngal gyi dbang po ni ci rigs par gzugs can yin pa'i phyir dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i phyir dang / drug pa las skyes pa ma yin pa'i phyir bsgom pas spang bar bya ba kho na yin gyi /
translated: The seven such as the eyes, life force and the faculty of pain are to be abandoned by the path of meditation because they are physical, they are not afflicted and they are not derived from the sixth.

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba ni ma yin te /
translated: They are not to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: nyon mongs can min mthong spang min //
analyzed: nyon mongs can min mthong spang min //
translated: They are not unafflicted nor to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: gzugs min drug pa min skyes min //üîΩzhes bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gzugs min drug pa min skyes min // zhes bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: The formless realm is not the sixth.

original: gcig tu zag pa dang bcas pa'i phyir spang bar bya ba ma yin pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gcig tu zag pa dang bcas pa'i phyir spang bar bya ba ma yin pa ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not to be abandoned because they are not contaminated.

original: lnga po ni spang bar bya min yang /üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lnga po ni spang bar bya min yang / zhes bya ba la /
translated: The five are not to be abandoned.

original: yang gi sgra yod pa'i phyir dang / skabs su bab pa'i phyir dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dag kyang ma yin no zhes bya bar shes so //
analyzed: yang gi sgra yod pa'i phyir dang / skabs su bab pa'i phyir dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dag kyang ma yin no zhes bya bar shes so //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that they are not to be abandoned by the path of cultivation, because they are wholesome and because they are not objects to be abandoned by the path of cultivation.

original: zag pa med pa'i phyir spang bar bya ba ma yin pa dag yin la /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i phyir spang bar bya ba ma yin pa dag yin la /
translated: They are not to be abandoned because they are uncontaminated.

original: dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa'i phyir bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa'i phyir bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: They are to be abandoned by the path of cultivation because they are contaminated wholesome states.

original: gsum min zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gsum min zhes bya ba la /
translated: They are not the third.

original: kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po la sogs pa gang du yang ni spang bya ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po la sogs pa gang du yang ni spang bya ma yin pa nyid de /
translated: The faculty of understanding all, etc., are not to be abandoned at all,

original: zag pa med pa rnams ni nyes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zag pa med pa rnams ni nyes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are uncontaminated and free of fault.

original: gal te gzings lta bu'i chos kyi rnam grangs las lam yang spang bar bya ba nyid du gsungs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gzings lta bu'i chos kyi rnam grangs las lam yang spang bar bya ba nyid du gsungs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If you say that the path is also said to be abandoned in the DharmaüîΩDiscourse Resembling the Great Vehicle,

original: gsungs mod kyi mthong ba dang bsgom pa dag gis ni spang bar bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gsungs mod kyi mthong ba dang bsgom pa dag gis ni spang bar bya ba ma yin te /
translated: that is true, but it is not abandoned by the paths of seeing and meditation.üîΩIt is said to be abandoned because it is relinquished when one enters the
