analyzed: de'i phyir 'phags pa las khyad par du byas pa'i phyir so so'i skye bo zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, because it is distinguished from ƒÅryas, ordinary beings is mentioned.

original: yid bde ba'i dbang po dang ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yid bde ba'i dbang po dang ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: One does not possess the faculty of mental satisfaction with the fourth absorption and those born in the formless realm.

original: 'phags pa ni bsam gtan gnyis pa'i gong du skyes kyang zag pa med pa'i yid bde pa'i dbang po dang ldan pas /
analyzed: 'phags pa ni bsam gtan gnyis pa'i gong du skyes kyang zag pa med pa'i yid bde pa'i dbang po dang ldan pas /
translated: Aryas born in the second absorption and above possess the uncontaminated faculty of mental satisfaction.

original: so so'i skye bo kho na dang zhes khyad par du byas so //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo kho na dang zhes khyad par du byas so //
translated: Therefore, the root text specifies that they are possessed only by ordinary beings.

original: sdug bsngal gyi dbang po dang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi dbang po dang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The faculty of pain and so on.

original: sdug bsngal gyi dbang po dang ni 'dod par gtogs pa kho na yin pas de dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med par skyes pa mi ldan no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi dbang po dang ni 'dod par gtogs pa kho na yin pas de dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med par skyes pa mi ldan no //
translated: The faculty of pain is possessed only in the desire realm and not by those born in the form and formless realms.

original: yid mi bde ba dang 'dod chags dang bral ba mi ldan pa'i rgyu ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: yid mi bde ba dang 'dod chags dang bral ba mi ldan pa'i rgyu ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The cause for not possessing mental dissatisfaction and being free of attachment is the same as before.

original: dad pa la sogs pa dag dang ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa dag dang ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Faith and so on.

original: dad pa la sogs pa rnams ni gcig tu dge ba yin pa'i phyir log par lta ba chen po yongs su rdzogs pa de dag kun du spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa rnams ni gcig tu dge ba yin pa'i phyir log par lta ba chen po yongs su rdzogs pa de dag kun du spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Faith and so on are virtuous alone and those who possess them are not those who engage in the great complete wrong view.

original: kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po dang ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po dang ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: The faculty producing complete knowledge.

original: zag pa med pa'i phyir so so'i skye bo dang mi ldan no //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i phyir so so'i skye bo dang mi ldan no //
translated: It is not possessed by ordinary beings because it is uncontaminated.

original: mthong ba'i lam gtang ba'i phyir 'bras bu la gnas pa dang mi ldan @127b no ;
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gtang ba'i phyir 'bras bu la gnas pa dang mi ldan @127b no ;
translated: It is not possessed by those who abide in the result because they have relinquished the path of seeing.

original: / kun shes pa'i dbang po dang ni zhes bya ba la /üîΩzag pa med pa'i bsgom pa'i lam gyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: / kun shes pa'i dbang po dang ni zhes bya ba la / zag pa med pa'i bsgom pa'i lam gyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The faculty of complete knowledge is not possessed by ordinary beings,

original: so so'i skye bo dang / mthong ba dang / mi slob pa'i lam la gnas pa rnams mi ldan no //üîΩkun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po dang ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo dang / mthong ba dang / mi slob pa'i lam la gnas pa rnams mi ldan no // kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po dang ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: those abiding on the path of seeing, and those abiding on the path of no learning because it is the nature of the uncontaminated path of meditation.

original: mi slob pa'i lam gyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir so so'i skye bo dang / slob pa dag dang mi ldan no //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i lam gyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir so so'i skye bo dang / slob pa dag dang mi ldan no //
translated: The faculty possessing complete knowledge is not possessed by ordinary beings and those on the path of learning because it is the nature of the path of no learning.

original: ma bkag pa'i gnas skabs dag tu ni //
analyzed: ma bkag pa'i gnas skabs dag tu ni //
translated: In the context of what is not refuted,

original: zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: it is said:

original: mig la sogs pa bzhi ni gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa dang ldan no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa bzhi ni gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa dang ldan no //
translated: The four such as the eye are possessed by those born in the form realm.

original: 'dod pa'i khams na thob par dang ma nyams pa yang mig la sogs pa dag dang ldan no ;
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams na thob par dang ma nyams pa yang mig la sogs pa dag dang ldan no ;
translated: One possesses the eye faculty, etc., obtained and not lost in the desire realm.

original: / lus kyi dbang po dang ni 'dod pa dang // gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa dag ldan no //
analyzed: / lus kyi dbang po dang ni 'dod pa dang // gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa dag ldan no //
translated: One possesses the body faculty born in the desire realm and form realm.

original: pho dang mo'i dbang po dang ni 'dod pa'i khams kho nar thob pa dang / ma nyams pa ldan no //
analyzed: pho dang mo'i dbang po dang ni 'dod pa'i khams kho nar thob pa dang / ma nyams pa ldan no //
translated: One possesses the female and male faculties obtained and not lost in the desire realm alone.

original: bde ba'i dbang po ni bsam gtan bzhi pa'i 'og tu skyes pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa la sogs par skyes pa'i 'phags pa dang ldan no //
analyzed: bde ba'i dbang po ni bsam gtan bzhi pa'i 'og tu skyes pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa la sogs par skyes pa'i 'phags pa dang ldan no //
translated: One possesses the pleasure faculty born below the fourth absorption and ƒÅryas born in the fourth absorption, etc.

original: yid bde ba'i dbang po dang ni bsam gtan gsum pa'i 'og tu skyes pa dang / bsam gtan gsum pa la sogs par skyes pa'i 'phags pa ldan no //
analyzed: yid bde ba'i dbang po dang ni bsam gtan gsum pa'i 'og tu skyes pa dang / bsam gtan gsum pa la sogs par skyes pa'i 'phags pa ldan no //
translated: One possesses the mental satisfaction faculty born below the third absorption and ƒÅryas born in the third absorption, etc.

original: sdug bsngal gyi dbang po dang ni 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa ldan no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi dbang po dang ni 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa ldan no //
translated: One possesses the pain faculty born in the desire realm.

original: yid mi bde ba'i dbang po dang ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang ma bral ba ldan no //
analyzed: yid mi bde ba'i dbang po dang ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang ma bral ba ldan no //
translated: One possesses the mental dissatisfaction faculty not free from attachment to the desire realm.

original: dad pa la sogs pa dag dang ni dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du ma chad pa ldan no //
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa dag dang ni dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du ma chad pa ldan no //
translated: Those who possess faith and so on also possess the faculty of possessing the roots of virtue.

original: kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po dang ni mthong ba'i lam la gnas pa ldan no //üîΩkun shes pa'i dbang po dang ni bsgom pa'i lam la gnas pa ldan no //
analyzed: kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po dang ni mthong ba'i lam la gnas pa ldan no // kun shes pa'i dbang po dang ni bsgom pa'i lam la gnas pa ldan no //
translated: Those who possess the faculty producing complete knowledge possess the path of seeing.üîΩThose who possess the faculty of complete knowledge possess the path of meditation.

original: kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po dang ni mi slob pa'i lam la gnas pa dag ldan no //
analyzed: kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po dang ni mi slob pa'i lam la gnas pa dag ldan no //
translated: Those who possess the faculty possessing complete knowledge possess the path of no learning.

original: de ltar ma bkag pa'i gnas skabs de dag tu ni ji skad bshad pa dang ldan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar ma bkag pa'i gnas skabs de dag tu ni ji skad bshad pa dang ldan par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, in those states not prohibited, it should be understood that they possess those faculties as explained.

original: bde lus ldan la bzhi dag dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bde lus ldan la bzhi dag dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Those possessing a body of pleasure possess four.

original: bde ba'i dbang po la btang snyoms dang / srog dang / yid dag gis khyab pa'i phyir 'khrul pa med do ;
analyzed: bde ba'i dbang po la btang snyoms dang / srog dang / yid dag gis khyab pa'i phyir 'khrul pa med do ;
translated: Since the faculty of pleasure is pervaded by equanimity, life force, and mind, there is no error.

original: / gang zhig bde pa'i dbang po dang ldan pa de ni gdon mi za bar dbang po bzhi dag dang ldan no zhes bya bar rgyas par btang snyoms la sogs pa ltar 'khrul pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: / gang zhig bde pa'i dbang po dang ldan pa de ni gdon mi za bar dbang po bzhi dag dang ldan no zhes bya bar rgyas par btang snyoms la sogs pa ltar 'khrul pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: One who possesses the faculty of pleasure definitely possesses four faculties, and so on.

original: de bzhin du lus kyi dbang po dang ldan pa yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du lus kyi dbang po dang ldan pa yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: One who possesses the body faculty should be explained in the same way.

original: 'khrul pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: 'khrul pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The error is the same as before.

original: mig sogs ldan la @128a * //
analyzed: mig sogs ldan la @128a * //
translated: One who possesses the eye faculty

original: lnga dang ldan //üîΩzhes bya ba la /üîΩmig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce rnams ni re re zhing btang snyoms la sogs pa bzhis khyab pa'i phyir na gang zhig mig la sogs pa rnams las gang yang rung ba zhig dang ldan pa ni gdon mi za bar dbang po lnga dang ldan no //
analyzed: lnga dang ldan // zhes bya ba la / mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce rnams ni re re zhing btang snyoms la sogs pa bzhis khyab pa'i phyir na gang zhig mig la sogs pa rnams las gang yang rung ba zhig dang ldan pa ni gdon mi za bar dbang po lnga dang ldan no //
translated: possesses five.üîΩOne who possesses the eye faculty definitely possesses five faculties.üîΩBecause the eye, ear, nose, and tongue faculties are each pervaded by the four faculties of equanimity and so on.

original: de la mig gi dbang po dang ldan pa ni gdon mi za bar rna ba la sogs pa dag dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la mig gi dbang po dang ldan pa ni gdon mi za bar rna ba la sogs pa dag dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: One who possesses the eye faculty definitely does not possess the body faculty, because it is impossible for one who is born in the formless realm to possess the eye faculty.

original: 'dod pa'i khams na de dag ma thob pa dang / nyams pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams na de dag ma thob pa dang / nyams pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the realm of desire, it is possible to not obtain or to lose these faculties.

original: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce'i dbang po dag dang ldan pa yang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce'i dbang po dag dang ldan pa yang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: The same holds for those who possess the ear, nose and tongue faculties.

original: mig la sogs pa de dag ni lus kyi dbang po med par mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa de dag ni lus kyi dbang po med par mi 'byung ste /
translated: These faculties of eye, etc., do not occur without the body faculty,

original: de la rag las te 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la rag las te 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they function in dependence on it.

original: phan tshun ni ma yin te /
analyzed: phan tshun ni ma yin te /
translated: They do not occur in mutual dependence,

original: phan tshun ltos pa med par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun ltos pa med par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they function independently of each other.

original: yid bde ldan yang ste /
analyzed: yid bde ldan yang ste /
translated: One also possesses the faculty of mental happiness.

original: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po dang ldan pa ltar btang snyoms dang / srog dang / yid dang / bde ba dang / yid bde ba dang / dbang po lnga dang ldan no //üîΩlhag ma rnams dang ni ldan pa yang yod /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po dang ldan pa ltar btang snyoms dang / srog dang / yid dang / bde ba dang / yid bde ba dang / dbang po lnga dang ldan no // lhag ma rnams dang ni ldan pa yang yod /
translated: Like those who possess the eye faculty, etc., one also possesses the five faculties of equanimity, life, mind, pleasure and mental happiness.üîΩOne may or may not possess the remaining faculties.

original: mi ldan pa yang yod do //
analyzed: mi ldan pa yang yod do //
translated: One may or may not possess the remaining faculties.

original: bsam gtan gnyis par skyes pa bsam gtan gsum pa ma 'thob pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis par skyes pa bsam gtan gsum pa ma 'thob pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: One who is born in the second absorption and has not obtained the third absorption possesses the faculty of pleasure of the first absorption.

original: bsam gtan gnyis par skyes pa la lus kyi bde ba med cing /üîΩsems kyi bde ba med de /
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis par skyes pa la lus kyi bde ba med cing / sems kyi bde ba med de /
translated: One born in the second absorption does not possess physical pleasure.

original: de'i phyir yid bde ba dang ldan pa ni mig la sogs pa ltar bde ba'i dbang po dang yang gdon mi za bar ldan pa ma yin no snyam du sems te 'dri ba ni /üîΩbde ba'i dbang po gang dang ldan pa yin //
analyzed: de'i phyir yid bde ba dang ldan pa ni mig la sogs pa ltar bde ba'i dbang po dang yang gdon mi za bar ldan pa ma yin no snyam du sems te 'dri ba ni / bde ba'i dbang po gang dang ldan pa yin //
translated: And since mental pleasure does not exist there, one possessing mental satisfaction does not definitely possess the faculty of pleasure, like the eyes and so on.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The question is asked:üîΩWith which faculty of pleasure is one born there endowed?

original: bsam gtan gsum pa'i sa pa'i nyon mongs pa can dang ldan zhes bya ba la ;
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa'i sa pa'i nyon mongs pa can dang ldan zhes bya ba la ;
translated: One born there is endowed with the faculty of pleasure of the third absorption because one is endowed with afflicted pleasure of the third absorption level.

original: sa 'og ma pa'i mi srid pa'i phyir dang / go rims bzhin sbyor ba la rag las pa'i phyir dang / skye ba la rag las pa'i phyir bsam gtan gsum pa'i sa pa'i dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa mi srid pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sa 'og ma pa'i mi srid pa'i phyir dang / go rims bzhin sbyor ba la rag las pa'i phyir dang / skye ba la rag las pa'i phyir bsam gtan gsum pa'i sa pa'i dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa mi srid pa'i phyir te /
translated: Since it is impossible for those born in lower levels to possess higher levels, since they depend on the process of preparation and since it is impossible for those born in the third absorption to possess virtuous or neutral states of the third absorption level,

original: gang gi phyir 'og mar skyes pa sa gong ma pa'i nyon mongs pa dag dang ldan ba de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'og mar skyes pa sa gong ma pa'i nyon mongs pa dag dang ldan ba de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: those born in lower levels possess afflicted states of higher levels.

original: nyon mongs pa can dang ldan no zhes smos so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can dang ldan no zhes smos so //
translated: He possesses the faculty of mental dissatisfaction.

original: sdug bsngal dang ldan bdun dang gdon mi za bar ldan no zhes bya bar snyegs te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang ldan bdun dang gdon mi za bar ldan no zhes bya bar snyegs te /
translated: He definitely possesses seven faculties that are associated with pain.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,

original: gang zhig sdug bsngal gyi dbang po dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gang zhig sdug bsngal gyi dbang po dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he possesses the faculty of pain, etc.

original: 'di ni 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa ste /
translated: He is born in the desire realm.

original: @128b de'i phyir nges par lus kyi dbang po dang / yid bde ba ma gtogs pa tshor ba'i dbang po bzhi dang / yid dang srog gi dbang po dag dang ldan pas gdon mi za bar bdun dang ldan no //
analyzed: @128b de'i phyir nges par lus kyi dbang po dang / yid bde ba ma gtogs pa tshor ba'i dbang po bzhi dang / yid dang srog gi dbang po dag dang ldan pas gdon mi za bar bdun dang ldan no //
translated: Therefore, he definitely possesses seven faculties: the body faculty, the four faculties of feeling, the mind faculty, and the life faculty.

original: dbang po lhag ma 'khrul pa ni snga ma bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: dbang po lhag ma 'khrul pa ni snga ma bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: The possession of the remaining faculties should be explained according to the above principles.

original: mo'i dbang sogs ldan brgyad dang// gdon mi za bar ldan no zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: mo'i dbang sogs ldan brgyad dang// gdon mi za bar ldan no zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: He definitely possesses eight faculties, such as the female faculty.

original: pho dang / mo dang / yid mi bde ba dang / dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: pho dang / mo dang / yid mi bde ba dang / dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the term ‚Äúendowed‚Äù is the same as the meaning of the term ‚Äúpossesses.‚Äù

original: gang zhig mo'i dbang po dang ldan pa de ni 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa ste /
analyzed: gang zhig mo'i dbang po dang ldan pa de ni 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa ste /
translated: One who possesses the female faculty is born in the desire realm.

original: gdon mi za bar brgyad dang ldan no //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar brgyad dang ldan no //
translated: He definitely possesses eight faculties.

original: gang dag dang zhe na /
analyzed: gang dag dang zhe na /
translated: Which eight?

original: bdun po de dag dang mo'i dbang po dang zhes bya ba smos so //üîΩlhag ma rnams dang ni ldan pa yang yod /
analyzed: bdun po de dag dang mo'i dbang po dang zhes bya ba smos so // lhag ma rnams dang ni ldan pa yang yod /
translated: He possesses those seven and the female faculty.

original: mi ldan pa yang yod do //üîΩgang zhig pho'i dbang po 'am yid mi bde ba'i dbang po dang ldan pa de ni gdon mi za bar dbang po brgyad dang ldan pa yin te /

original: ji skad du bshad pa bdun dang / brgyad pa pho'i dbang po'am yid mi bde ba'i dbang po de dang ldan no //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa bdun dang / brgyad pa pho'i dbang po'am yid mi bde ba'i dbang po de dang ldan no //
translated: He possesses those seven faculties that have been explained and the eighth consisting of either the male faculty or the faculty of mental pain.

original: gang gi phyir gang zhig yid mi bde ba dang ldan pa de ni gdon mi za bar tshor ba lnga dang / lus dang / srog dang / yid dang ldan te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang zhig yid mi bde ba dang ldan pa de ni gdon mi za bar tshor ba lnga dang / lus dang / srog dang / yid dang ldan te /

original: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin du brjod par bya'o//
analyzed: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin du brjod par bya'o//

analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /

analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa rnams ni btang snyoms la sogs pa dag med par mi 'byung zhing /

translated: Because even though the female organ has ceased, the homogeneous collection of her parts does not cease.

original: pho'i dbang po la yang de dang 'dra bar brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: pho'i dbang po la yang de dang 'dra bar brjod par bya'o //
translated: It should be said that the same applies to the male organ.

original: gsum @129b ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pas gnas skabs ma nges par dbang po'i ldan pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: gsum @129b ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pas gnas skabs ma nges par dbang po'i ldan pa bshad zin to //
translated: The text has already explained the possession of faculties that are not definite in terms of the stage, such as possessing three faculties and so on.

original: btang snyoms kyi dbang po dang ldan pa'i gang zag gang yin pa de ni 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa'am /
analyzed: btang snyoms kyi dbang po dang ldan pa'i gang zag gang yin pa de ni 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa'am /
translated: Any person possessing the faculty of equanimity is born in the desire realm or

original: srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du skyes pa zhig yin gyi /
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du skyes pa zhig yin gyi /
translated: born up to the summit of existence.

original: gang dbang po gsum kho na yod pa 'phags pa'am so so'i skye bo'i gang zag gcig pu ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pas 'dir gang zag spyir gyi dbang du byas kyi /
analyzed: gang dbang po gsum kho na yod pa 'phags pa'am so so'i skye bo'i gang zag gcig pu ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pas 'dir gang zag spyir gyi dbang du byas kyi /
translated: There is no person who is only endowed with three faculties, whether that person is a noble one or an ordinary person. Therefore, this is from the perspective of the general person,

original: gang zag gcig ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zag gcig ni ma yin no //
translated: not from the perspective of a single person.

original: dbang po nyi shu rtsa gcig las kha cig ni 'khrul pa yin /
analyzed: dbang po nyi shu rtsa gcig las kha cig ni 'khrul pa yin /
translated: From among the twenty one faculties, some are confused.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na dbang po rnams la med pa mi 'byung ba'i 'brel pa dpyad pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na dbang po rnams la med pa mi 'byung ba'i 'brel pa dpyad pa yin gyi /
translated: In one way, the relationship between the faculties and the nonarising of the nonexistent is analyzed,

original: rgyud gcig la ni ma yin pas de ni gang zag nges par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyud gcig la ni ma yin pas de ni gang zag nges par brjod par bya'o //
translated: but not in terms of a single mindstream. Therefore, that should be stated in terms of the person.

original: yang gang zhig nang na nyung ba dag dang ldan pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: yang gang zhig nang na nyung ba dag dang ldan pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: Moreover, who is endowed with the fewest?

original: 'dir ni nyung ba dag dang ldan pa 'gog pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dir ni nyung ba dag dang ldan pa 'gog pa yin gyi /
translated: Here, the possession of the fewest is refuted,

original: mang ba dag tu ldan pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mang ba dag tu ldan pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but not the possession of the greatest number.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du chad pa ni dge ba'i chos thams cad dang mi ldan pa'i phyir dge med ces bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du chad pa ni dge ba'i chos thams cad dang mi ldan pa'i phyir dge med ces bya'o //
translated: One who has severed the root of virtue is called one who lacks virtue because he is not endowed with any virtuous qualities.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du chad pa la ni 'dod pa'i khams la 'dod chags dang bral ba srid pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du chad pa la ni 'dod pa'i khams la 'dod chags dang bral ba srid pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: It is impossible for one who has severed the wholesome roots to be free from attachment to the desire realm.

original: de'i phyir / tshor ba lnga dag dang zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / tshor ba lnga dag dang zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚Äúalong with the five feelings.‚Äù

original: 'dod pa'i khams las gzhan pa ni dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du chad pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams las gzhan pa ni dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du chad pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no severing of the wholesome roots in realms other than the desire realm.

original: 'dod pa'i khams na lus kyi dbang po 'khrul ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams na lus kyi dbang po 'khrul ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Also, the body faculty is not confused in the desire realm.

original: de'i phyir / lus dang zhes bya ba smos so //üîΩtshor bar byed pa ni myong ba ste tshor bar byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni byed pa po'i 'dri ba ste byed pa po yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir / lus dang zhes bya ba smos so // tshor bar byed pa ni myong ba ste tshor bar byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni byed pa po'i 'dri ba ste byed pa po yin no //
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚Äúalong with the body.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúFeeling is that which feels‚Äù means that feeling is the agent of the action of feeling.

original: yang na tshor ba ni tshor ba ste zhes bya ba ni dngos po bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: yang na tshor ba ni tshor ba ste zhes bya ba ni dngos po bsgrub pa'o //
translated: Or, ‚Äúfeeling is that which is felt‚Äù means that feeling is the object of the action of feeling.

original: shes par byed pa ston pa ni /
analyzed: shes par byed pa ston pa ni /
translated: The explanation of the agent of the action of feeling is as follows.

original: dper na phun sum tshogs pa la phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba bzhin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dper na phun sum tshogs pa la phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba bzhin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: For example, it is like the expression ‚Äúthe perfection of perfection.‚Äù

original: dge med yin pa nyid kyi phyir na dad pa la sogs pa rnams dang / dri ma med pa dag dang ldan pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: dge med yin pa nyid kyi phyir na dad pa la sogs pa rnams dang / dri ma med pa dag dang ldan pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Because they are not virtuous, they do not possess faith, etc., or the stainless states.

original: mig la sogs pa pho'i dbang po'i mthar thug pa ma thob pa dang / nyams pa rnams dang yang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa pho'i dbang po'i mthar thug pa ma thob pa dang / nyams pa rnams dang yang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: They do not possess the eyes, etc., or the male faculty, etc., if they have not yet obtained or have lost them.

original: gzugs med byis pa de bzhin no //üîΩzhes byas ba la /
analyzed: gzugs med byis pa de bzhin no // zhes byas ba la /
translated: So too, the immature.

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba'i sgra ni grangs tsam zhig dang sbyar gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba'i sgra ni grangs tsam zhig dang sbyar gyi /
translated: The word ‚Äúso too‚Äù is applied to the number of faculties.

original: gang dag dang dge med ldan pa de dag kho na dang ldan pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang dag dang dge med ldan pa de dag kho na dang ldan pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Those who possess the nonvirtuous faculties do not possess the virtuous faculties.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Therefore the root text says,

original: btang snyoms srog yid dge rnams dang // zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: btang snyoms srog yid dge rnams dang // zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe faculties of equanimity, life, mind, and the five virtues.‚Äù

original: byis pa zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo'i ming yin no zhes bya ba 'di @130a * //
analyzed: byis pa zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo'i ming yin no zhes bya ba 'di @130a * //
translated: The term ‚Äúimmature‚Äù is a synonym for ordinary beings.

original: ji ltar rtogs she na /
analyzed: ji ltar rtogs she na /
translated: How is this understood?

original: mdo las 'byung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: mdo las 'byung ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it occurs in the sutras.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag byis pa so so'i skye bo thos pa dang mi ldan pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag byis pa so so'i skye bo thos pa dang mi ldan pa /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn said, ‚ÄúMonks, the immature, ordinary beings, who are not learned,

original: rtag par ltung ba rnams ni bdag dang bdag gi zhes bya ba rgyas par gsungs so //
analyzed: rtag par ltung ba rnams ni bdag dang bdag gi zhes bya ba rgyas par gsungs so //
translated: Those who always fall are called ‚Äúthose who are filled with ‚ÄòI‚Äô and ‚Äòmine.‚Äô‚Äù

original: de ni bya ba dang bya ba ma yin pa mi shes pas byis pa dang 'dra bas byis pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni bya ba dang bya ba ma yin pa mi shes pas byis pa dang 'dra bas byis pa yin no //
translated: They are called ‚Äúfools‚Äù because they are like fools who do not know what should and should not be done.

original: gal te gcig tu dge ba'i phyir //
analyzed: gal te gcig tu dge ba'i phyir //
translated: Because they are virtuous in every way,üîΩthe root text states, ‚Äúbecause they are virtuous.‚Äù

original: dge ba smos pas ni dad pa la sogs pa gzung bar bya ste zhes bya bas dge ba dag kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: dge ba smos pas ni dad pa la sogs pa gzung bar bya ste zhes bya bas dge ba dag kho na yin gyi /
translated: The words ‚Äúbecause they are virtuous‚Äù indicate that faith and so on are to be included.

original: mi dge ba dang lung du mi bstan pa dag ma yin no //üîΩkun shes par byed pa'i dbang po la sogs pa rnams kyang gzung bar thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi dge ba dang lung du mi bstan pa dag ma yin no // kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po la sogs pa rnams kyang gzung bar thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: They are virtuous, not nonvirtuous or indeterminate.

original: de dag kyang dad pa la sogs pa ltar gcig tu dge ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de dag kyang dad pa la sogs pa ltar gcig tu dge ba yin no zhe na /
translated: It follows, then, that the faculty of understanding all, and so on, should be included because they are virtuous in every way, just like faith and so on.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: brgyad kyi skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brgyad kyi skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because this discussion is about the eight.

original: dge med na ngan nyung ldan pa //
analyzed: dge med na ngan nyung ldan pa //
translated: If they do not possess virtue, they possess the minimum of eight.

original: lus tshor srog yid brgyad dang ldan //
analyzed: lus tshor srog yid brgyad dang ldan //
translated: They possess body, sensation, life faculty, mind,üîΩand the five faculties that begin with faith.

original: zhes 'dir brgyad kyi dbang du byas pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes 'dir brgyad kyi dbang du byas pa yin te /
translated: This discussion is about the eight faculties that begin with body and conclude with the faculty of faith.

original: de dag 'dzin na ni bcu gcig tu 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de dag 'dzin na ni bcu gcig tu 'gyur gyi /
translated: If they possessed them, they would have eleven faculties,

original: brgyad ni ma yin no //
analyzed: brgyad ni ma yin no //
translated: but they do not have eight.

original: byis pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: byis pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because they are children.

original: byis pa zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo la bya ste /
analyzed: byis pa zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo la bya ste /
translated: Children are ordinary beings,

original: so so'i skye bo nyid ni 'phags pa'i chos rnams ma thob pa'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo nyid ni 'phags pa'i chos rnams ma thob pa'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is said that ‚Äúthe nature of an ordinary being is the non-acquisition of the qualities of an ƒÅrya.‚Äù

original: de bas na kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po la sogs pa 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po la sogs pa 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, they do not possess the faculty of producing complete knowledge, etc.

original: yang na gzugs med pa na kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na gzugs med pa na kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or, because the faculty of producing complete knowledge does not exist in the formless realm.

original: yang gang zhig gang na dbang po mang po dag dang ldan pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: yang gang zhig gang na dbang po mang po dag dang ldan pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: Or, how many faculties do those who possess many faculties possess?

original: mtshan nyid pa la zag pa med pa'i chos med pa'i phyir kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po la sogs pa dag dang mi ldan no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid pa la zag pa med pa'i chos med pa'i phyir kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po la sogs pa dag dang mi ldan no //
translated: They do not possess the faculty of producing complete knowledge, etc., because uncontaminated states do not exist in the desire realm.

original: mtshan gnyis pa gdon mi za bar bcu dgu dang ldan pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: mtshan gnyis pa gdon mi za bar bcu dgu dang ldan pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Those who possess two organs definitely do not possess nineteen.

original: srid pa'i dbang du byas nas brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: srid pa'i dbang du byas nas brjod pa yin no //
translated: The text refers to existence.

original: dbang po tshang ba gang yin pa ni mig la sogs pa pho'i dbang po'i mthar thug pa thob pa dang ma nyams pa dag dang ldan no //
analyzed: dbang po tshang ba gang yin pa ni mig la sogs pa pho'i dbang po'i mthar thug pa thob pa dang ma nyams pa dag dang ldan no //
translated: One who is complete in faculties is endowed with the eye faculty, etc., up to the male faculty, having obtained them and not having lost them.

original: mtshan gnyis pa nyid yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: mtshan gnyis pa nyid yin pa'i phyir //
translated: Because of having two organs.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du chad pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du chad pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of not having cut off the wholesome roots.

original: 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang bral ba med pa'i phyir dad pa la sogs pa dag dang / tshor ba lnga dag dang / srog dang / yid dang ldan no //
analyzed: 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang bral ba med pa'i phyir dad pa la sogs pa dag dang / tshor ba lnga dag dang / srog dang / yid dang ldan no //
translated: Because of not being free from the passion of the realm of desire, he is endowed with faith, etc., the five feelings, life faculty, and mind faculty.

original: 'phags pa chags bcas te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'phags pa chags bcas te zhes bya ba la /
translated: The noble one who is passionate.

original: 'phags pa smos pa ni so so'i skye bo las khyad par du byas pa'i phyir te //
analyzed: 'phags pa smos pa ni so so'i skye bo las khyad par du byas pa'i phyir te //
translated: The word ‚Äúnoble‚Äù is used to distinguish him from the ordinary man.

original: de ni zag pa med pa'i dbang po dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni zag pa med pa'i dbang po dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: He is not endowed with the uncontaminated faculties.

original: chags bcas zhes bya ba ni chags pa dang bral pa las khyad par du byed pa ste /
analyzed: chags bcas zhes bya ba ni chags pa dang bral pa las khyad par du byed pa ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúpassionate‚Äù is used to distinguish him from the one who is free from passion.

original: de ni yid mi bde @130b ba dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni yid mi bde @130b ba dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: He is not endowed with the faculty of sorrow.

original: mtshan gcig dri med gnyis ma gtogs //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mtshan gcig dri med gnyis ma gtogs // zhes bya ba la /
translated: except for one of the two organs and the stainless.

original: mtshan gcig ni pho'am mo'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: mtshan gcig ni pho'am mo'i dbang po'o //
translated: One of the two organs is the male or female organ.

original: de ci'i phyir ma gtogs she na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir ma gtogs she na /
translated: Why are they excluded?

original: mtshan gnyis pa la 'phags pa'i lam mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan gnyis pa la 'phags pa'i lam mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the noble path does not arise in those with two organs.

original: gal te mthong ba'i lam la gnas pa yin na ni de'i phyir kun shes pa'i dbang po dang ; kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po ma gtogs te /
analyzed: gal te mthong ba'i lam la gnas pa yin na ni de'i phyir kun shes pa'i dbang po dang ; kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po ma gtogs te /
translated: If he is on the path of insight, then the faculty of understanding what has not been understood and the faculty of final and perfect knowledge are excluded.

original: de nyid ni bsgom pa dang / mi slob pa'i lam yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid ni bsgom pa dang / mi slob pa'i lam yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is the path of cultivation and the path of no learning.

original: 'on te bsgom pa'i lam la gnas pa yin na ni de'i phyir kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po dang / kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po ma gtogs te /
analyzed: 'on te bsgom pa'i lam la gnas pa yin na ni de'i phyir kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po dang / kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po ma gtogs te /
translated: If he is on the path of cultivation, then the faculty of understanding what has not been understood and the faculty of final and perfect knowledge are excluded.

original: de dag ni mthong ba dang / mi slob pa'i lam yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩdbang po rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo /
analyzed: de dag ni mthong ba dang / mi slob pa'i lam yin pa'i phyir ro // dbang po rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo /
translated: Because those are the path of insight and the path of no learning.üîΩThe faculties have been discussed.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: What is the order of the faculties?

original: khams rab tu dbye ba'i zhar la 'ongs pa zhes bya ba 'byung ste /üîΩkhams bco brgyad po de dag las dbang po rnams ni du /
analyzed: khams rab tu dbye ba'i zhar la 'ongs pa zhes bya ba 'byung ste / khams bco brgyad po de dag las dbang po rnams ni du /
translated: This is the topic of the ancillary discussion on the classification of the elements.üîΩAmong the eighteen elements, how many are faculties and how many are not faculties?

original: dbang po ma yin pa ni du zhes de ltar khams rab tu dbye ba'i zhar la 'ongs pa rnams kyi rab tu dbye brgyas par bshad zin te /
analyzed: dbang po ma yin pa ni du zhes de ltar khams rab tu dbye ba'i zhar la 'ongs pa rnams kyi rab tu dbye brgyas par bshad zin te /
translated: The classification of the elements has been explained in detail as an ancillary discussion,

original: grangs dang / ming dang / rang gi ngo bo dang / rnam pa rab tu dbye ba brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grangs dang / ming dang / rang gi ngo bo dang / rnam pa rab tu dbye ba brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the number, names, individual natures, and types of the elements have been explained.

original: da ni 'di dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni 'di dpyad par bya ste /
translated: Now, this should be analyzed:

original: ci 'dus byas kyi chos 'di dag zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ci 'dus byas kyi chos 'di dag zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ngo //
translated: Are these conditioned phenomena?

original: dpyod pa 'di la dgos pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: dpyod pa 'di la dgos pa ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the purpose of this analysis?

original: chos rab tu rnam par dbye ba'i don du chos mngon pa bstan to zhes dang po nyid du kho nar bshad pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: chos rab tu rnam par dbye ba'i don du chos mngon pa bstan to zhes dang po nyid du kho nar bshad pa ma yin nam /
translated: Was it not explained at the very beginning that Abhidharma was taught for the purpose of thoroughly discerning phenomena?

original: yang na ji ltar 'ug pa pa rnams kyi ltar na yan lag can gyi rdzas gcig skye ba de dgag par bya ba'i don du rdzas brgyad skye ba'o zhes rgyu dang / rkyen rnams kyi 'bras bu gcig pa nyid dgag par bya ba'i phyir ro//
analyzed: yang na ji ltar 'ug pa pa rnams kyi ltar na yan lag can gyi rdzas gcig skye ba de dgag par bya ba'i don du rdzas brgyad skye ba'o zhes rgyu dang / rkyen rnams kyi 'bras bu gcig pa nyid dgag par bya ba'i phyir ro//
translated: so too, the arising of the one effect of causes and conditions is the same as the arising of the many effects, the different characteristics.

original: ji ltar mtshan nyid tha dad pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs ni gzugs su rung ba'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: ji ltar mtshan nyid tha dad pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs ni gzugs su rung ba'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: How is it that they have different characteristics? Form has the characteristic of being able to be form.

original: tshor ba ni myong ba'i mtshan nyid can no zhes rang gi mtshan nyid tha dad pas so //
analyzed: tshor ba ni myong ba'i mtshan nyid can no zhes rang gi mtshan nyid tha dad pas so //
translated: Feeling has the characteristic of being experienced.

original: 'dus ma byas rnams kyang mtshan nyid tha dad mod kyi /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas rnams kyang mtshan nyid tha dad mod kyi /
translated: The unconditioned also have different characteristics.

original: skye ba ni ma yin pas de'i phyir 'dus byas smos so //üîΩdes par lhan cig skye ba yang yod ces bya ba la /
analyzed: skye ba ni ma yin pas de'i phyir 'dus byas smos so // des par lhan cig skye ba yang yod ces bya ba la /
translated: But they do not arise, therefore conditioned is stated.üîΩThere is also certain simultaneous arising.

original: kha cig lhan cig skye ba yod kyi /
analyzed: kha cig lhan cig skye ba yod kyi /
translated: Some say that simultaneous arising exists,

original: nges par lhan cig skye ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: nges par lhan cig skye ba ni ma yin te /
translated: but it is not certain that it arises simultaneously.

original: dper na mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams dang / mig la sogs pa dag lta bu ste /
analyzed: dper na mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams dang / mig la sogs pa dag lta bu ste /
translated: For example, like the visual consciousness, etc. and the eye, etc.

original: mig la sogs pa dag ni brten pa dang bcas pa dang / de dang mtshungs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde'i @131a * //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa dag ni brten pa dang bcas pa dang / de dang mtshungs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // de'i @131a * //
translated: The eye, etc. are the basis and the same as that.

original: phyir nges pa smos so //
analyzed: phyir nges pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, the word ‚Äúonly‚Äù is stated.

original: chos 'di dag thams cad ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos 'di dag thams cad ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: All these dharmas,

original: rnam pa du ma yod kyang mdor bsdus pa brjod par 'dod na lngar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa du ma yod kyang mdor bsdus pa brjod par 'dod na lngar 'gyur ro //
translated: although they exist in many ways, are stated in brief as five, if one wishes to speak.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How?

original: chos rnams ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: chos rnams ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The dharmas are twofold:

original: gzugs can dang / gzugs can ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs can dang / gzugs can ma yin pa'o //
translated: those with form and those without form.

original: de la gzugs can ma yin pa rnams la rnam pa bzhir dbye ba byas te lngar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la gzugs can ma yin pa rnams la rnam pa bzhir dbye ba byas te lngar 'gyur ro //
translated: Among them, those without form are divided into four kinds and become five.

original: yang ci'i phyir rnam pa lngar bstan zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir rnam pa lngar bstan zhe na /
translated: Again, why are they taught as five kinds?

original: log par rtogs pa dgag pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: log par rtogs pa dgag pa'i phyir te /
translated: In order to refute wrong ideas.

original: gzugs la log par rtogs pa de dgag par bya ba'i phyir 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa tha dad par bshad do //
analyzed: gzugs la log par rtogs pa de dgag par bya ba'i phyir 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa tha dad par bshad do //
translated: In order to refute wrong ideas about form, the primary elements and the derivative form are explained as different.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba don gzhan ma yin no snyam pa la /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba don gzhan ma yin no snyam pa la /
translated: Mind and mental factors are not different objects.

original: sems dang sems byung nges lhan cig / ces 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems dang sems byung nges lhan cig / ces 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Mind and mental factors are definitely simultaneous.

original: thob pa la sogs pa rnams ni yod pa ma yin no snyam pa la /
analyzed: thob pa la sogs pa rnams ni yod pa ma yin no snyam pa la /
translated: Obtainment and so on do not exist.

original: mi ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Nonassociated compositional factors are explained.

original: 'dus ma byas rdzas ma yin no snyam pa la /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas rdzas ma yin no snyam pa la /
translated: Unconditioned states are not substantially existent.

original: bral ba blo yis zad pa yin //
analyzed: bral ba blo yis zad pa yin //
translated: Freedom is the exhaustion of the mind.

original: zhes 'chad do// de lta na bstan pa 'dis ni log par rtogs pa de rnams bkag par 'gyur la /
analyzed: zhes 'chad do// de lta na bstan pa 'dis ni log par rtogs pa de rnams bkag par 'gyur la /
translated: Thus this teaching refutes those misconceptions and

original: rang gi grub mtha' yang gsal bar byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang gi grub mtha' yang gsal bar byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: it also clarifies our tenets.

original: de la 'dus ma byas la ni skye ba med pa nyid do zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: de la 'dus ma byas la ni skye ba med pa nyid do zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: In that regard, it is said that unconditioned states have no arising.

original: de la nges par lhan cig skye ba bsam pa'i skabs yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la nges par lhan cig skye ba bsam pa'i skabs yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore it is not the context to consider that they definitely arise simultaneously.

original: chos gzugs can rnams kyi zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos gzugs can rnams kyi zhes bya ba la /
translated: With respect to the phrase conditioned states that are form,

original: chos gzugs can rnams ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: chos gzugs can rnams ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: conditioned states that are form are of two types.

original: rdul phra rab ces bya ba dang / rdul phra rab ma yin pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rdul phra rab ces bya ba dang / rdul phra rab ma yin pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the so-called atom and the non-atom.

original: rdul phra rab ces bya ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rdul phra rab ces bya ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The so-called atom is also twofold:

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams dang / gzugs na spyod pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams dang / gzugs na spyod pa rnams so //
translated: those in the realm of desire and those in the realm of form.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Those in the realm of desire are also twofold:

original: dbang po med pa rnams dang / dbang po dang bcas pa rnams so //
analyzed: dbang po med pa rnams dang / dbang po dang bcas pa rnams so //
translated: those without faculties and those with faculties.

original: gzugs na spyod pa rnams kyang de dang 'dra bar rnam pa gnyis kho na'o //
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa rnams kyang de dang 'dra bar rnam pa gnyis kho na'o //
translated: Those in the realm of form are also twofold in the same way.üîΩThis is the rule: all that follows is projected by this.

original: nges pa ni 'di yin te zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba thams cad 'phen pa'o //
analyzed: nges pa ni 'di yin te zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba thams cad 'phen pa'o //
translated: Therein, first:

original: de la re zhig /'dod na dbang po med pa dang // sgra med phra rab rdul rdzas brgyad //
analyzed: de la re zhig /'dod na dbang po med pa dang // sgra med phra rab rdul rdzas brgyad //
translated: In the desire realm, the atom without faculties and without sound is eight substances.

original: ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: This is the extensive explanation.

original: thams cad pas phra ba bsags pa'i gzugs ni rdul phra rab ces bya ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: thams cad pas phra ba bsags pa'i gzugs ni rdul phra rab ces bya ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: The form that is the accumulation of the most subtle of all is called the atom.

original: rdul phra rab ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rdul phra rab ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The atom is twofold:

original: rdzas kyi rdul phra rab dang / bsags pa'i rdul phra rab po //
analyzed: rdzas kyi rdul phra rab dang / bsags pa'i rdul phra rab po //
translated: The subtle particle of matter and the subtle particle of aggregation.

original: de la rdzas kyi rdul phra rab ni thams cad pas phra ba thogs pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs kyi yan lag ste /
analyzed: de la rdzas kyi rdul phra rab ni thams cad pas phra ba thogs pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs kyi yan lag ste /
translated: The subtle particle of matter is the smallest of all, the part of matter that is impeded.

original: gang @131b zhig gzugs gzhan nam blos kyang rab tu rnam par dbye bar mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: gang @131b zhig gzugs gzhan nam blos kyang rab tu rnam par dbye bar mi nus pa'o //
translated: It is that which cannot be divided by another material particle or by the mind.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For this reason,

original: de cha shas med pas de la gzugs kyi mtha' zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de cha shas med pas de la gzugs kyi mtha' zhes bya ste /
translated: it is called the limit of matter, because it is partless.

original: skad cig ma phyed med pas skad cig ma dus kyi mtha' nyid yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: skad cig ma phyed med pas skad cig ma dus kyi mtha' nyid yin pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the limit of time, the moment, because it is partless.

original: 'dus pa'i rdul phra rab ni gang las ches phra ba'i 'dus pa gzhan med pa tshogs pa'i yan lag ste /
analyzed: 'dus pa'i rdul phra rab ni gang las ches phra ba'i 'dus pa gzhan med pa tshogs pa'i yan lag ste /
translated: The subtle particle of aggregation is the smallest of all, the part of matter that is aggregated.

original: gzugs gzhan gyis gzhom par mi nus pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs gzhan gyis gzhom par mi nus pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is that which cannot be destroyed by another material particle.

original: gal te 'dus pa'i rdzas kyi yin pa'i phyir skye ba mi rigs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'dus pa'i rdzas kyi yin pa'i phyir skye ba mi rigs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If it is a subtle particle of aggregation, is it not illogical that it should arise, because it is a composite of substances?

original: 'dus pa skye ba zhes de skad du smra /
analyzed: 'dus pa skye ba zhes de skad du smra /
translated: We say that the aggregation arises.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What do we mean?

original: 'dod pa'i khams na dbang po dang sgra'i rdul phra rab ma gtogs pa rdzas brgyad phan tshun 'brel pa med par skye'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams na dbang po dang sgra'i rdul phra rab ma gtogs pa rdzas brgyad phan tshun 'brel pa med par skye'o //
translated: In the desire realm, the eight substances arise without mutual contact, except for the atoms of the faculties and sound.üîΩThis is what is being taught:

original: 'di skad du rdzas brgyad skye'o //
analyzed: 'di skad du rdzas brgyad skye'o //
translated: The eight substances arise,

original: gang yang rung ba zhig ma tshang ba ni ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang yang rung ba zhig ma tshang ba ni ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: not lacking any one of them.

original: de ni 'dod pa'i khams na sgra dang / dbang po dang bral ba'i rdzas brgyad ma 'brel bar skye ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'dod pa'i khams na sgra dang / dbang po dang bral ba'i rdzas brgyad ma 'brel bar skye ba yin no //
translated: In the desire realm, the eight substances arise without mutual contact, except for sound and the faculties.

original: 'dod pa smos pa ni gzugs kyi khams gsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa smos pa ni gzugs kyi khams gsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The mention of the desire realm is for the purpose of clarifying the form realm.

original: de ni dri dang ro med pas rnam pa gzhan du nges par skye bar rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de ni dri dang ro med pas rnam pa gzhan du nges par skye bar rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Since there is no smell or taste there, it is established that they arise in a different way.

original: lus dbang ldan la zhes bya ba la /üîΩrdul phra rab dang sbyar te /üîΩ'khar ba can bzhin no //
analyzed: lus dbang ldan la zhes bya ba la / rdul phra rab dang sbyar te / 'khar ba can bzhin no //
translated: Those possessing the body faculty

original: de ni rdzas dgu nges par lhan cig skye ste /
analyzed: de ni rdzas dgu nges par lhan cig skye ste /
translated: The atoms of those possessing the body faculty definitely arise together with nine substances.

original: lus kyi dbang po ni mig la sogs pa ma gtogs par yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus kyi dbang po ni mig la sogs pa ma gtogs par yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the body faculty exists there, except for the eye faculty and so on.

original: dbang po gzhan ldan rdzas bcu'o //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dbang po gzhan ldan rdzas bcu'o // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Those possessing other faculties are ten substances.

original: 'dus pa gang la mig la sogs pa gzhan yod pa de ni rdzas bcu pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dus pa gang la mig la sogs pa gzhan yod pa de ni rdzas bcu pa yin te /
translated: In any composite where there are other faculties such as the eyes, there are ten substances.

original: mig la sogs pa rnams ni lus kyi dbang po med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir dang / phan tshun tha dad par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa rnams ni lus kyi dbang po med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir dang / phan tshun tha dad par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the eyes and so on do not occur without the body faculty and because they operate separately from each other.

original: rdul phra rab de dag sgra dang bcas pa zhig tu zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: rdul phra rab de dag sgra dang bcas pa zhig tu zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Those atoms that possess sound are ten substances.

original: de la dbang po med pa ni rdzas dgu pa'o //
analyzed: de la dbang po med pa ni rdzas dgu pa'o //
translated: Those that do not possess a faculty are nine substances.

original: lus kyi dbang po dang ldan pa ni rdzas bcu pa'o //
analyzed: lus kyi dbang po dang ldan pa ni rdzas bcu pa'o //
translated: Those possessing the body faculty are ten substances.

original: dbang po gzhan dang ldan pa ni rdzas bcu gcig pa ste /
analyzed: dbang po gzhan dang ldan pa ni rdzas bcu gcig pa ste /
translated: Those possessing other faculties are eleven substances.

original: de dag ni res 'ga' sgra med pa yang yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni res 'ga' sgra med pa yang yin te /
translated: Sometimes they do not possess sound.

original: sgra ni 'byung ba brdegs pa las skyes pa'i phyir na gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du rtag tu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra ni 'byung ba brdegs pa las skyes pa'i phyir na gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du rtag tu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because sound is generated from the striking of the elements, it does not always exist like form and so on.

original: de'i phyir na rdul phra rab de dag sgra dang bcas pa zhig tu skyes na ni zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir na rdul phra rab de dag sgra dang bcas pa zhig tu skyes na ni zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, if those subtle particles arise with sound, then...

original: de nyid kyi phyir dbang po dang tha mi dad pa'i sgra mi dmigs par dogs par byas pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dbang po dang tha mi dad pa'i sgra mi dmigs par dogs par byas pa de'i phyir /
translated: For that very reason, there is the doubt that sound inseparable from the sense faculty is not observed, so it is said:

original: dbang po dang tha mi dad pa'i sgra yang yod de zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //üîΩji ltar na 'byung ba rnams tha mi dad pa las 'di na zhes bya ba dang / nges par lhan cig skye @132a * //
analyzed: dbang po dang tha mi dad pa'i sgra yang yod de zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so // ji ltar na 'byung ba rnams tha mi dad pa las 'di na zhes bya ba dang / nges par lhan cig skye @132a * //
translated: There is also sound inseparable from the sense faculty.üîΩ How is it that from the inseparable primary elements, here...

original: ba'i phyir na dbang po rnams ni tha mi dad pa ste /
analyzed: ba'i phyir na dbang po rnams ni tha mi dad pa ste /
translated: The sense faculties are inseparable because they definitely arise simultaneously.

original: phan tshun rnam par dbye bar mi nus so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: phan tshun rnam par dbye bar mi nus so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means they cannot be separated from each other.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar na tha dad pa med na /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar na tha dad pa med na /
translated: Therefore, how is it that if they are not separate,

original: 'dus pa kha cig kho na ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'dus pa kha cig kho na ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: some collections alone...

original: 'dus pa thams cad la thams cad mtshungs par yod pas thams cad kyi rang gi ngo bo dmigs par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'dus pa thams cad la thams cad mtshungs par yod pas thams cad kyi rang gi ngo bo dmigs par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Since everything exists equally in all collections, the nature of all would be observed.

original: sra ba la sogs par re re dmigs par ni mi 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /üîΩgang zhig gang na ches gsal ba'i //
analyzed: sra ba la sogs par re re dmigs par ni mi 'gyur ro snyam du sems na / gang zhig gang na ches gsal ba'i //
translated: He says:

original: zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The one that is most evident in a certain place.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?üîΩHe says:

original: bshad pa / mthu'i sgo nas shas che ba ste /üîΩnus pa'i sgo nas shas che ba'i rdzas te /
analyzed: bshad pa / mthu'i sgo nas shas che ba ste / nus pa'i sgo nas shas che ba'i rdzas te /
translated: By the power of its predominance.üîΩThe substance that is predominant by the power of its ability,

original: tshad kyi sgo nas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshad kyi sgo nas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: not by the power of its measure.

original: de ni de na dmigs te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ni de na dmigs te zhes bya ba la /
translated: That is observed there.

original: 'byung ba'i 'dus pa sra ba ni sa'i 'byung ba mthu'i sgo nas shas che ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i 'dus pa sra ba ni sa'i 'byung ba mthu'i sgo nas shas che ste /
translated: The collection of elements that is hard is the earth element, which is predominant by the power of its ability.

original: de'i phyir de kho na der dmigs kyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir de kho na der dmigs kyi /
translated: Therefore, only that is observed there,

original: gzhan dag ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni ma yin te /
translated: not the others,

original: bya ba shas che ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bya ba shas che ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not predominant in function.

original: de bzhin du lhag ma rnams la yang brjod par bya'o ;
analyzed: de bzhin du lhag ma rnams la yang brjod par bya'o ;
translated: The same should be said of the remaining elements.

original: / de nyid la dpe ni /
analyzed: / de nyid la dpe ni /
translated: The example of that is:

original: dper na khab dang sdong bu'i tshogs la reg pa lta bu dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: dper na khab dang sdong bu'i tshogs la reg pa lta bu dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ste /
translated: For example, it is like the contact of a collection of needles and sticks.

original: dmigs pa'i rgyu ni yod pa tsam kho na yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rgyu ni yod pa tsam kho na yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The cause of observation is not just the mere existence of the object.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: gsal ba nyid kyang yin te /
analyzed: gsal ba nyid kyang yin te /
translated: It is also the clarity of the object.

original: dper na khab dang / sdong bu rnams dang / phye dang / lan tshva dag tshad mnyam yang khab dang / sdong bu'i tshogs la mthu'i sgo nas sra ba shas che ba'i phyir khab kyi reg bya kho na dmigs kyi /
analyzed: dper na khab dang / sdong bu rnams dang / phye dang / lan tshva dag tshad mnyam yang khab dang / sdong bu'i tshogs la mthu'i sgo nas sra ba shas che ba'i phyir khab kyi reg bya kho na dmigs kyi /
translated: For example, although needles and sticks and flour and salt are equal in quantity, the tactile objects of the needles are observed because the collection of needles has greater power in terms of hardness.

original: sdong bu'i reg bya ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sdong bu'i reg bya ni ma yin no //
translated: The tactile object of the sticks is not observed.

original: de bzhin du mthu dang ldan pa'i phyir lan tshva'i ro kho na dmigs par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du mthu dang ldan pa'i phyir lan tshva'i ro kho na dmigs par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Similarly, the taste of salt is observed because it has greater power.

original: phye'i ro ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phye'i ro ni ma yin no //
translated: The taste of the flour is not observed.

original: gang gi phyir zil gyis mnan pas ma dmigs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zil gyis mnan pas ma dmigs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not that the taste of the flour is not observed because it is suppressed.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: med pas kyang yin no zhes 'dri ba ni /
analyzed: med pas kyang yin no zhes 'dri ba ni /
translated: The question is, ‚ÄúWhy is it not observed because it does not exist?‚Äù

original: yang ji ltar de dag na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: yang ji ltar de dag na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: How is it that they are not observed?

original: sra ba dang / gsher ba dang / dro ba la sogs pa'i 'dus pa dag la 'byung ba lhag ma gsum yod pa nyid du rtogs she na /
analyzed: sra ba dang / gsher ba dang / dro ba la sogs pa'i 'dus pa dag la 'byung ba lhag ma gsum yod pa nyid du rtogs she na /
translated: and the remaining three elements are present in the aggregation of solidity, fluidity, heat, etc.

original: las kyi sgo nas te /üîΩ'byung ba rnams kyi las so sor nges par 'dzin pa dang / sdud pa dang ; smin pa dang / 'phel ba'i bdag nyid can ni /
analyzed: las kyi sgo nas te / 'byung ba rnams kyi las so sor nges par 'dzin pa dang / sdud pa dang ; smin pa dang / 'phel ba'i bdag nyid can ni /
translated: They are known by way of their function.üîΩThe function of the elements is to support, to collect, to ripen, and to expand.

original: 'dzin pa la sogs las su grub //
analyzed: 'dzin pa la sogs las su grub //
translated: They are established as the function of supporting, etc.

original: ces bya bas gong kho nar bshad zin to //
analyzed: ces bya bas gong kho nar bshad zin to //
translated: This was explained above.

original: de'i phyir gang na gang gi las dmigs pa de na de yod pa nyid do zhes bya bar rtogs te /üîΩ'dzin pa la sogs pa las ni byed pa po la ni ltos pa'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang na gang gi las dmigs pa de na de yod pa nyid do zhes bya bar rtogs te / 'dzin pa la sogs pa las ni byed pa po la ni ltos pa'am /
translated: Therefore, where the function of a particular element is observed, that element exists there.üîΩBecause the function of supporting, etc., does not depend on an agent,

original: byed pa po gzhan dang @132b ldan pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa po gzhan dang @132b ldan pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: nor does it depend on another agent.

original: de la rdo la sogs pa'i 'dus pa sra ba la ni drud pa dang / me 'byung ba dang / 'phel zhing ltung ba dag las chu dang / me dang / rlung rnams yod pa nyid du rtogs la /
analyzed: de la rdo la sogs pa'i 'dus pa sra ba la ni drud pa dang / me 'byung ba dang / 'phel zhing ltung ba dag las chu dang / me dang / rlung rnams yod pa nyid du rtogs la /
translated: In the aggregation of solidity, such as a stone, etc., the presence of water, fire, and wind is known from the functions of dragging, the arising of fire, and expansion and falling.

original: 'dus pa gsher ba la ni gru la sogs pa rnams 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / dro ba'i phyir dang / g-yo ba'i phyir lhag ma rnams yod pa nyid du rtogs so //üîΩme'i 'dus pa dro ba la me lce rnams brten pa dang / bsdus pa dang / g-yo ba dag las lhag ma rnams yod pa nyid du rtogs so //
analyzed: 'dus pa gsher ba la ni gru la sogs pa rnams 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / dro ba'i phyir dang / g-yo ba'i phyir lhag ma rnams yod pa nyid du rtogs so // me'i 'dus pa dro ba la me lce rnams brten pa dang / bsdus pa dang / g-yo ba dag las lhag ma rnams yod pa nyid du rtogs so //
translated: and the element of water is inferred to exist in the collection of water because it supports boats and so on, and because it is wet and fluid.üîΩThe element of fire is inferred to exist in the collection of fire because it supports the flames, and because it is hot and fluid.

original: rlung gi 'dus pa g-yo ba la 'dzin pa dang / grang ba dang / dro ba dag dmigs pa las lhag ma rnams yod pa nyid du rtogs so //
analyzed: rlung gi 'dus pa g-yo ba la 'dzin pa dang / grang ba dang / dro ba dag dmigs pa las lhag ma rnams yod pa nyid du rtogs so //
translated: The element of wind is inferred to exist in the collection of wind because it supports the movement of the wind, and because it is cold and hot.

original: rkyen dang phrad na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: rkyen dang phrad na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: If the conditions are met,

original: me la sogs pa'i rkyen dang phrad na zangs la sogs pa rnams gsher bar dmigs pa'i phyir de la chu'i khams yod par khong du chud la /
analyzed: me la sogs pa'i rkyen dang phrad na zangs la sogs pa rnams gsher bar dmigs pa'i phyir de la chu'i khams yod par khong du chud la /
translated: if the conditions of fire and so on are met, the element of water is inferred to exist in copper and so on because it is observed to be wet.

original: grang ba la sogs pa'i rkyen dang phrad pas gsher ba la sra ba la sogs pa mthong ba'i phyir de la sa'i khams yod pa nyid du nges so //
analyzed: grang ba la sogs pa'i rkyen dang phrad pas gsher ba la sra ba la sogs pa mthong ba'i phyir de la sa'i khams yod pa nyid du nges so //
translated: The element of earth exists in water, because when water is exposed to cold, etc., it becomes hard, etc.üîΩSimilarly, the element of fire exists in earth, because when a pile of wood, etc., is compressed, heat is perceived; and the element of wind exists in earth, because when a pile of earth, etc., is shaken, movement is perceived.üîΩThe element of fire exists in wind, because when wind is compressed, heat is perceived.üîΩThe element of wind exists in fire, because when fire is stirred, movement is perceived.üîΩThe element of earth exists in fire, because when fire is compressed, solidity is perceived.

original: de bzhin du sra ba'i tshogs drud pa las dro ba dmigs pa'i phyir me yod pa nyid dang / mngon par brdegs pa las yan lag byer ba las rlung gi khams yod pa nyid du shes so //
analyzed: de bzhin du sra ba'i tshogs drud pa las dro ba dmigs pa'i phyir me yod pa nyid dang / mngon par brdegs pa las yan lag byer ba las rlung gi khams yod pa nyid du shes so //
translated: The element of water exists in fire, because when fire is compressed, liquidity is perceived.üîΩThe element of wind exists in water, because when water is compressed, movement is perceived.üîΩThe element of earth exists in wind, because when wind is compressed, solidity is perceived.üîΩThe element of fire exists in wind, because when wind is compressed, heat is perceived.üîΩThe element of water exists in wind, because when wind is compressed, liquidity is perceived.

original: yod pa ni rkyen gyi mthu'i sgo nas bya ba chas che ba nyid du byed kyi /üîΩmed pa skye bar ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yod pa ni rkyen gyi mthu'i sgo nas bya ba chas che ba nyid du byed kyi / med pa skye bar ni ma yin te /
translated: The element of earth exists in water, because when water is compressed, solidity is perceived.üîΩThe element of fire exists in water, because when water is compressed, heat is perceived.üîΩThe element of wind exists in water, because when water is compressed, movement is perceived.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The element of earth exists in fire, because when fire is compressed, solidity is perceived.üîΩThe element of water exists in fire, because when fire is compressed, liquidity is perceived.üîΩThe element of wind exists in fire, because when fire is compressed, movement is perceived.

original: gzhan dag na re chu dag la grang ba'i khyad par gyi sgo nas zhes bya ba ni slob dpon dpal len yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re chu dag la grang ba'i khyad par gyi sgo nas zhes bya ba ni slob dpon dpal len yin te /
translated: The element of water exists in wind, because when wind is compressed, liquidity is perceived.üîΩThe element of earth exists in wind, because when wind is compressed, solidity is perceived.üîΩThe element of fire exists in wind, because when wind is compressed, heat is perceived.üîΩThe element of water exists in wind, because when wind is compressed, liquidity is perceived.üîΩThe element of earth exists in water, because when water is compressed, solidity is perceived.

original: me chung ches pa dang / ches chungs pa dang / chung ba dang 'dres pa'i phyir chu dag la grang ba'i khyad par te /
analyzed: me chung ches pa dang / ches chungs pa dang / chung ba dang 'dres pa'i phyir chu dag la grang ba'i khyad par te /
translated: The element of fire exists in water, because when water is compressed, heat is perceived.üîΩThe element of wind exists in water, because when water is compressed, movement is perceived.üîΩThe element of earth exists in wind, because when wind is compressed, solidity is perceived.üîΩThe element of fire exists in wind, because when wind is compressed, heat is perceived

original: grang ba dang / ches grang ba dang / grangs ches pa zhes bya ba rung ste /
analyzed: grang ba dang / ches grang ba dang / grangs ches pa zhes bya ba rung ste /
translated: Cold, very cold, and extremely cold are suitable.

original: grang ba dang ni dro ba'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: grang ba dang ni dro ba'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Cold is the antidote to heat.

original: dngos po rnams mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang 'dres pa nyid las ches zhan pa dang / zhan ches pa la sogs par tha dad do zhes bya ba 'di ni gcig tu nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po rnams mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang 'dres pa nyid las ches zhan pa dang / zhan ches pa la sogs par tha dad do zhes bya ba 'di ni gcig tu nges pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not definite that things are differentiated as weak, middling, and strong due to being mixed with their opposing factors.

original: zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate this, he says:

original: ma 'dres kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: ma 'dres kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Even though they are not mixed.

original: ji ltar sgra rdzas gzhan dang 'dres pa med cing rang gi rigs las ma 'das pa gsal ba dang / ches gsal ba dang / gsal ches pa yin pa dang / de bzhin du bde ba dang / sdug bsngal cig car srid pa med mod kyi /
analyzed: ji ltar sgra rdzas gzhan dang 'dres pa med cing rang gi rigs las ma 'das pa gsal ba dang / ches gsal ba dang / gsal ches pa yin pa dang / de bzhin du bde ba dang / sdug bsngal cig car srid pa med mod kyi /
translated: Just as sound is not mixed with other substances, does not transcend its type, and is clear, very clear, and extremely clear, and just as pleasure and pain do not occur simultaneously,

original: 'on kyang rang gi rigs las ma 'das par tshor ba la khyad par mthong ba'i phyir na tshor ba bde ba /
analyzed: 'on kyang rang gi rigs las ma 'das par tshor ba la khyad par mthong ba'i phyir na tshor ba bde ba /
translated: even so, since one sees a difference in feeling that does not transcend its type, there is the feeling of pleasure.

original: ma tshor ba @133a * //
analyzed: ma tshor ba @133a * //
translated: There is no feeling of pain.

original: sdug bsngal dang 'dres pa la ltos pa med la /üîΩsdug bsngal ma tshor ba bde ba dang 'dres pa la ltos pa med la de bzhin du chu dag la yang rdzas gzhan dang 'dres pa med cing /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang 'dres pa la ltos pa med la / sdug bsngal ma tshor ba bde ba dang 'dres pa la ltos pa med la de bzhin du chu dag la yang rdzas gzhan dang 'dres pa med cing /
translated: It is not that it is dependent on being mixed with suffering.üîΩIt is not that it is dependent on being mixed with pleasure, since pleasure is not experienced when suffering is not experienced.

original: rang gi rigs las ma 'das pa grang bar khyad par du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang gi rigs las ma 'das pa grang bar khyad par du 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, water is not mixed with a different substance, but it is distinguished by its coldness, since it does not transcend its own type.

original: gzhan dag na re de dag la sa bon gyi sgo nas yod kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re de dag la sa bon gyi sgo nas yod kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Others say that they exist there in the form of seeds, etc.

original: sa bon gyi sgo nas zhes bya ba ni nus pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: sa bon gyi sgo nas zhes bya ba ni nus pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: In the form of seeds means in the form of a potential.

original: de dag la zhes bya ba ni sra ba la sogs pa'i tshogs pa dag la'o //
analyzed: de dag la zhes bya ba ni sra ba la sogs pa'i tshogs pa dag la'o //
translated: There means in the collection of solidity, etc.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni sa la sogs pa dag go //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni sa la sogs pa dag go //
translated: They means earth, etc.

original: rang gi ngo bor ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni rdzas su ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bor ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni rdzas su ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Not in their own nature means not substantially.

original: ci'i phyir rang gi ngo bor ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rang gi ngo bor ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why not in their own nature?

original: de'i phyir / shing gi phung po 'di la khams rnam pa sna tshogs yod do zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / shing gi phung po 'di la khams rnam pa sna tshogs yod do zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says, ‚ÄúIn this heap of wood, there are various elements.‚Äù

original: sa bon rnams zhes bya bar rtogs kyi /
analyzed: sa bon rnams zhes bya bar rtogs kyi /
translated: One understands the seeds,

original: gser la sogs pa'i khams rnams rang gi ngo bos gnas pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gser la sogs pa'i khams rnams rang gi ngo bos gnas pa ni ma yin te /
translated: but not that the elements of gold, etc. exist by their own nature,

original: 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is contradictory.

original: shing gi phung po'i cha shas chung yang bsam gtan pa du ma'i mos pa tha dad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shing gi phung po'i cha shas chung yang bsam gtan pa du ma'i mos pa tha dad pa'i phyir /
translated: Even in a small part of a heap of wood, there are many contemplatives with different inclinations.

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis lhag par mos pa'i khyad par gyi sgo nas gser gyi khams so //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis lhag par mos pa'i khyad par gyi sgo nas gser gyi khams so //
translated: Through the difference of the special inclinations of the yogins, they understand the elements of gold,

original: dngul gyi khams so //
analyzed: dngul gyi khams so //
translated: the elements of silver,

original: zangs kyi khams so zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa rnams su yongs su rtogs kyi /
analyzed: zangs kyi khams so zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa rnams su yongs su rtogs kyi /
translated: the elements of copper, etc.

original: 'gal ba'i phyir na rang gi ngo bor ni ma yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i phyir na rang gi ngo bor ni ma yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: But they do not understand them as existing by their own nature, because that is contradictory.

original: bsam gtan pa rnams kyi mos pa tha dad pa'i phyir 'di ni mi sdug pa ltar mos pa yid la byed pa yin gyi de kho na yid la byed pa ni ma yin no zhes gang bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan pa rnams kyi mos pa tha dad pa'i phyir 'di ni mi sdug pa ltar mos pa yid la byed pa yin gyi de kho na yid la byed pa ni ma yin no zhes gang bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is attention to conviction, not attention to reality, as in the case of the meditation on foulness.

original: dngos po rnams ni mthong ba tha dad pa'i rjes su byed pa na rang gi bdag nyid yongs su 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po rnams ni mthong ba tha dad pa'i rjes su byed pa na rang gi bdag nyid yongs su 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: When things are seen differently, they do not change their own nature.

original: gcig la cig car bdag nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: gcig la cig car bdag nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: It is not tenable that one thing has many natures.

original: / gal te rdul phra rab rdzas brgyad po nges par lhan cig skye na /
analyzed: / gal te rdul phra rab rdzas brgyad po nges par lhan cig skye na /
translated: If the eight substances of the atom are definitely produced simultaneously,

original: rlung la kha dog ji ltar yod //üîΩces pa 'am /
analyzed: rlung la kha dog ji ltar yod // ces pa 'am /
translated: how can wind have color?
