original: yang na gsher ba nyid la sogs pa rkyen yod na sra ba la sogs pa rnams la gsher ba nyid la sogs pa dmigs pa'i phyir sngar yang de yod pa nyid du smras na /
analyzed: yang na gsher ba nyid la sogs pa rkyen yod na sra ba la sogs pa rnams la gsher ba nyid la sogs pa dmigs pa'i phyir sngar yang de yod pa nyid du smras na /
translated: Or, if you say that solidity, etc., exist previously because fluidity, etc., are perceived when the conditions of fluidity, etc., are present,

original: gang dang 'brel pa las rlung la kha dog dmigs par 'gyur ba'i rkyen ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang dang 'brel pa las rlung la kha dog dmigs par 'gyur ba'i rkyen ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: then there is no condition for the perception of color in wind.

original: de'i phyir rlung la kha dog ji ltar yod pa brjod par bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir rlung la kha dog ji ltar yod pa brjod par bya'o zhe na /
translated: Therefore, you must state what the color of the wind is.

original: don 'di ni dad par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: don 'di ni dad par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: This point is to be accepted with faith,

original: rjes su dpag par bya ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: but it is not to be inferred.

original: lkog tu gyur pa'i don la ni rnam pa gnyis kyis rtogs te /
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa'i don la ni rnam pa gnyis kyis rtogs te /
translated: An object that is hidden from the senses is understood in two ways:

original: rjes su dpag pa @133b dang ; yid ches pa'i lung gis so //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa @133b dang ; yid ches pa'i lung gis so //
translated: through inference and through a trustworthy person.

original: de'i phyir 'dir ni bshad ma thag ba'i rjes su dpag pa mi srid kyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir ni bshad ma thag ba'i rjes su dpag pa mi srid kyi /
translated: Therefore, here, the previously mentioned inference is impossible,

original: yid ches pa'i tshig tshad ma nyid du gyur pa kho na las rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: yid ches pa'i tshig tshad ma nyid du gyur pa kho na las rtogs par bya'o //
translated: but it is to be understood from a trustworthy person‚Äôs words that are valid cognitions.

original: don 'di ni mchog tu yid ches pa dag gis gsungs so zhes bya bar rtogs par bya'i /
analyzed: don 'di ni mchog tu yid ches pa dag gis gsungs so zhes bya bar rtogs par bya'i /
translated: This point is to be understood as having been stated by those who are supremely trustworthy.

original: don 'di rjes su dpag pas bsgrub par bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don 'di rjes su dpag pas bsgrub par bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: This point is not to be established by inference.

original: yang na dad par bya ba yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad de /üîΩ'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: yang na dad par bya ba yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad de / 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: Or, it is not only to be accepted with faith,

original: rjes su dpag par bya ba yang yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya ba yang yin no //
translated: but also to be inferred.

original: 'dres par dri 'dzin pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dres par dri 'dzin pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba la /
translated: because it is mixed with the smell that is grasped.

original: dri dang ldan pa'i rdzas dang 'dres pas rlung gis dri khrod nas 'ongs pa'i phyir dang / 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / dri 'ongs pa la yang kha dog 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dri dang ldan pa'i rdzas dang 'dres pas rlung gis dri khrod nas 'ongs pa'i phyir dang / 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / dri 'ongs pa la yang kha dog 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The wind comes from the midst of the smell because it is mixed with the substance that possesses the smell. It is also because it grasps the smell and because the color of the smell that comes is not confused.

original: gzugs ni gzugs kyi khams la dri 'khrul gyi /
analyzed: gzugs ni gzugs kyi khams la dri 'khrul gyi /
translated: Form is confused with the form element,

original: dri ni gzugs la ma yin te /
analyzed: dri ni gzugs la ma yin te /
translated: but smell is not confused with form.

original: de'i gang na dri yod pa de na gzugs yod do zhes bya bar rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i gang na dri yod pa de na gzugs yod do zhes bya bar rtogs par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that wherever there is smell, there is form.

original: rdzas drug dang / bdun dang / brgyad dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rdzas drug dang / bdun dang / brgyad dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Possessing six, seven, or eight substances.

original: gzugs kyi khams na ni dri dang ro gnyis med de /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams na ni dri dang ro gnyis med de /
translated: In the form realm, there are no two: smell and taste.

original: de'i phyir dbang po dang / sgra dang bral ba ni rdzas drug dang ldan no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dbang po dang / sgra dang bral ba ni rdzas drug dang ldan no //
translated: Therefore, one who is devoid of the faculties and sound possesses six substances.

original: lus kyi dbang po dang ldan pa ni rdzas bdun dang ldan no //
analyzed: lus kyi dbang po dang ldan pa ni rdzas bdun dang ldan no //
translated: One who possesses the body faculty possesses seven substances.

original: dbang po gzhan dang ldan pa ni rdzas brgyad pa yin no //
analyzed: dbang po gzhan dang ldan pa ni rdzas brgyad pa yin no //
translated: One who possesses another faculty possesses eight substances.

original: smras pa / gzugs na dbang po med pa dang // sgra med phra rab rdul rdzas drug / lus dbang ldan pa rdzas bdun te //
analyzed: smras pa / gzugs na dbang po med pa dang // sgra med phra rab rdul rdzas drug / lus dbang ldan pa rdzas bdun te //
translated: Those with a body faculty have seven substances.

original: dbang po gzhan ldan rtag rdzas brgyad //
analyzed: dbang po gzhan ldan rtag rdzas brgyad //
translated: Those with other faculties always have eight substances.

original: ces so // de dag sgra dang bcas na ni rdzas bdun dang / brgyad dang / dgu dang ldan no //
analyzed: ces so // de dag sgra dang bcas na ni rdzas bdun dang / brgyad dang / dgu dang ldan no //
translated: If they have sound, they have seven, eight, or nine substances.

original: don gyis bshad zin pa dang 'dra ba nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: don gyis bshad zin pa dang 'dra ba nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because the meaning has already been explained,

original: de bshad zin pa 'dra ba'i dngos po ni bshad zin pa 'dra ba nyid do //
analyzed: de bshad zin pa 'dra ba'i dngos po ni bshad zin pa 'dra ba nyid do //
translated: it is similar to what has already been explained.

original: brjod pa don med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir yang mi bshad do //
analyzed: brjod pa don med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir yang mi bshad do //
translated: Because it would follow that the explanation would be meaningless, it is not explained.

original: yang ci 'dir zhes bya ba ni rdul phra rab rdzas brgyad dang ldan par ro //
analyzed: yang ci 'dir zhes bya ba ni rdul phra rab rdzas brgyad dang ldan par ro //
translated: Again, here means in the form realm, with eight substances.

original: rdzas kho na rdzas su gzung zhes bya ba ni rdzas kyi sgras sa la sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid kho na brjod kyi /
analyzed: rdzas kho na rdzas su gzung zhes bya ba ni rdzas kyi sgras sa la sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid kho na brjod kyi /
translated: Only substances are taken as substances means that the term substance expresses only the intrinsic characteristics of earth and so on,

original: skye mched kyi rang gi mtshan nyid ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: skye mched kyi rang gi mtshan nyid ma yin pa'o //
translated: not the intrinsic characteristics of the sense bases.

original: 'on te skye mched kyi rdzas zhes bya ba ni skye mched kyi rang gi mtshan nyid mang po rnams kyi gcig nyid gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: 'on te skye mched kyi rdzas zhes bya ba ni skye mched kyi rang gi mtshan nyid mang po rnams kyi gcig nyid gang yin pa ste /
translated: Or else, the substance of the sense-spheres is the oneness of the many intrinsic natures of the sense-spheres.

original: dper na rnam pa nyi shu'i dbye bas phye ba ni gzugs kyi skye mched yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na rnam pa nyi shu'i dbye bas phye ba ni gzugs kyi skye mched yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the sense-sphere of visible form, which is distinguished by the twenty aspects of color and so on.

original: gal te rdzas kho na la rdzas su grub gzung na ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gal te rdzas kho na la rdzas su grub gzung na ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: If only substance is apprehended as substance,

original: gal te rdzas kho na rdzas kyi sgras gzung gi / skye mched kyi rang gi mtshan nyid ma yin @134a * //
analyzed: gal te rdzas kho na rdzas kyi sgras gzung gi / skye mched kyi rang gi mtshan nyid ma yin @134a * //
translated: if only substance is apprehended by the word substance and not the intrinsic nature of the sense-spheres,

original: na ni de lta yin dang ha cang nyungs par smras pa yin te /
analyzed: na ni de lta yin dang ha cang nyungs par smras pa yin te /
translated: then this is a very limited statement,

original: rdul phra rab de la brgyad dang / dgu dang / bcu dang / bcu gcig las tha dad pa'i rdzas gzhan yang yod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rdul phra rab de la brgyad dang / dgu dang / bcu dang / bcu gcig las tha dad pa'i rdzas gzhan yang yod pa'i phyir te /
translated: because there are other substances that are different from eight, nine, ten, and eleven of those atoms.

original: dbyibs de yang rdul phra rab bsags pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbyibs de yang rdul phra rab bsags pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And that shape is also an aggregation of atoms.

original: lci ba nyid dang / yang ba nyid dag la sa gang yang rung ba zhig dang / 'jam pa nyid dang / rtsub pa nyid dag las gang yang rung ba zhig kyang gdon mi za bar yod de /üîΩ'dus pa'i gzugs ni lci ba nyid dang / yang ba nyid dang bral ba'am /
analyzed: lci ba nyid dang / yang ba nyid dag la sa gang yang rung ba zhig dang / 'jam pa nyid dang / rtsub pa nyid dag las gang yang rung ba zhig kyang gdon mi za bar yod de / 'dus pa'i gzugs ni lci ba nyid dang / yang ba nyid dang bral ba'am /
translated: Heavy and light exist in any of the four primary elements, and smooth and rough exist in any of the three primary elements, except for the primary element of water.üîΩThere is no composite form that is devoid of heaviness and lightness,

original: 'jam pa nyid dang / rtsub pa nyid dang bral ba 'ga' yang med do //üîΩgrang ba dang / bkres pa dang / skom pa dag ni rdul phra rab thams cad la mi srid pas kha cig la ni zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: 'jam pa nyid dang / rtsub pa nyid dang bral ba 'ga' yang med do // grang ba dang / bkres pa dang / skom pa dag ni rdul phra rab thams cad la mi srid pas kha cig la ni zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: or devoid of smoothness and roughness.üîΩCold, hunger, and thirst are not possible in all atoms, so it says ‚Äúin some.‚Äù

original: 'on te skye mched la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'on te skye mched la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: If you say they are sense bases, then there would be no sense base of tangibility.

original: gal te skye mched kyi rang gi mtshan nyid dbang du byas nas rdzas su brjod kyi /
analyzed: gal te skye mched kyi rang gi mtshan nyid dbang du byas nas rdzas su brjod kyi /
translated: If you say that tangibility is described as a substance from the perspective of the intrinsic identity of the sense base,

original: rdzas kyi rang gi mtshan nyid ma yin na'o //
analyzed: rdzas kyi rang gi mtshan nyid ma yin na'o //
translated: and not from the perspective of the intrinsic identity of substance,

original: rdzas bzhi dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rdzas bzhi dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: then you have to say that the four primary elements exist in the sense base of tangibility.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: de'i phyir 'byung ba las gyur pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'byung ba las gyur pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Therefore, the author of the treatise states:üîΩThe primary elements are the source of the derived form, and the derived form is the source of the sense base of tangibility.üîΩThe sense base of tangibility is not only the derived form, but also the primary elements.

original: 'byung ba ji snyed pa dag kyang reg bya'i skye mched yin no zhes bya ba smos so //üîΩrten du gyur pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni sa la sogs pa ste /üîΩde ni rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyi rten yin no //
analyzed: 'byung ba ji snyed pa dag kyang reg bya'i skye mched yin no zhes bya ba smos so // rten du gyur pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni sa la sogs pa ste / de ni rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyi rten yin no //
translated: The primary elements are the source of the derived form, and the derived form is the source of the sense base of tangibility.

original: rten can du gyur pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni rgyur byas pa'i gzugs so //
analyzed: rten can du gyur pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni rgyur byas pa'i gzugs so //
translated: The primary elements are the source of the derived form, and the derived form is the source of the sense base of tangibility.

original: de ltar na dbyibs ni gzugs kyi skye mched kyi khongs su 'du la /üîΩlci ba nyid la sogs pa rnams ni reg bya'i skye mched kyi khongs su 'du ba'i phyir ha cang nyungs pa dang ha cang mangs par smras pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na dbyibs ni gzugs kyi skye mched kyi khongs su 'du la / lci ba nyid la sogs pa rnams ni reg bya'i skye mched kyi khongs su 'du ba'i phyir ha cang nyungs pa dang ha cang mangs par smras pa ma yin no //
translated: The primary elements are the source of the derived form, and the derived form is the source of the sense base of tangibility.üîΩThe primary elements are the source of the derived form, and the derived form is the source of the sense base of tangibility.üîΩThe primary elements are the source of the derived form, and the derived form is the source of the sense base of tangibility.üîΩThe primary elements are the source of the derived form, and the derived form is the source of the sense base of tangibility.üîΩThe primary elements are the source of the derived form, and the derived form is the source of the sense base of tangibility.üîΩThe primary elements are the source of the derived form, and the derived form is the source of the sense base of tangibility.üîΩThe primary elements are the source of the derived form, and the derived form is the source of the sense base of tangibility.üîΩThe primary elements are the source of the derived form, and the derived form is the source of the sense base of tangibility.üîΩThe primary elements are the source of the derived form, and the derived form is the source of the sense base of tangibility.üîΩThe primary elements are the source of the derived form, and the derived form is the source of the sense base of tangibility.üîΩThe primary elements are the source of the derived form, and the derived form is the source of the sense base of tangibility.üîΩThe primary elements are the source of the derived form, and the derived form is the source of the sense base of tangibility.üîΩThe primary elements are the source of the derived form, and the derived form is the source of the sense base of tangibility.

original: gal te rten du gyur pa rdzas kho na la rdzas su gzung ba de lta na yang mangs pa nyid las mi grol lo //üîΩci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rten du gyur pa rdzas kho na la rdzas su gzung ba de lta na yang mangs pa nyid las mi grol lo //üîΩci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: The primary elements are the source of the derived form, and the derived form is the source of the sense base of tangibility.üîΩThe primary elements are the source of the derived form, and the derived form is the source of the sense base of

original: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúThe form derived from the four great elements is not the same as the four great elements.‚Äù

original: 'byung ba bzhi tshan gang zhig rgyur byas pa'i gzugs gcig gi rten yin pa de nyid rgyur byas pa gzhan gyi ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'byung ba bzhi tshan gang zhig rgyur byas pa'i gzugs gcig gi rten yin pa de nyid rgyur byas pa gzhan gyi ni ma yin te /
translated: The four great elements that are the cause of one form derived from the great elements are not the cause of another form derived from the great elements.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is the cause of another form derived from the great elements?üîΩThe four great elements that are the cause of another form derived from the great elements are different from the four great elements that are the cause of the first form derived from the great elements.

original: de'i rten ni 'byung ba bzhi tshan gzhan nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' yin no //
analyzed: de'i rten ni 'byung ba bzhi tshan gzhan nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' yin no //
translated: This is the conclusion of the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas.

original: 'byung ba'i rdzas rnams ni mang po nyid yin la /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i rdzas rnams ni mang po nyid yin la /
translated: The substances of the great elements are many.üîΩAnd they are definitely generated simultaneously, not separately, like the form derived from the great elements.üîΩThe substances of the great elements are not the same as the substances of the great elements that are their cause.üîΩThe substances of the great elements are not the same as the substances of the great elements that are their effect.

original: de dag kyang rgyur byas pa'i gzugs ltar gdon mi za bar phan tshun nges par lhan cig skye bar 'gyur ro //üîΩ'di ni rigs las rdzas su gzung ste zhes bya ba ni sa la sogs pa'i rigs so //
analyzed: de dag kyang rgyur byas pa'i gzugs ltar gdon mi za bar phan tshun nges par lhan cig skye bar 'gyur ro // 'di ni rigs las rdzas su gzung ste zhes bya ba ni sa la sogs pa'i rigs so //
translated: The substances of the great elements are not the same as the substances of the form derived from the great elements that are their cause.üîΩThe substances of the form derived from the great elements are not the same as the substances of the form derived from the great elements that are their cause.üîΩThe substances of the form derived from the great elements are not the same as the substances of the great elements that are their cause.üîΩThe substances of the form derived from the great elements are not the same as the substances of the great elements that are their effect.

original: 'byung ba bzhi tshan gzhan dag kyang 'byung ba bzhi tshan gcig gi rigs gang yin pa de kho na las mi 'da' ste /üîΩde nyid kyi rgyu bshad @134b pa ;
analyzed: 'byung ba bzhi tshan gzhan dag kyang 'byung ba bzhi tshan gcig gi rigs gang yin pa de kho na las mi 'da' ste /üîΩde nyid kyi rgyu bshad @134b pa ;
translated: The substances of the form derived from the great elements are not the same as the substances of the form derived from the great elements that are their effect.üîΩThe substances of the form derived from the great elements are not the same as the substances of the great elements that are their cause.üîΩThe substances of the form derived from the great elements are not the same as the substances of the form derived from the great elements that are their cause.üîΩThe substances of the form derived from the great elements are not the same as the substances of the great elements that are their cause.üîΩThe substances of the form derived from the great elements are not the same as the substances of the form derived from the great elements that are their cause.üîΩThe substances of the form derived from the great elements are not the same as the substances of the great elements that are their cause.üîΩThe substances of the form derived from the great elements are not the same as the substances of the form derived from the great elements that are their cause.

original: 'byung ba bzhi tshan gzhan dag kyang sa la sogs pa'i rigs las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba bzhi tshan gzhan dag kyang sa la sogs pa'i rigs las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the other sets of four primary elements do not exceed the type of earth, etc.

original: mig la sogs pa re re'i rten 'byung ba bzhi tshan gang dag yin pa de dag ni phan tshun 'byung ba bzhi tshan gyi rigs las mi 'da' ste /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa re re'i rten 'byung ba bzhi tshan gang dag yin pa de dag ni phan tshun 'byung ba bzhi tshan gyi rigs las mi 'da' ste /
translated: The four primary elements that are the basis of each of the eyes, etc., do not exceed the type of the four primary elements, and

original: de'i phyir 'byung ba chen po bzhi zhes 'byung ba'i bzhi tshan gcig nyid du bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'byung ba chen po bzhi zhes 'byung ba'i bzhi tshan gcig nyid du bshad do //
translated: therefore they are explained as a single set of four primary elements.

original: de ltar 'bad de zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /üîΩ'dir cung zad cig ni rdzas kho na rdzas yin la /
analyzed: de ltar 'bad de zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste / 'dir cung zad cig ni rdzas kho na rdzas yin la /
translated: This is the effort that is made, etc.üîΩHere, some are substantial entities alone,

original: cung zad cig ni skye mched kyi rdzas yin zhing /
analyzed: cung zad cig ni skye mched kyi rdzas yin zhing /
translated: some are substantial entities that are sense bases,

original: slar yang rigs kyi rdzas yin no zhes de ltar bye brag tu bstan par bya ba'i phyir 'bad pa 'di la don ci yod /
analyzed: slar yang rigs kyi rdzas yin no zhes de ltar bye brag tu bstan par bya ba'i phyir 'bad pa 'di la don ci yod /
translated: and some are substantial entities that are types. What is the point of this effort to teach them in this way?

original: 'dun pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni 'dun pa zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: 'dun pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni 'dun pa zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: In terms of desire means in terms of the meaning of desire.

original: mdor bsdus pa dang / rgyas pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdor bsdus pa dang / rgyas pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is in accordance with the concise and the extensive.

original: don la brtag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni ci rdzas 'di dag lhan cig nges par skye ba yin nam ma yin zhes bya bar ro //
analyzed: don la brtag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni ci rdzas 'di dag lhan cig nges par skye ba yin nam ma yin zhes bya bar ro //
translated: The meaning is: Are these substances definitely generated together or not?

original: gzugs can rnams kyi nges par lhan cig skye ba bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzugs can rnams kyi nges par lhan cig skye ba bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The definite generation together of those having form has already been explained.

original: 'dod na dbang po med pa dang // sgra med phra rab rdul rdzas brgyad //
analyzed: 'dod na dbang po med pa dang // sgra med phra rab rdul rdzas brgyad //
translated: In the desire realm, a subtle particle is eight substances, without faculties and without sound.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: This is explained in the Abhidharmako≈õa.üîΩThe remaining ones should be stated.

original: lhag ma rnams kyi brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sems dang sems las byung ba dang ldan pa ma yin pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams kyi brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sems dang sems las byung ba dang ldan pa ma yin pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: The remaining ones are mind, mental factors, and those not associated with mind.

original: sems dang sems byung nges lhan cig / ces bya ba la /üîΩsems thams cad sems las byung ba thams cad dam /
analyzed: sems dang sems byung nges lhan cig / ces bya ba la / sems thams cad sems las byung ba thams cad dam /
translated: Mind and mental factors are definitely generated together.üîΩAll minds are not definitely generated together with all mental factors,

original: sems las byung ba thams cad sems thams cad dang lhan cig nges par skye ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sems las byung ba thams cad sems thams cad dang lhan cig nges par skye ba ni ma yin te /
translated: nor are all mental factors definitely generated together with all minds.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams phan tshun bral ba skye ba ma yin no zhes bya bar nges par gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams phan tshun bral ba skye ba ma yin no zhes bya bar nges par gzung bar bya'o //
translated: It should be ascertained that minds and mental factors do not arise without mutual dependence.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Therefore,

original: 'di dag ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: 'di dag ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: it is said:

original: phan tshun rag las te /
analyzed: phan tshun rag las te /
translated: They are mutually dependent,

original: lus kyi rnyed pa'i phyir phan tshun med na 'byung bar mi nus so //üîΩbshad pa / sems las byung ba med pa yi //
analyzed: lus kyi rnyed pa'i phyir phan tshun med na 'byung bar mi nus so // bshad pa / sems las byung ba med pa yi //
translated: because they cannot occur without each other in order to obtain a body.üîΩReply: A mind never occurs

original: sems ni nam yang mi 'byung ste //
analyzed: sems ni nam yang mi 'byung ste //
translated: without mental factors,

original: nyi ma dang ni 'od zer bzhin //
analyzed: nyi ma dang ni 'od zer bzhin //
translated: just as the sun does not shine without its light.

original: de dag nyid dang lhan cig 'byung //
analyzed: de dag nyid dang lhan cig 'byung //
translated: They occur together with those.

original: thams cad 'dus byas mtshan nyid dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: thams cad 'dus byas mtshan nyid dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: All have the characteristics of conditioned states.

original: 'dus byas ni skye ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas ni skye ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Conditioned states are not mistaken with regard to the characteristics of arising and so on.

original: thams cad ces bya ba ni gzugs dang / sems dang sems las byung ba dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed dag yin gyi /
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba ni gzugs dang / sems dang sems las byung ba dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed dag yin gyi /
translated: All refers to form, minds, mental factors, and formations not associated with minds.

original: 'dus ma byas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni ma yin te /
translated: It does not refer to unconditioned states.

original: skye ba'i dbang du byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba'i dbang du byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is from the point of view of birth that it is said that something arises.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /üîΩgang cung zad skye ba zhes smras so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir / gang cung zad skye ba zhes smras so //
translated: For this very reason,

original: thob pa'am zhes bya ba la /üîΩsems can du ston @135a * //üîΩpa kho na thob pa dang lhan cig gdon mi za bar skye'i /
analyzed: thob pa'am zhes bya ba la / sems can du ston @135a * // pa kho na thob pa dang lhan cig gdon mi za bar skye'i /
translated: it is said that whatever arises is also obtained.üîΩObtaining is not necessarily simultaneous with the arising of sentient beings.

original: sems can du ston pa ma yin pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sems can du ston pa ma yin pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Obtaining is not necessarily simultaneous with the arising of non-sentient beings.

original: sems can du mi 'grang ba la thob pa med do zhes bya ba 'di la rgyu ci yod ce na /
analyzed: sems can du mi 'grang ba la thob pa med do zhes bya ba 'di la rgyu ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the reason that sentient beings do not have obtaining?

original: sems can thams cad kyi thun mong ba yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi thun mong ba yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: Because it is common to all sentient beings,

original: thob pa ni thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: thob pa ni thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: but obtaining is not common.

original: / de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: / de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For this very reason,

original: bye brag tu bya ba'i phyir ram zhes bya ba'i sgra smos so zhes bshad de /üîΩcung zad cig thob pa dang lhan cig skye la /
analyzed: bye brag tu bya ba'i phyir ram zhes bya ba'i sgra smos so zhes bshad de / cung zad cig thob pa dang lhan cig skye la /
translated: the word ‚Äúor‚Äù is stated in order to make a distinction.üîΩSome obtainment arises simultaneously with the arising of sentient beings,

original: cung zad cig mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cung zad cig mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: but some does not arise.

original: bshad ma thag pa'i 'dus byas rnam pa bzhi las gzugs ni gzugs kyi phung po bstan par rnam par phye zin to //
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'i 'dus byas rnam pa bzhi las gzugs ni gzugs kyi phung po bstan par rnam par phye zin to //
translated: Form has already been distinguished in the exposition of the form heap.

original: sems ni khams bstan par rnam par phye'o //
analyzed: sems ni khams bstan par rnam par phye'o //
translated: Mind has already been distinguished in the exposition of the elements.

original: sems las byung ba rnams dang ldan pa ma yin pa rnams ni rnam par dbye ba ma byas te /
analyzed: sems las byung ba rnams dang ldan pa ma yin pa rnams ni rnam par dbye ba ma byas te /
translated: The mental factors and the dissociated forces have not yet been distinguished.

original: de'i phyir sems las byung ba'i rnam par dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir sems las byung ba'i rnam par dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to demonstrate the distinctions among the mental factors, he says:

original: sems byung rnam lnga ste zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: sems byung rnam lnga ste zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The mental factors are fivefold.

original: de dag kyang gang dag cig ce na /üîΩde'i phyir / sa mang la sogs tha dad phyir //
analyzed: de dag kyang gang dag cig ce na / de'i phyir / sa mang la sogs tha dad phyir //
translated: What are they?üîΩTherefore, he says:

original: zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Because of the differences of the universal mental factors, etc.

original: gang dag sems thams cad la 'byung ba de dag ni sa mang po pa'o //
analyzed: gang dag sems thams cad la 'byung ba de dag ni sa mang po pa'o //
translated: Those that occur in all minds are the universals.

original: gang dag dge ba kho na la 'byung ba de dag ni dge ba'i sa mang po pa rnams so //
analyzed: gang dag dge ba kho na la 'byung ba de dag ni dge ba'i sa mang po pa rnams so //
translated: Those that occur only in virtuous minds are the virtuous mental factors.

original: gang dag nyon mongs pa can kho na la 'byung ba de dag ni nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa'o //
analyzed: gang dag nyon mongs pa can kho na la 'byung ba de dag ni nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa'o //
translated: Those that occur only in afflicted minds are the afflicted mental factors.

original: gang dag mi dge ba kho na la byung ba de dag ni mi dge ba'i sa mang po pa rnams so //
analyzed: gang dag mi dge ba kho na la byung ba de dag ni mi dge ba'i sa mang po pa rnams so //
translated: Those that occur only in the unwholesome are called the great unwholesome grounds.

original: gang dag nyon mongs pa chung ngu dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems las byung ba de dag ni nyon mongs pa chung du pa'i sa pa rnams so //
analyzed: gang dag nyon mongs pa chung ngu dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems las byung ba de dag ni nyon mongs pa chung du pa'i sa pa rnams so //
translated: Those that occur in the mind associated with the small afflictions are called the small affliction grounds.

original: sa zhes bya ba ni go skabs kyi yul te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sa zhes bya ba ni go skabs kyi yul te zhes bya ba la /
translated: The term ‚Äúground‚Äù means a domain of opportunity.

original: go skabs zhes bya ba ni go 'am skye ba'o //
analyzed: go skabs zhes bya ba ni go 'am skye ba'o //
translated: Opportunity means a domain of birth.

original: gang zhig gang gis go skabs kyi yul yin pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang zhig gang gis go skabs kyi yul yin pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: What is the domain of opportunity for what?

original: gang du gang gis go mi rdug pa de ni de'i go skabs kyi yul te /
analyzed: gang du gang gis go mi rdug pa de ni de'i go skabs kyi yul te /
translated: That in which something does not obstruct the arising of something else is its domain of opportunity.

original: de nyid la 'jig rten nas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid la 'jig rten nas zhes bya'o //
translated: That is also called the world.üîΩThose that have many grounds are called the great grounds.üîΩThey are called great because they occur in all minds.

original: de la 'di dag la sa mang po yod pas na sa mang po pa rnams te /
analyzed: de la 'di dag la sa mang po yod pas na sa mang po pa rnams te /
