original: gang dag rnam pa thams cad du sems thams cad dang lhan cig skye 'am /
analyzed: gang dag rnam pa thams cad du sems thams cad dang lhan cig skye 'am /
translated: They are called great grounds because they occur in all minds.

original: khams gsum pa dang / dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa 'am /
analyzed: khams gsum pa dang / dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa 'am /
translated: They are called great

original: zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dang lhan cig skye'o //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dang lhan cig skye'o //
translated: It arises simultaneously with that which is associated with the contaminants and that which is not associated with the contaminants.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For this very reason,

original: sems ni sa chen po pa yin te /
analyzed: sems ni sa chen po pa yin te /
translated: the mind is a great stage,

original: sems gzhan dang lhan cig mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems gzhan dang lhan cig mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not occur simultaneously with another mind.

original: go skabs kyi yul ni go skabs kyi yul lo//
analyzed: go skabs kyi yul ni go skabs kyi yul lo//
translated: The domain of opportunity is the domain of opportunity.

original: @135b chos bcu po 'di dag ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: @135b chos bcu po 'di dag ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: These ten dharmas are...

original: grag go zhes bya ba'i sgra ni yid la byed pa dang / btang snyoms mi rtsol ba gnyis sems kyi skad cig gcig la 'gal bas mi 'dod par bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grag go zhes bya ba'i sgra ni yid la byed pa dang / btang snyoms mi rtsol ba gnyis sems kyi skad cig gcig la 'gal bas mi 'dod par bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúit is said‚Äù is used because it is taught that the two, attention and equanimity, are mutually exclusive in a single moment of mind.

original: tshor ba myong ba zhes sngar tshor ba'i rang gi ngo bor bshad pas da ltar rab tu dbye ba tsam zhig ston pa ni /
analyzed: tshor ba myong ba zhes sngar tshor ba'i rang gi ngo bor bshad pas da ltar rab tu dbye ba tsam zhig ston pa ni /
translated: Since the nature of feeling has already been explained as experience, now it is taught merely as a classification:

original: myong ba rnam pa gsum ste zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: myong ba rnam pa gsum ste zhes bya ba'o //
translated: There are three kinds of experience.

original: dbang po rnam par gzhag par lus kyi dang / sems kyi dbye ba rnam pa lngar bshad pa gang yang yin pa de ni myong ba rnam pa gsum las ma 'das so zhes bstan pa'i phyir yang myong ba rnam pa gsum ste zhes bshad do //üîΩde la / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i nyams su myong ba ni go rims bzhin du lus la phan 'dogs pa dang / gnod pa dang / snyoms par byed pa 'dod pa dang /
analyzed: dbang po rnam par gzhag par lus kyi dang / sems kyi dbye ba rnam pa lngar bshad pa gang yang yin pa de ni myong ba rnam pa gsum las ma 'das so zhes bstan pa'i phyir yang myong ba rnam pa gsum ste zhes bshad do // de la / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i nyams su myong ba ni go rims bzhin du lus la phan 'dogs pa dang / gnod pa dang / snyoms par byed pa 'dod pa dang /
translated: The three kinds of feeling are explained in order to show that feeling does not go beyond the three kinds.

original: mi 'dod pa dang / gnyis ka las bzlog pa'i reg pas bskyed pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mi 'dod pa dang / gnyis ka las bzlog pa'i reg pas bskyed pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Pleasant feeling, unpleasant feeling, and neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling are respectively produced by contact that benefits the body, harms the body, or is indifferent to the body, which are desired, not desired, and the opposite of both.

original: sems pa ni sems mngon par 'du byed pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems pa ni sems mngon par 'du byed pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Mental attention is the mental factor that directs the mind to an object.

original: sems pa ni yid g-yo ba dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa dman pa dang / bar ma dang / gya nom pa sems g-yo ba dang / rab tu g-yo ba ste /
analyzed: sems pa ni yid g-yo ba dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa dman pa dang / bar ma dang / gya nom pa sems g-yo ba dang / rab tu g-yo ba ste /
translated: Mind is the movement of the mind, virtuous, nonvirtuous, and indeterminate, inferior, middling, and superior, the movement of the mind, and the movement of the mind.

original: gang zhig yod na khab long gi dbang gis lcags g-yo ba ltar sems dmigs pa la g-yo bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: gang zhig yod na khab long gi dbang gis lcags g-yo ba ltar sems dmigs pa la g-yo bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: When it exists, the mind moves to the object, like iron moved by the power of a magnet.

original: skad cig gzhan du mi gnas shing //
analyzed: skad cig gzhan du mi gnas shing //
translated: It does not remain for a second moment.

original: byed med yid kyang gang gis na //
analyzed: byed med yid kyang gang gis na //
translated: What is the mind that is without action?

original: byed dang bcas par snang byed pa //
analyzed: byed dang bcas par snang byed pa //
translated: It is the mind that appears to have action.

original: sems pa de ni yid kyi las //üîΩzhes bshad do //
analyzed: sems pa de ni yid kyi las // zhes bshad do //
translated: That mind is mental action.

original: yul la mtshan mar 'dzin pa'o //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yul la mtshan mar 'dzin pa'o // zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is the apprehension of the sign of the object.

original: mtshan ma ni yul gyi bye brag ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma ni yul gyi bye brag ste /
translated: Sign means the particular of the object.

original: skyes pa dang / bud med la sogs pa'i dmigs pa'i rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skyes pa dang / bud med la sogs pa'i dmigs pa'i rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means the cause of the establishment of the object, such as a man, a woman, and so on.

original: 'dun pa ni byed 'dod pa'i zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa 'dzin par 'dod ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dun pa ni byed 'dod pa'i zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa 'dzin par 'dod ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Desire is the desire to act. It means the desire to apprehend the object.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba thams cad ni mngon par 'dod pa sngon du 'gro ba can te /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba thams cad ni mngon par 'dod pa sngon du 'gro ba can te /
translated: All minds and mental factors are preceded by aspiration.

original: de nyid kyi phyir chos thams cad ni 'dun pa'i rtsa ba can du brjod do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir chos thams cad ni 'dun pa'i rtsa ba can du brjod do //
translated: Therefore, it is said that all phenomena are rooted in aspiration.

original: gal te 'dun pa la mngon par dad pa'i bdag nyid can yin na 'dun pa dang sred pa gnyis la khyad par ci yod ce na /
analyzed: gal te 'dun pa la mngon par dad pa'i bdag nyid can yin na 'dun pa dang sred pa gnyis la khyad par ci yod ce na /
translated: If aspiration has the nature of faith, what is the difference between aspiration and craving?

original: sred pa ni mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid can yin la /
analyzed: sred pa ni mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid can yin la /
translated: Craving has the nature of attachment.

original: 'dun pa ni mngon par 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid can yin par khyad par yod do //üîΩreg pa @136a * //
analyzed: 'dun pa ni mngon par 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid can yin par khyad par yod do // reg pa @136a * //
translated: Aspiration has the nature of desire.üîΩContact

original: ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /üîΩdbang po dang / yul dang / rnam par shes pa rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa dag phan tshun reg pa dang 'dra ba /
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la / dbang po dang / yul dang / rnam par shes pa rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa dag phan tshun reg pa dang 'dra ba /
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúContact is the coming together of three.‚ÄùüîΩThe coming together of three factors‚Äîa sense faculty, an object, and a consciousness‚Äîthat are mutually causal is contact.

original: gnas skabs de dang ldan pa dag las sems las byung ba'i chos gzhan du gyur pa /
analyzed: gnas skabs de dang ldan pa dag las sems las byung ba'i chos gzhan du gyur pa /
translated: This is a mental factor that is distinct from the sense faculty, object, and consciousness.

original: tshor ba thams cad kyi rgyu reg pa zhes bya ba zhig skye ba de la reg pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: tshor ba thams cad kyi rgyu reg pa zhes bya ba zhig skye ba de la reg pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Contact is the cause of all feelings.

original: shes rab ste chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'o zhes bya ba la /üîΩrab tu rnam par 'byed par byed pas na rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab ste chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'o zhes bya ba la / rab tu rnam par 'byed par byed pas na rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ste /
translated: Wisdom is the discernment of phenomena.

original: gang gis rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid 'dres pa'i chos rnams la me tog dag dang 'dra bar rab tu rnam par 'byed par byed cing /
analyzed: gang gis rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid 'dres pa'i chos rnams la me tog dag dang 'dra bar rab tu rnam par 'byed par byed cing /
translated: Discernment is that by which one discerns, that is, distinguishes, phenomena that are mixed together by way of their general and specific characteristics, like flowers that are mixed together.

original: rnam par 'byed par byed pa'i blo ni 'di dag zag pa dang bcas pa rnams so //
analyzed: rnam par 'byed par byed pa'i blo ni 'di dag zag pa dang bcas pa rnams so //
translated: The understanding that discerns, that is, distinguishes, is the understanding that thinks:

original: 'di dag ni zag pa med pa rnams so //üîΩ'di dag ni gzugs can ma yin pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni zag pa med pa rnams so // 'di dag ni gzugs can ma yin pa rnams so //
translated: These are the contaminated ones.üîΩThese are the uncontaminated ones.üîΩThese are the formless ones.

original: 'di dag ni gzugs can rnams so snyam du rnam par 'byed pa'i rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni gzugs can rnams so snyam du rnam par 'byed pa'i rtogs pa'o //
translated: These are the form ones.üîΩRecollection is the non-forgetting of the object.

original: dran pa ni dmigs pa mi brjed pa'o zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa 'dzin pa la nyams pa med pa'i rgyu'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dran pa ni dmigs pa mi brjed pa'o zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa 'dzin pa la nyams pa med pa'i rgyu'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is the cause of the non-deterioration of the apprehension of the object.

original: yid la byed pa ni sems kyi 'jug pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yid la byed pa ni sems kyi 'jug pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Mental attention is the engagement of the mind.

original: dmigs pa la sems 'jug par byed pa'i las can mthun par sems pa sems las 'byung ba'i chos ni yid la byed pa ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa la sems 'jug par byed pa'i las can mthun par sems pa sems las 'byung ba'i chos ni yid la byed pa ste /
translated: Mental attention is a mental factor that has the function of engaging the mind in the object.

original: gang zhig la 'jig rten pa rnams sems gtod pa zhes smra ba'o ;
analyzed: gang zhig la 'jig rten pa rnams sems gtod pa zhes smra ba'o ;
translated: It is that by which worldly people say, ‚ÄúI will direct my mind to that.‚Äù

original: / yid la byed pas na yid la byed pa ste /
analyzed: / yid la byed pas na yid la byed pa ste /
translated: It is mental attention because it attends to the mind.

original: lcags byed pa bzhin no //
analyzed: lcags byed pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like a blacksmith‚Äôs bellows.

original: sems mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa dmigs pa la 'jug par byed do zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: sems mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa dmigs pa la 'jug par byed do zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa ste /
translated: It engages the mind and its concomitant states in the object.

original: de la ni lag pas ril ba bhring ga ra ltar 'jug cing /
analyzed: de la ni lag pas ril ba bhring ga ra ltar 'jug cing /
translated: It is like a hand that inserts a ring into a sling.

original: sems dmigs pa la 'dzud par byed do //
analyzed: sems dmigs pa la 'dzud par byed do //
translated: It inserts the mind into the object.

original: mos pa ni 'dod pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'di ni 'di ltar yin no snyam pa ste /
analyzed: mos pa ni 'dod pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'di ni 'di ltar yin no snyam pa ste /
translated: Interest is the desire for something.

original: dmigs pa la bying bying po med pa nyid do //
analyzed: dmigs pa la bying bying po med pa nyid do //
translated: It is the absence of mental sinking in regard to a thing‚Äôs attributes.

original: gzhan dag na re 'dod pa'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re 'dod pa'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that it is desire.

original: gzhan dag na re ni nges par ji lta ba bzhin du nges par 'dzin pa'o zhe'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re ni nges par ji lta ba bzhin du nges par 'dzin pa'o zhe'o //
translated: Others say: It is the definite apprehension of an object just as it is.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni sems rtse gcig pa nyid do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni sems rtse gcig pa nyid do zhes bya ba la /
translated: Concentration is the one-pointedness of the mind.

original: rtse ni dmigs pa dang yul zhes bya ba'i don to ;üîΩ/ gang yod na sems dang sems las byung ba rnams dmigs pa gcig par 'byung ba'i chos de ni ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rtse ni dmigs pa dang yul zhes bya ba'i don to ; / gang yod na sems dang sems las byung ba rnams dmigs pa gcig par 'byung ba'i chos de ni ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The point is the object or domain.üîΩThe dharma that is the cause of the nondistraction of the mind and mental factors apprehending the object is called concentration.

original: rnam par ma spros pa'i tshul gyis yul 'dzin pa la mi g-yengs pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩslob dpon dpal len na re sa mang po pa rnams ni med kyi /üîΩgal te brtag @136b na ni gsum kho na zhig ste /
analyzed: rnam par ma spros pa'i tshul gyis yul 'dzin pa la mi g-yengs pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // slob dpon dpal len na re sa mang po pa rnams ni med kyi / gal te brtag @136b na ni gsum kho na zhig ste /
translated: It is the cause of nondispersal.

original: mdo las tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa dag ni lhan cig skye'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: mdo las tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa dag ni lhan cig skye'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Master Haribhadra says: The Abhidharmasamuccaya does not mention these three, but if they are to be analyzed, there are only three because a sutra states, ‚ÄúSensation, ideation, and intention are coemergent.‚Äù

original: de ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: That is not so.

original: mdo gzhan las sems las byung ba'i chos gzhan yang bstan te /
analyzed: mdo gzhan las sems las byung ba'i chos gzhan yang bstan te /
translated: Other s≈´tras teach other mental factors.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ches thams cad ni 'dun pa'i rtsa ba can yid la byed pa las byung ba /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ches thams cad ni 'dun pa'i rtsa ba can yid la byed pa las byung ba /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn said, All phenomena have desire as their root, they arise from attention,

original: reg pa'i kun 'byung ba can chor ba la brten pa /
analyzed: reg pa'i kun 'byung ba can chor ba la brten pa /
translated: they are originated by contact, they are based on feeling,

original: dran pa'i bdag po can ting nge 'dzin gtso bor gyur pa /
analyzed: dran pa'i bdag po can ting nge 'dzin gtso bor gyur pa /
translated: they have mindfulness as their lord, they are governed by concentration,

original: shes rab mchog tu gyur pa /
analyzed: shes rab mchog tu gyur pa /
translated: they are supreme through wisdom,üîΩthey have the essence of liberation and they culminate in nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: rnam par grol ba'i snying po can mya ngan las 'das pa'i mthar thug pa'o zhes gsungs pa ji ltar sa mang po pa dag gsum kho nar gsungs /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i snying po can mya ngan las 'das pa'i mthar thug pa'o zhes gsungs pa ji ltar sa mang po pa dag gsum kho nar gsungs /
translated: Why are they said to be only three universal mental states?

original: de ltar na gal te ji ltar sems kyi rgyun gcig la mtshan nyid tha dad pa bcu yod pa nyid du rtogs par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na gal te ji ltar sems kyi rgyun gcig la mtshan nyid tha dad pa bcu yod pa nyid du rtogs par bya zhe na /
translated: If it is asked how should one understand that there are ten different characteristics in a single continuum of mind?

original: de'i phyir / sems las byung ba rnams kyi bye brag ni phra bas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / sems las byung ba rnams kyi bye brag ni phra bas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it says, The distinctions of mental factors are subtle.

original: brtson 'grus med pa dang / shes rab med pa dang / dad pa med pa dag gis rtogs par mi nus so //
analyzed: brtson 'grus med pa dang / shes rab med pa dang / dad pa med pa dag gis rtogs par mi nus so //
translated: It cannot be realized by those who lack diligence, wisdom, and faith.

original: 'di ltar phra ba zhig gi ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar phra ba zhig gi ste /
translated: It is subtle in this way.

original: gang zhig rgyun rnams la yang yongs su gcad par dka' na skad cig ma dag la lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: gang zhig rgyun rnams la yang yongs su gcad par dka' na skad cig ma dag la lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: If it is difficult to discern in a continuum, what need is there to speak of discerning it in moments?

original: dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / shes rab can dag gis kha cig ni rang gi ngo bo'i sgo nas yongs su gcad par bya bar nus la /
analyzed: dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / shes rab can dag gis kha cig ni rang gi ngo bo'i sgo nas yongs su gcad par bya bar nus la /
translated: Some can be discerned by means of their intrinsic nature by those who have faith, diligence, and wisdom.

original: kha cig ni bya ba'i sgo nas yongs su gcad par bya bar nus pas yongs su gcad par dka' na zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: kha cig ni bya ba'i sgo nas yongs su gcad par bya bar nus pas yongs su gcad par dka' na zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Some can be discerned by means of their function. Therefore, it is difficult to discern.

original: sems pa dang yid la byed pa dag ni shin tu mtshan nyid tha dad do snyam du mthong bas /üîΩre zhig sman la sogs pa gzugs can rnams la yang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sems pa dang yid la byed pa dag ni shin tu mtshan nyid tha dad do snyam du mthong bas / re zhig sman la sogs pa gzugs can rnams la yang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is seen that intention and attention have very different characteristics.üîΩTherefore he says, ‚ÄúEven in regard to physical things, such as medicine, etc.‚Äù

original: aa ru ra la sogs pa sman lus can rnams la yang ste /
analyzed: aa ru ra la sogs pa sman lus can rnams la yang ste /
translated: Even in regard to physical things, such as medicine, etc.,üîΩsuch as myrobalan, etc.,

original: aa ru ra la ni lan tshva'i ro ma gtogs pa lhag ma ro lnga dag yod pa yin no //üîΩdbang po gzung bar bya ba rnams //
analyzed: aa ru ra la ni lan tshva'i ro ma gtogs pa lhag ma ro lnga dag yod pa yin no // dbang po gzung bar bya ba rnams //
translated: The myrobalan fruit has five tastes except for the taste of salt.üîΩThose that are grasped by the sense faculties

original: zhes bya ba ni lce'i dbang pos gzung bar bya ba rnams te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lce'i dbang pos gzung bar bya ba rnams te /
translated: are grasped by the tongue sense faculty.

original: nges par gzung bar dka' bas yongs su gcad par dka' na /üîΩchos gang dag lus can ma yin zhing blos bzung ba ste /
analyzed: nges par gzung bar dka' bas yongs su gcad par dka' na / chos gang dag lus can ma yin zhing blos bzung ba ste /
translated: Since they are difficult to grasp, they are difficult to determine.üîΩWhat need is there to mention those phenomena that are not embodied and are grasped by the mind,

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa tsam gyis gzung bar bya ba rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa tsam gyis gzung bar bya ba rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos //
translated: that are grasped by the mental consciousness alone?

original: de'i phyir / de rnams ni yid ches pas bstan pa'i phyir de kho na ltar rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir / de rnams ni yid ches pas bstan pa'i phyir de kho na ltar rtogs par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, they should be understood just as they are taught, because they are taught with certainty.

original: don gyi rnam pa du ma cig car rtogs pa'i phyir dang / gcig la cig car de dag dang ldan pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gyi rnam pa du ma cig car rtogs pa'i phyir dang / gcig la cig car de dag dang ldan pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because many aspects of an object are simultaneously understood, and because it is not tenable that they are simultaneously possessed in one.

original: chos gzhan rjes su zhugs @137a * //
analyzed: chos gzhan rjes su zhugs @137a * //
translated: When other phenomena are engaged,

original: na rgyun rnams la rnam par 'gyur ba mthong ste /
analyzed: na rgyun rnams la rnam par 'gyur ba mthong ste /
translated: a transformation is seen in the continuum.

original: 'bru mar bsnan pa dang / dri ma dang / chu dang / rlung zhugs na mar me'i rgyun la cig car yongs su gsal ba dang / mi gsal ba dang / sgra dang / g-yo ba la sogs pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bru mar bsnan pa dang / dri ma dang / chu dang / rlung zhugs na mar me'i rgyun la cig car yongs su gsal ba dang / mi gsal ba dang / sgra dang / g-yo ba la sogs pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because when oil, dirt, water, and wind enter the flame, the flame is seen to be sometimes clear, sometimes unclear, sometimes noisy, sometimes moving, and so on.

original: de'i phyir sa mang po pa rnams yod do zhes ji ltar nye bar bkod pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir sa mang po pa rnams yod do zhes ji ltar nye bar bkod pa kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore, the universal mental factors do exist, as they have been posited.

original: dad pa ni sems dang ba'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dad pa ni sems dang ba'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Faith is clarity of mind.

original: dad pa ni sems kyi rnyog pa dang 'gal ba ste /
analyzed: dad pa ni sems kyi rnyog pa dang 'gal ba ste /
translated: Faith is the opposite of mental turbidity.

original: de dang mtshungs bar ldan na nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i dri ma'i rnyog pa dang bral bar 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de dang mtshungs bar ldan na nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i dri ma'i rnyog pa dang bral bar 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: When it is associated with it, the mind is free from the turbidity of the stains of the root and secondary afflictions.

original: dad pa la brten na sems dang bar 'gyur bas sems dang ba'o zhes brjod do //
analyzed: dad pa la brten na sems dang bar 'gyur bas sems dang ba'o zhes brjod do //
translated: When one relies on faith, the mind becomes clear, and thus it is said that faith is clarity of mind.

original: dad pa ni sems las byung ba'i chos gzhan nor bu chu 'dang dang 'dra ba zhig go //
analyzed: dad pa ni sems las byung ba'i chos gzhan nor bu chu 'dang dang 'dra ba zhig go //
translated: Faith is a mental factor that is like a wish-fulfilling gem.

original: gzugs dang ba yang yod pas de'i phyir sems dang ba zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: gzugs dang ba yang yod pas de'i phyir sems dang ba zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: and there is also clarity of form. Therefore, the root text states, ‚Äúclarity of mind.‚Äù

original: gzhan dag na re bden ba dang dkon mchog ces bya ba la sogs pa la /üîΩbden pa dang / dkon mchog rnams dang ; las rnams dang / 'bras bu rnams la mngon par yid ches pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re bden ba dang dkon mchog ces bya ba la sogs pa la / bden pa dang / dkon mchog rnams dang ; las rnams dang / 'bras bu rnams la mngon par yid ches pa ste /
translated: According to another opinion, faith is a clarity of mind that is preceded by the conviction that there are four noble truths, three jewels, etc.üîΩIt is a clarity of mind that is preceded by the conviction that there are four noble truths, three jewels, actions, and results.üîΩIt is a clarity of mind that is preceded by the conviction that there are four noble truths, three jewels, actions, and results.üîΩIt is a clarity of mind that is preceded by the conviction that there are four noble truths, three jewels, actions, and results.

original: yid ches shing legs pa 'dod pa dang / mos pa gsos  'debs pa ni dad pa'o //
analyzed: yid ches shing legs pa 'dod pa dang / mos pa gsos  'debs pa ni dad pa'o //
translated: It is a clarity of mind that is preceded by the conviction that there are four noble truths, three jewels, actions, and results.

original: bag yod pa ni dge ba'i chos rnams bsgom pa'o zhes 'byung ste /üîΩgang yod na zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: bag yod pa ni dge ba'i chos rnams bsgom pa'o zhes 'byung ste / gang yod na zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: It is a clarity of mind that is preceded by the conviction that there are four noble truths, three jewels, actions, and results.üîΩIt is a clarity of mind that is preceded by the conviction that there are four noble truths, three jewels, actions, and results.

original: dge ba'i chos rnams bsgom pa ni rnyed pa dang ; brten pa la mngon par 'dod de /üîΩde ni bag yod pa las 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos rnams bsgom pa ni rnyed pa dang ; brten pa la mngon par 'dod de / de ni bag yod pa las 'gyur ro //
translated: It is a clarity of mind that is preceded by the conviction that there are four noble truths, three jewels, actions, and results.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /üîΩde dag las gzhan pa zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir / de dag las gzhan pa zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: It is a clarity of mind that is preceded by the conviction that there are four noble truths, three jewels, actions, and results.üîΩIt is a clarity of mind that is preceded by the conviction that there are four noble truths, three jewels, actions, and results.üîΩIt is a clarity of mind that is preceded by the conviction that there are four noble truths, three jewels, actions, and results.üîΩIt is a clarity of mind that is preceded by the conviction that there are four noble truths, three jewels, actions, and results.üîΩIt is a clarity of mind that is preceded by the conviction that there are four noble truths, three jewels, actions, and results.üîΩIt is a clarity of mind that is preceded by the conviction that there are four noble truths, three jewels, actions, and results.üîΩIt is a clarity of mind that is preceded by the conviction that there are four noble truths, three jewels, actions, and results.

original: dge ba'i chos dag las gzhan pa bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos dag las gzhan pa bsgom pa ste /
translated: It is a clarity of mind that is preceded by the conviction that there are four noble truths, three jewels, actions, and results.üîΩIt is a clarity of mind that is preceded by the conviction that there are four noble truths, three jewels, actions, and results.

original: yod pa ma yin pa kho na'o snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa kho na'o snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: It is a clarity of mind that is preceded by the conviction

original: de dag nyid la gces su 'dzin pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba la ;
analyzed: de dag nyid la gces su 'dzin pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba la ;
translated: It is the cherishing of those very things.

original: gces su 'dzin pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig lhur len pa'o //
analyzed: gces su 'dzin pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig lhur len pa'o //
translated: What is meant by cherishing?üîΩIt is the intense desire for something.üîΩWhat is intense desire?

original: lhur len pa 'di ci zhig / gang yod na dge ba'i phyogs su lhur byed par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: lhur len pa 'di ci zhig / gang yod na dge ba'i phyogs su lhur byed par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is that by which one is devoted to the side of virtue.

original: sems kun du srung ba'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems kun du srung ba'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is the protection of the mind.

original: bdag la phan pa gces su 'dzin pa'i lus dang / ngag dang / yid kun nas srung ba lhur len pa bag med pa dang 'gal ba'i chos ni bag yod pa'o //
analyzed: bdag la phan pa gces su 'dzin pa'i lus dang / ngag dang / yid kun nas srung ba lhur len pa bag med pa dang 'gal ba'i chos ni bag yod pa'o //
translated: It is the intense desire to protect the body, speech, and mind of one who cherishes his own welfare.

original: shin tu sbyangs pa ni sems las su rung ba nyid do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa ni sems las su rung ba nyid do zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is mental suppleness.

original: las su rung ba nyid kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: las su rung ba nyid kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What is mental suppleness?

original: yang dag par yid la byed pa la zhugs pa'i sems sim pa dang / yang pa'i rgyu sems las byung ba'i chos gzhan gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag par yid la byed pa la zhugs pa'i sems sim pa dang / yang pa'i rgyu sems las byung ba'i chos gzhan gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is a mental factor that is the cause of the mind's lightness and agility.

original: de dang ldan @137b pas sems dmigs pa la ma chags par 'jug pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: de dang ldan @137b pas sems dmigs pa la ma chags par 'jug pa de'i phyir /
translated: It is that by which the mind enters its object without resistance.

original: sems las su rung ba nyid do zhes brjod de /
analyzed: sems las su rung ba nyid do zhes brjod de /
translated: It is the serviceability of mind.

original: bsreg pa dang / chus gtor ba dang / brdungs pas sbyang ba byas pa'i gser bzhin no //
analyzed: bsreg pa dang / chus gtor ba dang / brdungs pas sbyang ba byas pa'i gser bzhin no //
translated: It is like gold that has been refined, melted, and worked.üîΩA sutra states:

original: mdo las / gang zhig shin tu sbyangs pa byang chub kyi yan lag tu gyur pa'i rnam grangs gang zhe na /
analyzed: mdo las / gang zhig shin tu sbyangs pa byang chub kyi yan lag tu gyur pa'i rnam grangs gang zhe na /
translated: What is the classification of pliancy as a member of enlightenment?

original: lus shin tu sbyangs pa yang yod do //
analyzed: lus shin tu sbyangs pa yang yod do //
translated: There is pliancy of body and

original: sems shin tu sbyangs pa yang yod do //üîΩgang yang lus shin tu sbyangs pa /
analyzed: sems shin tu sbyangs pa yang yod do // gang yang lus shin tu sbyangs pa /
translated: there is pliancy of mind.

original: shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag de yang mngon par shes pa dang / rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / mya ngan las 'da' bar byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag de yang mngon par shes pa dang / rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / mya ngan las 'da' bar byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Pliancy of body is the lightness and fitness of the body that is the opposite of the heaviness and unfitness that prevents the body from performing its function.

original: gang yang sems shin tu sbyangs pa /
analyzed: gang yang sems shin tu sbyangs pa /
translated: Pliancy of mind is the lightness and fitness of the mind that is the opposite of the heaviness and unfitness that prevents the mind from performing its function.

original: shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag de yang mngon par shes pa dang / rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / mya ngan las 'da' bar byed par 'gyur ro zhes lus shin tu sbyangs pa yang gsungs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag de yang mngon par shes pa dang / rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / mya ngan las 'da' bar byed par 'gyur ro zhes lus shin tu sbyangs pa yang gsungs pa ma yin nam /
translated: And isn't pliancy also called physical pliancy?

original: 'dir sems las su rung ba kho na shin tu sbyangs par bshad pas shin tu sbyangs pa'i mtshan nyid ma khyab pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir sems las su rung ba kho na shin tu sbyangs par bshad pas shin tu sbyangs pa'i mtshan nyid ma khyab pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But here pliancy is explained as mental flexibility, so isn't the definition of pliancy too broad?

original: mdo las ma gsungs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mdo las ma gsungs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that the sutras do not mention this.üîΩIt is like physical feeling

original: de ni lus kyi tshor ba ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ni lus kyi tshor ba ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba la /
translated: .üîΩJust as physical feeling is also mental, so too mental pliancy is called physical pliancy because it arises in dependence on the physical faculty.

original: sems kyi yin yang dbang po gzugs can la brten nas skyes pa'i phyir mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa la /
analyzed: sems kyi yin yang dbang po gzugs can la brten nas skyes pa'i phyir mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa la /
translated: It is like the eye consciousness and so on that are concomitant with physical feeling.

original: lus kyi zhes bshad pa de bzhin du lus shin tu sbyangs pa yang rig par bya ste /
analyzed: lus kyi zhes bshad pa de bzhin du lus shin tu sbyangs pa yang rig par bya ste /
translated: Pliancy of the body should be understood in the same way.

original: sems kyi yin yang dbang po gzugs can la brten nas skye ba'i phyir /üîΩrnam par shes pa lnga dang mtshungs par ldan pa la lus kyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sems kyi yin yang dbang po gzugs can la brten nas skye ba'i phyir / rnam par shes pa lnga dang mtshungs par ldan pa la lus kyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Although it is mental, it is called bodily because it arises in dependence on the physical sense faculty.üîΩIt is concomitant with the five consciousnesses.

original: de yang mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dge ba rnams las su rung ba nyid de /
analyzed: de yang mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dge ba rnams las su rung ba nyid de /
translated: It is pliancy of the body and mind that is concomitant with the five sense consciousnesses, because it is the pliancy of virtuous eye consciousness and so on.

original: shin tu sbyangs pa ni sa mang po pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa ni sa mang po pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Pliancy is a universal mental state.

original: de na lus dang sems shin tu sbyangs pa gnyis la ngo bo'i khyad par 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pas mtshan nyid khyab pa yin gyi ma khyab pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de na lus dang sems shin tu sbyangs pa gnyis la ngo bo'i khyad par 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pas mtshan nyid khyab pa yin gyi ma khyab pa ma yin no //
translated: Since there is no difference in the nature of both physical and mental pliancy, its definition is pervasive and not nonpervasive.

original: de ji ltar na byang chub kyi yan lag tu zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: de ji ltar na byang chub kyi yan lag tu zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: How can it be a branch of enlightenment?

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams mnyam par ma bzhag pa yin pa'i phyir dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams zag pa med pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams mnyam par ma bzhag pa yin pa'i phyir dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams zag pa med pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the five sense consciousnesses are not equipoise and the branches of enlightenment are uncontaminated.

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shin tu sbyangs pa ni byang chub kyi yan lag dag tu rung ba ma yin no zhe na /üîΩ'o na mdo der ni lus las su rung ba 'byung ba'i khyad par dga' bas drangs pa kho na @138a * //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shin tu sbyangs pa ni byang chub kyi yan lag dag tu rung ba ma yin no zhe na / 'o na mdo der ni lus las su rung ba 'byung ba'i khyad par dga' bas drangs pa kho na @138a * //
translated: But pliancy concomitant with eye consciousness and so on is not suitable as a branch of enlightenment.

original: lus shin tu sbyangs pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: lus shin tu sbyangs pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: If that is so, then in that sutra, physical pliancy is recognized as the special arising of flexibility induced by joy.üîΩFor a sutra states:

original: mdo las yid dga' bar gyur pa'i lus shin tu sbyangs par 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo las yid dga' bar gyur pa'i lus shin tu sbyangs par 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: When the mind is joyful, the body becomes pliant.

original: kha cig na re ni lus mnyan pa nyid du zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re ni lus mnyan pa nyid du zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say: The body becomes pliant.

original: de ji ltar na byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya zhe na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ji ltar na byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya zhe na zhes bya ba la /
translated: How can that be called a branch of enlightenment?

original: byang chub kyi yan lag rnams ni yid kyis pa dang / zag pa med pa dag yin la /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag rnams ni yid kyis pa dang / zag pa med pa dag yin la /
translated: The branches of enlightenment are mental and uncontaminated.

original: lus shin tu sbyangs pa ni sems las byung ba'i bdag nyid ma yin zhing /
analyzed: lus shin tu sbyangs pa ni sems las byung ba'i bdag nyid ma yin zhing /
translated: Physical pliancy is not a mental factor.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa yin pas de yang byang chub kyi yan lag dag tu mi rung ngo zhe na /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa yin pas de yang byang chub kyi yan lag dag tu mi rung ngo zhe na /
translated: Since it is contaminated, it is not suitable as a branch of enlightenment.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re /
translated: Vaibhasikas say:

original: byang chub kyi yan lag dang mthun pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag dang mthun pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is compatible with the branches of enlightenment.

original: lus shin tu sbyangs pa de yang sems shin tu sbyangs pa byang chub kyi yan lag gi bdag nyid can dang rjes su mthun pas de la yang byang chub kyi yan lag ces brjod do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: lus shin tu sbyangs pa de yang sems shin tu sbyangs pa byang chub kyi yan lag gi bdag nyid can dang rjes su mthun pas de la yang byang chub kyi yan lag ces brjod do zhes zer ro //
translated: Since physical pliancy is compatible with mental pliancy, which is a branch of enlightenment, it is called a branch of enlightenment.

original: ji ltar mthun zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar mthun zhe na /
translated: How is it compatible?

original: lus las su rung ba de nyid ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //üîΩde lta bu zhes bya ba ni de'i rang bzhin ma yin yang mthun pa'i phyir de dang 'dra bar nye bar 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: lus las su rung ba de nyid ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo // de lta bu zhes bya ba ni de'i rang bzhin ma yin yang mthun pa'i phyir de dang 'dra bar nye bar 'dogs pa'o //
translated: That very pliancy of the body is calledüîΩThat is, though it is not by nature a branch of enlightenment, it is similar to it because it is compatible with it.

original: de'i rang bzhin ma yin yang dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ma yin yang dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir /
translated: Though it is not by nature joy, it is compatible with the branch of enlightenment that is joy.

original: dga' ba'i gnas lta bu'i chos rnams dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag tu gsungs shing /
analyzed: dga' ba'i gnas lta bu'i chos rnams dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag tu gsungs shing /
translated: The Abhidharmakosa states, Joy is the branch of enlightenment of correct joy in regard to phenomena that are the basis of joy.

original: khong khro ba'i rgyu mtshan mnar sems kyi gzhi dgu gnod sems dang mthun pa'i phyir gnod sems kyi sgrib par gsungs la /
analyzed: khong khro ba'i rgyu mtshan mnar sems kyi gzhi dgu gnod sems dang mthun pa'i phyir gnod sems kyi sgrib par gsungs la /
translated: And it states that the nine bases of resentment are obscurations to nonaversion since they are the causes of aversion and are concordant with aversion.

original: gang gi tshe lam phung po gsum du mdzad pa de'i tshe rtog pa dang rtsol ba shes rab kyi phung por gsungs na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe lam phung po gsum du mdzad pa de'i tshe rtog pa dang rtsol ba shes rab kyi phung por gsungs na /
translated: When the path is divided into three aggregates, investigation and analysis are stated to be the aggregate of wisdom.

original: rtog pa dang rtsol ba gnyis ni shes rab rang bzhin ma yin te /
analyzed: rtog pa dang rtsol ba gnyis ni shes rab rang bzhin ma yin te /
translated: But investigation and analysis are not by nature wisdom.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: rtog pa dang brtson 'grus kyi rang bzhin yin no //üîΩbtang snyoms ni sems mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba ni bying rgod kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: rtog pa dang brtson 'grus kyi rang bzhin yin no // btang snyoms ni sems mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba ni bying rgod kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
translated: They are by nature both investigation and effort.üîΩEquanimity is the sameness of mind.üîΩIt is the antidote to mental dissatisfaction.üîΩIt is the proper engagement of the mind.

original: sems tshul bzhin du rgyu ba las ma 'das pa zhes bya ba'i don te /üîΩsems lhun gyis grub pa nyid do zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems tshul bzhin du rgyu ba las ma 'das pa zhes bya ba'i don te /üîΩsems lhun gyis grub pa nyid do zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the spontaneous state of mind.

original: gzhan dag na re ni yid la byed pa'i gegs yin no zhes zer ro ;
analyzed: gzhan dag na re ni yid la byed pa'i gegs yin no zhes zer ro ;
translated: Others say: It is the obstruction to attention.

original: /'di ni 'du byed btang snyoms yin par rig par bya'i /
analyzed: /'di ni 'du byed btang snyoms yin par rig par bya'i /
translated: This should be known as equanimity that is a formation.

original: tshor ba ni myong ba rnam pa gsum mo zhes bya ba de nyid las de smos pa'i phyir tshor ba btang snyoms ma yin la /
analyzed: tshor ba ni myong ba rnam pa gsum mo zhes bya ba de nyid las de smos pa'i phyir tshor ba btang snyoms ma yin la /
translated: It is not equanimity that is feeling, because feeling is said to be the three types of experience in the Abhidharma.

original: dge ba'i sems thams cad la 'byung ba'i phyir tshad med pa btang snyoms kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i sems thams cad la 'byung ba'i phyir tshad med pa btang snyoms kyang ma yin no //
translated: It is also not equanimity that is a measureless state because it occurs in all virtuous minds.

original: gang gi phyir gsung rab las ni tshor @138b ba btang snyoms dang / 'du byed btang snyoms dang / tshad med pa btang snyoms zhes bya ba btang snyoms pa rnam pa gsum gsungs mod kyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gsung rab las ni tshor @138b ba btang snyoms dang / 'du byed btang snyoms dang / tshad med pa btang snyoms zhes bya ba btang snyoms pa rnam pa gsum gsungs mod kyi /
translated: Although three types of equanimity are mentioned in the scriptures: equanimity that is feeling, equanimity that is a formation and equanimity that is a measureless state,

original: 'dir ni dge ba'i sa mang po pa'i skabs yin pas tshor ba dang / tshad med pa btang snyoms dag mi gzung ngo //
analyzed: 'dir ni dge ba'i sa mang po pa'i skabs yin pas tshor ba dang / tshad med pa btang snyoms dag mi gzung ngo //
translated: here equanimity that is feeling and equanimity that is a measureless state are not taken because this is the section on the great grounds of virtue.

original: da ni ji ltar na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste ;
analyzed: da ni ji ltar na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste ;
translated: Now, how is it that equanimity is a great ground of virtue?

original: 'di ni sa mang po pa yin pa'i phyir dang / dge ba'i sa mang po pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ni sa mang po pa yin pa'i phyir dang / dge ba'i sa mang po pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because these are universal mental states and because they are virtuous mental states.

original: yid la byed pa dang btang snyoms dag sems gcig la 'byung na de ni 'thad pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: yid la byed pa dang btang snyoms dag sems gcig la 'byung na de ni 'thad pa yang ma yin te /
translated: If attention and equanimity occur in a single mind, that is not tenable,

original: phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because they are mutually contradictory.

original: 'di dag gi bye brag ni shes par dka'o zhes bshad pa ma yin nam zhes bya ba la ;
analyzed: 'di dag gi bye brag ni shes par dka'o zhes bshad pa ma yin nam zhes bya ba la ;
translated: Isn't it explained that the distinctions of these are difficult to understand?

original: sdug bsngal bas shes pa ni shes par dka' ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal bas shes pa ni shes par dka' ba'o //
translated: It is said that understanding suffering is difficult to understand.

original: shes par dka' ba yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: shes par dka' ba yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Difficult to understand is explained in detail.

original: gang zhig reg pa dang tshor ba ji lta ba bzhin du sems kyi skad cig gcig la sems las byung ba'i chos gzhan dang mi 'gal ba de ni shes par dka' yang shes pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gang zhig reg pa dang tshor ba ji lta ba bzhin du sems kyi skad cig gcig la sems las byung ba'i chos gzhan dang mi 'gal ba de ni shes par dka' yang shes pa yin gyi /
translated: If something is not contradictory to another mental factor in a single moment of mind, like contact and feeling, then that is difficult to understand, but it is understood.

original: gang zhig rtsol ba dang / rtsol ba med pa phan tshun 'gal ba dag gcig la 'byung ba mi 'gal lo zhes bya ba 'di ni shin tu shes par dka' ste /
analyzed: gang zhig rtsol ba dang / rtsol ba med pa phan tshun 'gal ba dag gcig la 'byung ba mi 'gal lo zhes bya ba 'di ni shin tu shes par dka' ste /
translated: It is very difficult to understand that which is contradictory, such as exertion and nonexertion, is not contradictory when occurring in one mind.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dag ni sems gcig la 'byung bar ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dag ni sems gcig la 'byung bar ma mthong ngo //
translated: We have never seen pleasure and pain occurring in one mind.

original: rtsol ba yang gzhan du 'byung ba la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: rtsol ba yang gzhan du 'byung ba la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Exertion also occurs in relation to other objects.

original: chos gzhan nyid yin pa'i phyir rtsol ba nyid rtsol ba med pa ma yin la /
analyzed: chos gzhan nyid yin pa'i phyir rtsol ba nyid rtsol ba med pa ma yin la /
translated: Exertion itself is not nonexertion because they are different states.

original: de gnyis dngos po gcig la 'jug pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de gnyis dngos po gcig la 'jug pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor do those two occur in one entity.üîΩWhen one exerts oneself in relation to form, one does not exert oneself in relation to sound and so on.

original: gang gi tshe gzugs la rtsol ba de'i tshe sgra la sogs pa dag la rtsol ba mad pa yin pas 'di la 'gal ba ci yod ce na /üîΩ'o na ni nga zhes bya ba la sogs pa /
analyzed: gang gi tshe gzugs la rtsol ba de'i tshe sgra la sogs pa dag la rtsol ba mad pa yin pas 'di la 'gal ba ci yod ce na / 'o na ni nga zhes bya ba la sogs pa /
translated: What contradiction is there in this?

original: rtsol ba dang / rtsol ba med pa gnyis yul tha dad pa'i phyir mtshungs par ldan pa thams cad dmigs pa gcig par mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: rtsol ba dang / rtsol ba med pa gnyis yul tha dad pa'i phyir mtshungs par ldan pa thams cad dmigs pa gcig par mi 'gyur na /
translated: If you say that exertion and nonexertion are not concomitant because they have different objects, then all mental factors would not have the same focal object.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa rnams dmigs pa tha mi dad pa nyid du 'dod pa yang yin te /
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa rnams dmigs pa tha mi dad pa nyid du 'dod pa yang yin te /
translated: and they are also considered to be associated because they have the same object.

original: dmigs pa mtshungs pa nyid kyis mtshungs par ldan pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa mtshungs pa nyid kyis mtshungs par ldan pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are accepted as being associated by having the same object.

original: 'di las 'di lta bu'i rigs zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di las 'di lta bu'i rigs zhes bya ba la /
translated: In this regard, it is said that they are of the same type.

original: dper na rtog pa dang / dpyod pa gnyis bzhin du 'gal yang mi 'gal ba'i rigs te /
analyzed: dper na rtog pa dang / dpyod pa gnyis bzhin du 'gal yang mi 'gal ba'i rigs te /
translated: For example, like investigation and analysis, they are of the same type, even though they are contradictory.

original: rtsing ba dang zhib pa dag phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsing ba dang zhib pa dag phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because coarseness and subtlety are mutually contradictory.

original: mi 'gal ba ni sems gcig la 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'gal ba ni sems gcig la 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not contradictory because they occur in a single mind.

original: de'i tshul gang yin pa de ni 'di la yang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i tshul gang yin pa de ni 'di la yang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The way that is so is that they are of the same type.

original: rnam grangs kyis gnas so zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs kyis gnas so zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
translated: It is thought that they exist in the same continuum.

original: @139a * // ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa ni 'og nas 'chad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /üîΩma gus ngo tsha med khrel med //
analyzed: @139a * // ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa ni 'og nas 'chad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni / ma gus ngo tsha med khrel med //
translated: Shame and embarrassment will be explained later.üîΩShamelessness and lack of embarrassment are disrespect.

original: kha na ma tho 'jigs mi lta //
analyzed: kha na ma tho 'jigs mi lta //
translated: They do not fear wrongdoing.

original: zhes bya ba der te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba der te /
translated: This is said in the verse:üîΩShamelessness and lack of embarrassment are disrespect.

original: bzlog pa ni ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bzlog pa ni ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Shame and embarrassment should be understood as their opposites.

original: rtsa ba gnyis ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: rtsa ba gnyis ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: The two roots are nonattachment and nonhatred.

original: de la ma chags pa ni rnyed pa dang / ma rnyed pa'i yul la lhag par zhen pa dang / don du gnyer ba dang 'gal zhing mngon par ma zhen pa'o //
analyzed: de la ma chags pa ni rnyed pa dang / ma rnyed pa'i yul la lhag par zhen pa dang / don du gnyer ba dang 'gal zhing mngon par ma zhen pa'o //
translated: Nonattachment is the absence of attachment to objects that are acquired or not acquired, and the absence of desire for them.

original: zhe sdang med pa ni sems can rnams la gnod sems med cing /
analyzed: zhe sdang med pa ni sems can rnams la gnod sems med cing /
translated: Nonhatred is the absence of malice toward sentient beings.

original: rjes su brtse ba'i sa bon du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su brtse ba'i sa bon du gyur pa'o //
translated: It is the seed of compassion.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams phan tshun med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir dge ba'i sems thams cad la mtshungs par 'byung yang gti mug med pa ma bstan pas /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams phan tshun med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir dge ba'i sems thams cad la mtshungs par 'byung yang gti mug med pa ma bstan pas /
translated: Nondelusion is not taught in the explanation of the great ground of virtue because it occurs equally in all virtuous minds, since roots of virtue are mutually nondeprived.

original: dge ba'i sa mang po pa'i bshad pa ma tshang ba yin no snyam du dogs pa spangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dge ba'i sa mang po pa'i bshad pa ma tshang ba yin no snyam du dogs pa spangs pa'i phyir /
translated: To dispel the doubt that the explanation of the great ground of virtue is incomplete,

original: gti mug med pa yang yod mod kyi zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: gti mug med pa yang yod mod kyi zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: it says, nondelusion also exists.

original: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: This is taught as follows.

original: gang dag dge ba'i sems gzhan la yang 'byung bas dge ba'i sa mang po pa yin te /
analyzed: gang dag dge ba'i sems gzhan la yang 'byung bas dge ba'i sa mang po pa yin te /
translated: They are called universal because they occur in other virtuous minds.

original: de na sems gzhan la yang 'byung bas dge ba'i sa mang po ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de na sems gzhan la yang 'byung bas dge ba'i sa mang po ba ma yin te /
translated: They are not called universal because they occur in other minds.

original: 'dun pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dun pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: They are like aspiration, etc.

original: de'i phyir dge ba'i sa mang po pa'i bshad pa la ma tshang ba nyid med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir dge ba'i sa mang po pa'i bshad pa la ma tshang ba nyid med do //
translated: Therefore, the explanation of the universal mental factors is not incomplete.

original: rnam par mi 'tshe ba ni zhes bya ba rnam par tho mi 'tshams pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi 'tshe ba ni zhes bya ba rnam par tho mi 'tshams pa ste /
translated: Nonviolence is the opposite of violence.

original: sems can gzhan la gnod par dga' ba dang 'gal ba sems bzang po nyid ni rnam par mi 'tshe ba'o //
analyzed: sems can gzhan la gnod par dga' ba dang 'gal ba sems bzang po nyid ni rnam par mi 'tshe ba'o //
translated: It is a good mental disposition that is the opposite of delighting in harming others.

original: brtson 'grus ni sems mngon par spro ba'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni sems mngon par spro ba'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Vigor is the complete exertion of the mind.

original: yon tan dang skyon skyes zin pa kun du bsrungs ba dang / spangs pa dang / ma skyes pa bskyed pa dang / mi bskyed par bya ba'i phyir sems la le lo med pa ni mngon par spro ba ste /
analyzed: yon tan dang skyon skyes zin pa kun du bsrungs ba dang / spangs pa dang / ma skyes pa bskyed pa dang / mi bskyed par bya ba'i phyir sems la le lo med pa ni mngon par spro ba ste /
translated: It is the complete exertion of the mind in order to protect the virtues that have arisen, abandon the faults that have arisen, generate the virtues that have not yet arisen, and prevent the faults that have not yet arisen from arising.
